analyzed: skyes bu snang ba nas mun par zhugs pa bzhin no // de dag phan tshun phan 'dogs par nus pa yang gnas skabs gang zhig mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i gnas skabs de nyid yin par brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is like a person who goes from light into darkness.üîΩAlso, they are able to mutually assist each other, but it must be determined in what state they are able to generate eye consciousness.

original: gnas skabs gzhan dang ldan pa rnams la ni dngos su skyed par nus pa'i rgyu nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan dang ldan pa rnams la ni dngos su skyed par nus pa'i rgyu nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because in other states, they are seen to be causes that are not able to directly generate eye consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rung ba'i yul na gnas ba nus pa sad pa'i rgyu de dag ni sngar mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin du zin kyang /üîΩphyis skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rung ba'i yul na gnas ba nus pa sad pa'i rgyu de dag ni sngar mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin du zin kyang / phyis skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, even though the causes of the activation of the potential do not produce eye consciousness previously, they do produce it later.

original: de la nus pa sad pa'i rgyu gzhan ni brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nus pa sad pa'i rgyu gzhan ni brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible to imagine any other cause for the activation of the potential.

original: de'i phyir rung ba'i yul na 'dug pa de nyid nus pa sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rung ba'i yul na 'dug pa de nyid nus pa sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere presence of the causes of the activation of the potential in the appropriate place is the cause of the activation of the potential.

original: shin tu ring ba na 'dug pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pas phan tshun phan 'dogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu ring ba na 'dug pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pas phan tshun phan 'dogs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is very distant is not mutually helpful through the relation of cause and effect, because it does not have the property of forward and reverse pervasion.

original: ji skad du yul bar chod pa de dag ni lhan cig byed par mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du yul bar chod pa de dag ni lhan cig byed par mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: As will be explained, ‚ÄúThose that are obstructed in their place are not suitable as co-operating causes.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe don nye ba nyid dam snang ba nas 'ongs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa legs par byas pa dran pa skyed pa la nye bar sbyor ba de'i tshe nye bar tshogs pa'i rkyen de dag nyid dam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don nye ba nyid dam snang ba nas 'ongs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa legs par byas pa dran pa skyed pa la nye bar sbyor ba de'i tshe nye bar tshogs pa'i rkyen de dag nyid dam /
translated: When the object is near, or when the sense faculty such as the eye is functioning well, then memory is generated.üîΩWhen the conditions for the arising of consciousness are complete, or when the object is in the shade, then the eye faculty and so on are the causes that generate consciousness.

original: grib ma'i nang du zhugs pa mig la sogs pas dran pas bar du chod pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu nye bar gyur ba'i don bskyed pa de dag gis mi 'dra ba skyed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grib ma'i nang du zhugs pa mig la sogs pas dran pas bar du chod pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu nye bar gyur ba'i don bskyed pa de dag gis mi 'dra ba skyed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that they should generate a different result.

original: gang gis na de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu dag gis ni shes pa skyed par rung ba skyed par byed la /üîΩrang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu @52a * //
analyzed: gang gis na de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu dag gis ni shes pa skyed par rung ba skyed par byed la / rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa'i rgyu @52a * //
translated: The causes that are of the same nature as the consciousness generate consciousness,üîΩbut the causes that are of a different nature from the consciousness do not generate consciousness.

original: dag gis ni dran pa skyed par rtog pa rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa'i don ni shes pa skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dag gis ni dran pa skyed par rtog pa rang bzhin gzhan du gyur pa'i don ni shes pa skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see any object that is of a different nature from consciousness generating consciousness.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rtags rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rtags rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the sign generates the inferential cognition,

original: dran pas bar du chod ba can gyi don dbang po'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba la dngos su nye bar mi sbyor bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dran pas bar du chod ba can gyi don dbang po'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba la dngos su nye bar mi sbyor bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: in the same way, memory would not directly engage in generating the object of a sense consciousness that is interrupted by memory.

original: de las kyang nye bar tshogs pa'i skad cig ma thams cad 'tshogs pa'i rgyu nyid dam grib mar zhugs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag las dran pa'i 'du byed sad pa'am /
analyzed: de las kyang nye bar tshogs pa'i skad cig ma thams cad 'tshogs pa'i rgyu nyid dam grib mar zhugs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag las dran pa'i 'du byed sad pa'am /
translated: Moreover, all the moments of the assembly would be the cause of the arising of the sense consciousness, and the sense faculty that has entered the shade would be activated by the formation of memory,

original: shes pa bskyed par bya ba la mtshungs par nus pa'am mi nus par 'gyur ba de'i phyir nus pa khyad par med pas rang bzhin dang rgyu 'dra ba can gyi skad cig ma rnams la gcig dngos su nus par khas blangs na thams cad kyang thal bar 'gyur
analyzed: shes pa bskyed par bya ba la mtshungs par nus pa'am mi nus par 'gyur ba de'i phyir nus pa khyad par med pas rang bzhin dang rgyu 'dra ba can gyi skad cig ma rnams la gcig dngos su nus par khas blangs na thams cad kyang thal bar 'gyur
translated: or it would be equally able or unable to generate consciousness. Therefore, since there is no difference in their potency, if you accept that one moment is able to generate consciousness, then all would be able to do so.

original: ba'am / gcig dngos su nus pa med par khas blangs na yang thams cad skyed bar byed pa ma yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'am / gcig dngos su nus pa med par khas blangs na yang thams cad skyed bar byed pa ma yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one admits that one is not able to produce, one would have to admit that all are not producers.

original: de lta na yang skad cig ma gcig dbang po'i shes pa gcig nyid la skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur la de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skad cig ma gcig dbang po'i shes pa gcig nyid la skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur la de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it would be mutually contradictory that one moment produces one sense consciousness and that it does not produce another, and that is illogical.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni /üîΩgcig nyid ces bya ba yin no //üîΩtha dad par gyur pa rnams ni gcig la byed pa dang byed pa ma yin pa mi 'gal bas gcig nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni / gcig nyid ces bya ba yin no // tha dad par gyur pa rnams ni gcig la byed pa dang byed pa ma yin pa mi 'gal bas gcig nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: That is explained:üîΩIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.üîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa rnams la mi 'gal bas gcig la zhes smos so //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams la mi 'gal bas gcig la zhes smos so //
translated: If they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are different, it is illogical that one is and is not a producer.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma re re la yang sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: If they are different, it is not contradictory that one is a producer and one is not a producer, so it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are

original: rigs pa ma yin ba de'i phyir gang zhig dran pas bar du chod pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin ba de'i phyir gang zhig dran pas bar du chod pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Because that is illogical, then, since there is no difference between that which is not produced by the prior memory and that which is not produced by the subsequent memory, all are not produced.

original: gal te skad cig ma snga ma nyid kyis dran pa sad par byas pa'i phyir de la gnyis pa la sogs pa ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma snga ma nyid kyis dran pa sad par byas pa'i phyir de la gnyis pa la sogs pa ci dgos she na /
translated: If the prior moment awakens the memory, what need is there for a second moment and so on?

original: smras pa / rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyud dag gis dbang po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i dran pa sad par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni rang gi rgyud dag gis dbang po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i dran pa sad par byed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin la /
translated: We say: The nature of the object that is suitable to be the object of memory is the nature of the object that awakens the memory that produces the sense consciousness through its own continuum.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa yang nye bar tshogs pa'i rten du gyur pa rang gi rgyu ngag gis de 'dra ba'i ngo bor bskyed pa des na skad cig so sor dran pa sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi dgos pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa yang nye bar tshogs pa'i rten du gyur pa rang gi rgyu ngag gis de 'dra ba'i ngo bor bskyed pa des na skad cig so sor dran pa sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi dgos pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The second moment and so on are the support of the collection of conditions that are produced by their own cause in that way. Therefore they are the cause of the awakening of memory in each moment, but not by necessity.

original: @52b de dag ni rtag par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @52b de dag ni rtag par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not permanent,

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: but they are by nature related to their causes.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po dang yid la byed pa tshogs par 'gyur ba'i don nyid dran pa skyed par nus pa dang / mi nus par 'gyur ba don gang gi rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig gis gang du nus par mthong ba'i rang bzhin de nyid de la nus pa med par ni 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po dang yid la byed pa tshogs par 'gyur ba'i don nyid dran pa skyed par nus pa dang / mi nus par 'gyur ba don gang gi rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig gis gang du nus par mthong ba'i rang bzhin de nyid de la nus pa med par ni 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the object itself, which is capable of producing memory when the sense faculty and attention are assembled, and which is incapable of producing memory when they are not assembled, is seen to be capable of producing memory when it has a certain nature, it is not reasonable that it be incapable of producing memory when it has that same nature.

original: dran pa la ltos pa'i skad cig phyi ma rnams dran pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa la ltos pa'i skad cig phyi ma rnams dran pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the subsequent moments, which depend on memory, do not produce memory,

original: gang gi phyir dran pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa de ni skad cig ma snga ma dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa de ni skad cig ma snga ma dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: because the assemblage of causes that is different from memory is the same as the prior moment.

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis sad pa'i dran pa de nyid kyis de nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa sad pa'i nus pa nyams par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis sad pa'i dran pa de nyid kyis de nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa sad pa'i nus pa nyams par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The memory that is aroused by the nature of the object that is present in a suitable place does not diminish the potency of the memory that is of the same nature as itself.

original: du bas me'i rang bzhin bskyed ba'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: du bas me'i rang bzhin bskyed ba'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the potency that produces the nature of fire from smoke.

original: de'i phyir rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams dran pa skyed pa'i nus pa khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos su skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams dran pa skyed pa'i nus pa khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos su skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference in the potency that produces memory in those present in a suitable place, it is not the direct producer.

original: gtan tshigs des na don med na yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na don med na yang 'gyur ro //
translated: By that reason, it is also the case that the object does not exist.

original: yang gi sgras ni res 'ga' yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni res 'ga' yod kyang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that sometimes it exists.

original: thams cad du ni mig gi blo de'i nus pa la mi ltos par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du ni mig gi blo de'i nus pa la mi ltos par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In all cases, the eye consciousness arises without depending on the potency of that eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa don med kyang skye ba la gtan tshigs snga ma mjug sdud de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa don med kyang skye ba la gtan tshigs snga ma mjug sdud de /
translated: The previous reason is summarized in the statement that the eye consciousness arises without an object.

original: don dbang po la brten pa'i blo la dngos su mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ni dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu dran pa sad pa las nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dbang po la brten pa'i blo la dngos su mi sbyor ba'i phyir dang rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ni dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu dran pa sad pa las nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not directly engage the mind that is based on the sense faculty, and because the object that is a suitable object is engaged by the arousing of the memory that is the cause of the sense consciousness.

original: 'di snyam du dran pa sad par bya ba'i don du don la ltos par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dran pa sad par bya ba'i don du don la ltos par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: In this regard, isn‚Äôt the object relied on in order to arouse memory?

original: des na don med kyang zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na don med kyang zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said, ‚ÄúEven though the object does not exist‚Äù?

original: dran pa sad par byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dran pa sad par byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause it is engaged in arousing memory.‚Äù

original: nye bar sbyor ba gzhan med pa'i phyir sngar nyid du dran pa sad par byas nas log par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba gzhan med pa'i phyir sngar nyid du dran pa sad par byas nas log par gyur pa yin la /
translated: Because there is no other engagement, memory is aroused and then ceases.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni phyi nang rim gyis dran pa'i rgyun gyis skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni phyi nang rim gyis dran pa'i rgyun gyis skyed pa yin no //
translated: The sense consciousness is generated by the continuum of memory that arises internally and externally.

original: dran pa sad pa'i dus na yang don gzhan la chags pas dbang po'i shes pa gags byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa sad pa'i dus na yang don gzhan la chags pas dbang po'i shes pa gags byas pa yin te /
translated: Even when memory is aroused, the sense consciousness is obstructed by attachment to another object.

original: des na phan pa med pa nyid kyis don de yod pa la blo mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na phan pa med pa nyid kyis don de yod pa la blo mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since it is useless, the cognition does not depend on the existence of the object.

original: ci ste yang don gyi nye bar sbyor bas dbang po'i blo bskyed par byas pa yin na ni des na rjod pa dran pas bar chad de gegs byas pa'am /üîΩrjod @53a * //
analyzed: ci ste yang don gyi nye bar sbyor bas dbang po'i blo bskyed par byas pa yin na ni des na rjod pa dran pas bar chad de gegs byas pa'am / rjod @53a * //
translated: But if the cognition of the sense faculty is produced by the application of the object, then the memory of the expression would be an obstacle to that, or

original: pa dran pa nyid bar du gcod pa'i gegs yin te de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dran pa nyid bar du gcod pa'i gegs yin te de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the memory of the expression itself would be an obstacle.

original: 'di skad brjod bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would be like this:

original: mngon par brjod par dran pa med na ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don tsam las dbang po'i shes pa skyes ba des na de tsam zhig snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par brjod par dran pa med na ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don tsam las dbang po'i shes pa skyes ba des na de tsam zhig snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: If there were no memory of the expression, then the sense cognition would arise from just the object in the proper place, and because of that, just that would appear, so there would be no conceptualization.

original: 'di la ltos pa nyid la ni dngos su skyed pas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ltos pa nyid la ni dngos su skyed pas khyab pa yin te /
translated: In this case, it is pervaded by direct production,

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas 'das pa la yang byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas 'das pa la yang byed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that even in the past, it is produced by a series.

original: gang gi phyir ltos pa ni de yod na yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltos pa ni de yod na yod pa yin la /
translated: Because dependence exists when that exists,üîΩand

original: dngos su skyed pa ma yin pa la yang de yod na yod pa nyid med pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pas khyab bar bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub bo //
analyzed: dngos su skyed pa ma yin pa la yang de yod na yod pa nyid med pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pas khyab bar bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub bo //
translated: And if it exists, then it exists even though it is not actually produced. Thus, the existence of the pervasion is established by the observation of the contradiction between the two natures.

original: des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that the non-observation of the pervader is a means of valid knowledge.

original: dngos su skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyang rung pa'i yul na gnas pa dran pas bar du chod pas shes pa skyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / de lta bur gyur pa la de'i rang bzhin dang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyang rung pa'i yul na gnas pa dran pas bar du chod pas shes pa skyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / de lta bur gyur pa la de'i rang bzhin dang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it is not actually produced, it is the nature of the cognition that produces it, because it is present in a suitable place and is obstructed by memory, and because it is contradictory for something to be and not be of that nature.

original: des na dran pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na don las skye bar mi 'thad la /
analyzed: des na dran pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na don las skye bar mi 'thad la /
translated: Therefore, if it depends on memory, it is not tenable that it is produced from the object.

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don gyis skyed pa yin na ni rjod pa'i spyi dran pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don gyis skyed pa yin na ni rjod pa'i spyi dran pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: But if it is produced by the object present in a suitable place, then it is not conceptual, because the memory of the universal of the expression does not depend on memory.

original: de ltar ming sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar ming sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa bsal nas /
translated: Having thus eliminated the conception of identity in terms of name,

original: don sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa bsal ba'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: don sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtog pa bsal ba'i don du bshad pa /
translated: in order to eliminate the conception of identity in terms of object, he says:

original: khyad par ni phal pa ste gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni phal pa ste gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The distinction is the ordinary, which is the benefit for others.

original: khyad par can ni gtso bo ste phan gdags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ni gtso bo ste phan gdags par bya ba'o //
translated: The distinguished is the principal, which is the one to be benefited.

original: 'brel pa ni khyad par dang khyad par can de dag gi ste rva dang rva can dang / rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa dag 'du ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni khyad par dang khyad par can de dag gi ste rva dang rva can dang / rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa dag 'du ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The relation is between those two, the distinction and the distinguished, which have the characteristic of the combination of horn and horned, or of class and the one possessing the class,

original: dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can gyi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can gyi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: or the characteristic of the possession of stick and stick-possessor.

original: 'jig rten chos lugs ni 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten chos lugs ni 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag ste /
translated: The worldly convention is the worldly science,

original: 'ga' zhig gi khyad par ram khyad par can nyid du so sor nges pa'i sgra'i tha snyad kyi yul lo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi khyad par ram khyad par can nyid du so sor nges pa'i sgra'i tha snyad kyi yul lo //
translated: which is the object of verbal conventions that are individually ascertained as the distinction or the distinguished of something.

original: thal zin pa de thams cad sdom pa ni gcig tu byed pa ste /
analyzed: thal zin pa de thams cad sdom pa ni gcig tu byed pa ste /
translated: The summary of all that has been said is the single activity.

original: dag pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phan tshun 'brel par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phan tshun 'brel par byed pa'o //
translated: The purification of the apprehension of the distinction is the mutual connection.

original: de la khyad par la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos lugs kyi mthar thug pa de dag so sor bzung nas /
analyzed: de la khyad par la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos lugs kyi mthar thug pa de dag so sor bzung nas /
translated: Having thus apprehended the distinctions, etc., which are the ultimate of worldly conventions,

original: so sor gzung ba de dag kyang so sor @53b 'dzin pa la ltos nas bsre bar byas nas de ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: so sor gzung ba de dag kyang so sor @53b 'dzin pa la ltos nas bsre bar byas nas de ltar rtogs te /
translated: one should mix the individual apprehensions, depending on the individual apprehensions, and thus understand them.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should understand the distinction and the distinguished.

original: sngar brjod pa'i rim pa med par ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i rim pa med par ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is not without the order previously stated.

original: gzhan du ming zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ming zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is stated elsewhere.

original: tshig le'ur byas ba'i don nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas ba'i don nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the verses is explained in the commentary.

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dang de dag gi 'brel pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa ste khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rnam pa gzhag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dang de dag gi 'brel pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa ste khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rnam pa gzhag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The distinction, the distinguished, their connection, and the worldly establishment, i.e., the establishment of the nature of the distinction and the distinguished is the worldly establishment.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po sgra las byung pa ni 'jig rten nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po sgra las byung pa ni 'jig rten nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: The relation of qualifier and qualified, which is based on sound, is to be understood from the world itself, not from the thing.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni 'ga' zhig gi khyad par dang / phan par byed pa dang legs par byed pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ni 'ga' zhig gi khyad par dang / phan par byed pa dang legs par byed pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of a thing does not exist as a qualifier or as a beneficiary or as a benefactor.

original: legs par bya ba dang legs par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las yin la /
analyzed: legs par bya ba dang legs par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po las yin la /
translated: The relation of benefactor and beneficiary is based on the relation of cause and effect of what is well done and what does it.

original: de yang snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa dag nyid yin pas de dag dus gcig tu yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa dag nyid yin pas de dag dus gcig tu yod pa ma yin la /
translated: And that is only in the prior and subsequent moments, so they do not exist at the same time.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo yang yod pa dag yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo yang yod pa dag yin no //
translated: The nature of qualifier and qualified also exists.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni dus gcig bdag nyid la yin gyi rim pa dang ldan pa dag la ni ma yin la cig car ba'i dngos po dag la yang phan par byed pa dang phan par bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni dus gcig bdag nyid la yin gyi rim pa dang ldan pa dag la ni ma yin la cig car ba'i dngos po dag la yang phan par byed pa dang phan par bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is in the same moment, not in the sequential, and the benefactor and beneficiary do not exist in simultaneous things.

original: 'brel pa las phan par grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa las phan par grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation is established as helpful,

original: 'brel pa can dag las 'brel pa tha mi dad na ni phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can dag las 'brel pa tha mi dad na ni phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: then if the relation is not different from the relata, it is not a cause of the related object and the helper.

original: 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the same as the nature of the relata.

original: tha dad pa na yang rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po gsum po rnams phan tshun du gtso bo dang phal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa na yang rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po gsum po rnams phan tshun du gtso bo dang phal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is different, then the three things that exist in their own nature do not have any mutual priority or posteriority.

original: de'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can du rtogs pa 'di ni sgra kho na'i byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can du rtogs pa 'di ni sgra kho na'i byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this understanding of something as qualified by something else is only the function of words.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the form of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i shes pa la sgra'i rnam pa bzlog pa nyid las sgras nye bar bzhag pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can bzlog pa yin yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas yang zlog par byed pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i shes pa la sgra'i rnam pa bzlog pa nyid las sgras nye bar bzhag pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can bzlog pa yin yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas yang zlog par byed pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: For this very reason, when the form of the word is eliminated in a sense perception, the qualified and the qualifier posited by the word are also eliminated, even though they are eliminated by a different form.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'di ltar khyad par yin la /üîΩ'di ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'di ltar khyad par yin la / 'di ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the distinction,üîΩand this is the distinction.

original: khyad par can ni 'di kho na yin la /
analyzed: khyad par can ni 'di kho na yin la /
translated: This is the only distinction,

original: khyad par yang 'di kho @54a * //
analyzed: khyad par yang 'di kho @54a * //
translated: and this is the only distinction.

original: na yin no zhes khyad par dang khyad par can gyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa dang nges pa la ni 'jig rten gyi rnam gzhag rjes su rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: na yin no zhes khyad par dang khyad par can gyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa dang nges pa la ni 'jig rten gyi rnam gzhag rjes su rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: The understanding and ascertainment of the nature of the distinguished and the distinguishing is to be understood as the establishment of the world.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu dbyug pa can yin gyi dbyug pa skyes bu can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu dbyug pa can yin gyi dbyug pa skyes bu can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: For example, the expression ‚Äúthe man with the stick‚Äù is used, but not ‚Äúthe stick with the man.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na nor dang bdag po'i dngos po ni dbyug pa khyad par du brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na nor dang bdag po'i dngos po ni dbyug pa khyad par du brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: In the world, the relation of owner to owned is not distinguished by the stick,

original: 'on kyang ldan bas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ldan bas yin no //
translated: but rather by possession.

original: de bzhin du rva ni 'du bas yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rva ni 'du bas yin te /
translated: In the same way, the horn is distinguished by the possessor of the horn,

original: rva sker btags pa ni rva can gyi sgra'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rva sker btags pa ni rva can gyi sgra'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the horn attached to the neck is not the distinguishing mark of the word ‚Äúhorned.‚Äù

original: 'di dag rtogs pa na khyad par can 'ga' zhig khyad par 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag rtogs pa na khyad par can 'ga' zhig khyad par 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: When these are understood, some particular is apprehended as a particular by virtue of some other particular.

original: khyad par la sogs pa de bsdams pa ni phan tshun bsres pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par la sogs pa de bsdams pa ni phan tshun bsres pa ste /
translated: The combination of these particulars, etc., is the mixing of them.

original: gcig gtso bor 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis gzung ba'i don thams cad bsres pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gtso bor 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis gzung ba'i don thams cad bsres pa'o //
translated: All objects of apprehension are mixed by the method of holding one as primary.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i gcig tu byed pa ni khyad par dang bral ba'i gnas skabs 'dzin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i gcig tu byed pa ni khyad par dang bral ba'i gnas skabs 'dzin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: This kind of unification is related to the apprehension of the state of being free from particulars.

original: dag pa'i rang bzhin sngar gzung ba med par ni khyad par dang ldan pa 'dzin pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dag pa'i rang bzhin sngar gzung ba med par ni khyad par dang ldan pa 'dzin pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: The pure nature is not apprehended as previously without particulars, and the apprehension of particulars is not seen.

original: des na dag pa'i gnas skabs nyid du gzung pa'i khyad par can dang khyad par dag khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin du gzung ba ste bzhi po dang bsdoms te gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: des na dag pa'i gnas skabs nyid du gzung pa'i khyad par can dang khyad par dag khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin du gzung ba ste bzhi po dang bsdoms te gcig tu byas nas /
translated: Therefore, the pure state itself is the apprehension of the particular as a particular, and the particulars are apprehended as having the nature of particulars. These four are combined and made one.

original: shes par nus ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: shes par nus ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The cognition that is able to cognize is the cognition that apprehends the specific nature.

original: ji srid du khyad par gyis nye bar ma bsgrubs pa'i rang bzhin shes pa med pa de srid du nye bar bsgrubs pa yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid du khyad par gyis nye bar ma bsgrubs pa'i rang bzhin shes pa med pa de srid du nye bar bsgrubs pa yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: As long as the cognition of the nature that is not specified is not present, the cognition of the specified nature will not be present either,

original: nye bar bsgrubs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni nye bar ma bsgrubs pa 'dzin pa'i lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni nye bar ma bsgrubs pa 'dzin pa'i lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the apprehension of the specified nature is the cooperative condition of the apprehension of the unspecified nature.

original: 'di ltar khyad par 'brel pa rtogs pa ni 'di ltar sbyin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par 'brel pa rtogs pa ni 'di ltar sbyin te /
translated: The cognition of the connection with the qualifier is as follows:

original: mthong ba'i lha sbyin gang yin pa de ni dbyug pa can yin la /üîΩgong bu gang yin pa de rva can yin no zhes khyad par dang bral ba gzung nas de'i 'og tu khyad par dang bcas pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lha sbyin gang yin pa de ni dbyug pa can yin la / gong bu gang yin pa de rva can yin no zhes khyad par dang bral ba gzung nas de'i 'og tu khyad par dang bcas pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Devadatta who is seen is the one who has a stick,‚ÄùüîΩand ‚ÄúThe Devadatta who is seen is the one who has horns.‚ÄùüîΩThus, the cognition of the connection with the qualifier is as follows:

original: des na bsdoms pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: des na bsdoms pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cognition of the connection with the qualifier is of two kinds:

original: khyad par dang bral bar mthong ba dang / khyad par dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gcig tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa dang gang yang bzhi po rnams la yang phan tshun phan par byed pa'i dngos por bsre ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par dang bral bar mthong ba dang / khyad par dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gcig tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa dang gang yang bzhi po rnams la yang phan tshun phan par byed pa'i dngos por bsre ba ste /
translated: The fourth is the mixing of the four into a single entity, the grasping of the particular and the general.

original: khyad par can du 'dzin pa 'di @54b nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can du 'dzin pa 'di @54b nyid yin no //
translated: This is the grasping of the particular.

original: de bsdoms pas zhes de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de bsdoms pas zhes de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third characteristic is the combination of those.

original: 'di skad du bsdoms pa rnam pa gnyis po de nyid khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du bsdoms pa rnam pa gnyis po de nyid khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is to say that the combination of those two kinds is the grasping of the particular.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa la bsdoms byas nas zhes bya ba smos pa ni dus snga mar bsdoms te rtogs pa la ltos nas tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba las blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa la bsdoms byas nas zhes bya ba smos pa ni dus snga mar bsdoms te rtogs pa la ltos nas tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba las blta bar bya ste /
translated: The compound ‚Äúhaving combined‚Äù in the verse means that the combination is prior to the grasping, and it should be understood that it is the object of the conventional.

original: bsdoms par gyur na ni khyad par can du rtogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsdoms par gyur na ni khyad par can du rtogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When there is a combination, there is the conventional of the grasping of the particular.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyang dbyug pa la sogs pa la grub pa yin no zhes dbyug pa can la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyang dbyug pa la sogs pa la grub pa yin no zhes dbyug pa can la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This very process is established in the case of a stick, etc., just as in the case of a stick-holder, etc.

original: gzhan du ni khyad par can du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni khyad par can du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be understood as a qualifier.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don de dag gi 'brel pa dang bshad ma thag pa'i rjod par byed pa'i rnam par gzhag pa de dag ma rtogs na ni khyad par can du rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don de dag gi 'brel pa dang bshad ma thag pa'i rjod par byed pa'i rnam par gzhag pa de dag ma rtogs na ni khyad par can du rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, if one does not understand the relation between the qualifier and the object qualified, and the aforementioned presentation of the expression, it is not reasonable to understand it as a qualifier.

original: rigs pa bstan na sad ni rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul ston par byed de /
analyzed: rigs pa bstan na sad ni rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul ston par byed de /
translated: Having taught the reasoning, he teaches the object with ‚ÄúThe object is the domain of the reasoning,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said:

original: don snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la brjod pa'i rnam pa med pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa la ming sbyor ba srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la brjod pa'i rnam pa med pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa la ming sbyor ba srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the consciousness that appears as an object lacks the aspect of expression, it is not possible to apply a name to a sense consciousness.

original: don rnams shes pa gcig la snang ba yin pa de lta na yang de dag la khyad par du 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ming bsre ba bzlog nas don bsre ba'i khyad par 'di nyid kyis logs shig tu gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: don rnams shes pa gcig la snang ba yin pa de lta na yang de dag la khyad par du 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ming bsre ba bzlog nas don bsre ba'i khyad par 'di nyid kyis logs shig tu gsal ba yin no //
translated: Although the objects appear to a single cognition, there is no apprehension of them as distinct. Having refuted the confusion of names, this very distinction of the confusion of objects is clarified separately.

original: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba de dag gang la yod pa'i rdzas la sogs pa de dag la ni 'di ltar 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba de dag gang la yod pa'i rdzas la sogs pa de dag la ni 'di ltar 'dzin pa med do //
translated: Substances and so on that possess those kinds, qualities, and actions are not apprehended in this way.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: bshad pa / rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa de dag mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa de dag mi snang ba ste /
translated: It is said: Those related to different natures do not appear.

original: rnam par shes ba'i bdag nyid la ma shar bas sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes ba'i bdag nyid la ma shar bas sbyor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not arise in the nature of consciousness, it is not tenable to connect them.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa bzung na ni sbyor bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad pa'i yul bstan pa'i phyir 'o ma dang chu bzhin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa bzung na ni sbyor bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad pa'i yul bstan pa'i phyir 'o ma dang chu bzhin no zhes brjod de /
translated: If those related to different natures are apprehended, they would be connected, but not otherwise. In order to teach the distinction of the object, it is said: Like milk and water.

original: 'brel pa dang tha dad pa snang ba med pa na sbyor ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang tha dad pa snang ba med pa na sbyor ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: When there is no appearance of a connection or difference, there is no application of the terms ‚Äúmilk‚Äù and ‚Äúwater.‚Äù

original: yang de dag la ci zhig tu mi snang zhen /
analyzed: yang de dag la ci zhig tu mi snang zhen /
translated: What is it that does not appear?

original: chu dang 'o ma de dag la rig pa ni 'o ma dang chu da dag gi 'brel pa dang rang bzhin tha dad pa rig pa gang yin pa de la bya ste /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma de dag la rig pa ni 'o ma dang chu da dag gi 'brel pa dang rang bzhin tha dad pa rig pa gang yin pa de la bya ste /
translated: The awareness of the connection and the difference of the milk and water is the awareness of the connection and the difference of the milk and water.

original: de de la rigs pa ma yin no//
analyzed: de de la rigs pa ma yin no//
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: @55a * // ji ltar tha dad pa dang 'brel pa mi snang ba'i phyir 'o ma dang chu rnam par rtog pas sbyor pa byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @55a * // ji ltar tha dad pa dang 'brel pa mi snang ba'i phyir 'o ma dang chu rnam par rtog pas sbyor pa byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as, because the difference and the connection do not appear, the imagination does not apply the terms ‚Äúmilk‚Äù and ‚Äúwater.‚Äù

original: gang gis gang dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa ma bzung ba des ni de dag sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gang dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa ma bzung ba des ni de dag sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: One who does not apprehend the difference of the natures of those two does not apply the terms ‚Äúmilk‚Äù and ‚Äúwater‚Äù to them.

original: dper na de mi shes pa'i chu dang 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de mi shes pa'i chu dang 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like water and milk that are not recognized as such.

original: rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa yang skyes bus gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa yang skyes bus gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: The difference of the natures of the universal and the possessor of the universal is not apprehended by a person.

original: rang bzhin 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rang bzhin gyi yul la sbyor ba la ni rang bzhin 'dzin pas khyab ba yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rang bzhin gyi yul la sbyor ba la ni rang bzhin 'dzin pas khyab ba yin la /
translated: In the case of application to a natural object that is preceded by the apprehension of nature, there is pervasion by the apprehension of nature.

original: khyad par byed pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa med pa'i phyir sbyor ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa med pa'i phyir sbyor ba yod pa yin no //
translated: But since there is no apprehension of nature as a different nature that is a different modifier, there is application.

original: de bzhin du 'brel pa la ltos ba'i sbyor ba la yang khyab pa grub par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brel pa la ltos ba'i sbyor ba la yang khyab pa grub par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in the case of application that depends on a relation, one should see that the pervasion is established.

original: 'o na ji ltar dbyig pa dang dbyig pa can dang / rva dang rva can lta bu shes pa gcig la snang ba sgra dang don bzhin du shes pa tha dad pa'i yul ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dbyig pa dang dbyig pa can dang / rva dang rva can lta bu shes pa gcig la snang ba sgra dang don bzhin du shes pa tha dad pa'i yul ma yin la /
translated: Well, then, how is it that, like a stick and its owner, or horns and their possessor, the object of a single cognition appears, like a word and its meaning, but is not the object of a different cognition?

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa yang rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i yul can gyi mngon sum gyi shes pa ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por snang bas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes dgos na /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa yang rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i yul can gyi mngon sum gyi shes pa ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por snang bas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes dgos na /
translated: If it is necessary to explain that the direct perceptual cognition that understands the relation of different natures or different relations has as its object a conceptual cognition that appears as the relation of qualifier and qualified,

original: bshad pa / yang gang la rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa dag rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / yang gang la rang bzhin tha dad pa dang 'brel pa dag rtogs pa ste /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Those in whom the understanding of the relationship between different natures

original: shes pa gcig la snang ba yod pa de dag la yang /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la snang ba yod pa de dag la yang /
translated: and the existence of appearances in a single cognition

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ni'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po 'dzin pa ni'o //
translated: exist, they also possess the apprehension of the relationship between the qualifier and the qualified.

original: brda ni sgra nges par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: brda ni sgra nges par sbyor ba ste /
translated: A convention is the application of a term.

original: skabs kyis 'dir khyad par dang khyad par can brjod pa'i yul can yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: skabs kyis 'dir khyad par dang khyad par can brjod pa'i yul can yin par gzung ngo //
translated: In this context, it is taken to be the object of expression of the relationship between the qualifier and the qualified.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos po rnams kyi khyad par dang khyad par can nyid dngos po rnams kyi khyad par dang khyad par nyid dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos po rnams kyi khyad par dang khyad par can nyid dngos po rnams kyi khyad par dang khyad par nyid dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: As explained earlier, the relationship between the qualifier and the qualified of things is not the nature of the relationship between the qualifier and the qualified of things.

original: 'on kyang sgras sbrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgras sbrul pa yin no //
translated: However, it is fabricated by terms.

original: des na khyad par dang khyad par can de dag gi rang gi ngo bo dang nges pa nyid shes par bya ba'i don du sgra'i tha snyad rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par dang khyad par can de dag gi rang gi ngo bo dang nges pa nyid shes par bya ba'i don du sgra'i tha snyad rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to understand the nature and ascertainment of those qualifiers and the qualified, one should understand the conventions of terms.

original: de'i phyir brda 'dzin pa dang de dran pa ni khyad par can 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brda 'dzin pa dang de dran pa ni khyad par can 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of the sign and the memory of it are the causes of the apprehension of the qualified.

original: brda 'dzin pa'i dus su sbyar ba'i khyad par dang khyad par can dran pa las khyad par can du 'dzin pa'i shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda 'dzin pa'i dus su sbyar ba'i khyad par dang khyad par can dran pa las khyad par can du 'dzin pa'i shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of apprehending the sign, the memory of the qualified and the qualification related at the time of the sign causes the cognition of the qualified.

original: de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes brda'i dus su mthong ba dang da ltar mthong ba gcig tu byed ba 'di ni sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes brda'i dus su mthong ba dang da ltar mthong ba gcig tu byed ba 'di ni sdud pa yin no //
translated: The unification of this is that is the recollection of the seeing at the time of the sign and the seeing at the present time.

original: brda'i dus su @55b mthong ba dang da ltar mthong ba gcig tu ma rtogs par ni brda'i dus su goms pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus su @55b mthong ba dang da ltar mthong ba gcig tu ma rtogs par ni brda'i dus su goms pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Without understanding the seeing at the time of the sign and the seeing at the present time as one, one does not understand the qualification and the qualified as related at the time of the sign.

original: des na tha snyad kyi tshe na dag pa'i dngos po mthong nas de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes brda'i mthong ba dang gcig tu byed pa ni khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tha snyad kyi tshe na dag pa'i dngos po mthong nas de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes brda'i mthong ba dang gcig tu byed pa ni khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, at the time of conventional usage, having seen the qualified thing, the unification of the seeing at the time of the sign and the seeing at the present time as one is the apprehension of the qualified.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: For this very reason, it was said:üîΩThe apprehension of the qualified is the unification of the seeing at the time of the sign and the seeing at the present time.

original: sdud pa'i bdag can te rang gi ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces byas te /
analyzed: sdud pa'i bdag can te rang gi ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces byas te /
translated: That which has the nature of a collector is called that.

original: de ste de 'dra bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ste de 'dra bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That is to say, it is a grasping of that kind.

original: mig ces bya ba 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúeye‚Äù is a mere example.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa la ni mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa la ni mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is impossible in a perceptual cognition.

original: 'di ltar khyad par dang khyad par can du dran pa'i shes pa brda'i mthong ba dang da ltar gyi mthong ba gcig tu byed pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ni khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par dang khyad par can du dran pa'i shes pa brda'i mthong ba dang da ltar gyi mthong ba gcig tu byed pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ni khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the cognition that remembers the qualifier and the qualified combines the seeing of the symbol and the present seeing into one, and that is the grasping of the qualified.

original: sngon mthong ba dang da ltar mthong tu 'dzin pa yod kyang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi brda ma dran na khyad par can du 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no//
analyzed: sngon mthong ba dang da ltar mthong tu 'dzin pa yod kyang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi brda ma dran na khyad par can du 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no//
translated: Even though there is the grasping of the prior seeing and the present seeing, if the symbol of the qualifier and the qualified is not remembered, there is no grasping of the qualified.

original: 'di ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa da ltar mthong ba la sngon mthong ba dang gcig tu byed kyang shing gi sgra ma dran na shing gi sbras khyad par can du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa da ltar mthong ba la sngon mthong ba dang gcig tu byed kyang shing gi sgra ma dran na shing gi sbras khyad par can du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although one makes the present perception of the tree, which is endowed with leaves, etc., identical with the former perception by saying ‚Äúthis is that,‚Äù if one does not recall the word ‚Äútree,‚Äù one does not apprehend the tree as a particular.

original: des na khyad par can la sogs pa'i brda dran pa'i rgyu nyid las bsdom ste khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par can la sogs pa'i brda dran pa'i rgyu nyid las bsdom ste khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one apprehends the tree as a particular on the basis of the memory of the name ‚Äútree,‚Äù etc.

original: de ltar bsdom pa yang gang zhig khyad par can du bzung ba'i de ma thag tu mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i yul dang / brda'i tshe mthong ba'i yul 'dzin par nus pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis byed par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsdom pa yang gang zhig khyad par can du bzung ba'i de ma thag tu mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i yul dang / brda'i tshe mthong ba'i yul 'dzin par nus pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis byed par nus pa yin no //
translated: And that memory is produced by the very same cognition that is able to apprehend the object that is devoid of the particular, which is seen immediately after the particular is apprehended, and the object that is seen at the time of the convention.

original: des na brda'i dus su goms pa khyad par can la sogs pa dran pa dang / sngar mthong ba'i yul dang gcig tu byed pa na khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na brda'i dus su goms pa khyad par can la sogs pa dran pa dang / sngar mthong ba'i yul dang gcig tu byed pa na khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one recalls a special experience at the time of the sign, and when one unifies the object seen previously, one grasps it as special, but not otherwise.

original: de ltar na sngar mthong ba dang da ltar mthong ba gcig tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar mthong ba dang da ltar mthong ba gcig tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one grasps as one what was seen previously and what is seen now.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba'o //
translated: What was seen previously is what was seen before.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi mthong ba'o //üîΩ'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba dang phyis mthong ba dag la ci de nyid 'di yin nam /
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi mthong ba'o // 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba dang phyis mthong ba dag la ci de nyid 'di yin nam /
translated: What is seen now is what is seen now.

original: 'on te gzhan zhes lhag par 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhes lhag par 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the grasping of what was seen previously and what is seen now as Is it just that? or Is it something else?

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni 'dis stong pa yin no //üîΩ'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig de gang gi phyir sngon dang phyi mar 'dzin pas stong pa de'i phyir 'di la sdom pa'i bdag @56a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni 'dis stong pa yin no // 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig de gang gi phyir sngon dang phyi mar 'dzin pas stong pa de'i phyir 'di la sdom pa'i bdag @56a * //
translated: The sense perception is empty of this.

original: nyid du 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid du 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the reason. Because it is empty of grasping what was seen before and what is seen later, therefore there is no grasping of it as having the nature of a unity.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di nyid kyi don rnam par 'grel pa na /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di nyid kyi don rnam par 'grel pa na /
translated: When commenting on the meaning of this very verse,

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba 'chad de /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgrub par bya ba 'chad de /
translated: he explains the probandum with ‚Äúhere‚Äù and so on.

original: snga ma khyad par dang bral ba 'dzin pa dang / brda'i dus kyi mthong ba nyid du phyi ma 'dzin pa dang / khyad par can la sogs pa'i brda dran ba ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma khyad par dang bral ba 'dzin pa dang / brda'i dus kyi mthong ba nyid du phyi ma 'dzin pa dang / khyad par can la sogs pa'i brda dran ba ni byed pa ste /
translated: The prior apprehension of the absence of difference, the subsequent apprehension of the mere seeing at the time of the convention, and the memory of the convention of the qualified and so on are the actions.

original: 'di rnams gcig med na yang khyad par can du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di dag gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams gcig med na yang khyad par can du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di dag gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable to apprehend the qualified when any of these is absent, they are undoubtedly the actions.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni bya ba 'di dag byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni bya ba 'di dag byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are not able to perform these actions.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says because they are devoid of analysis.

original: gang zhig snga phyir 'dzin pas stong ba de nyid ni dpyod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig snga phyir 'dzin pas stong ba de nyid ni dpyod pa med pa yin no //
translated: That which is devoid of the apprehension of prior and subsequent is devoid of analysis.

original: 'di ni khyad par bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i gtan tshigs te /
translated: This is the reason that teaches the probandum.

original: gang gi phyir dpyod pa dang bral ba de'i phyir 'di tsam gyi bya ba byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpyod pa dang bral ba de'i phyir 'di tsam gyi bya ba byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is devoid of analysis, therefore it does not perform the function of mere perception.

original: 'di ni sngar mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po dang da ltar mthong ba la de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dpyod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po dang da ltar mthong ba la de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dpyod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to analyze the object that was seen previously and the object that is seen now as being the same or different.

original: dpyod pa med pa nyid 'di la yang gtan tshigs yod pa yin no zhes bshad pa na /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa nyid 'di la yang gtan tshigs yod pa yin no zhes bshad pa na /
translated: When it is said that there is a reason for this absence of analysis,

original: nye ba rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i yul gyi stobs te /
analyzed: nye ba rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i yul gyi stobs te /
translated: it is the power of the object that is present in the proximity.

original: mthus bskyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir dpyod pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthus bskyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir dpyod pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is the cause that is generated by the power of the object, there is no analysis.

original: yul nye ba'i stobs kyis skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin kho na'i 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul nye ba'i stobs kyis skyes pa ni de'i rang bzhin kho na'i 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: What is generated by the power of the object in proximity is the apprehension of its nature alone.

original: gang de la yod pa ma yin ba brda'i dus su goms pas sgro btags pa khyad par dang khyad par can nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de la yod pa ma yin ba brda'i dus su goms pas sgro btags pa khyad par dang khyad par can nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the superimposition of a qualifier and a qualified, which is due to the imprints from the time of convention that do not exist in that object.

original: sngon mthong ba'i dngos po de yang sngon mthong ba'i shes pa'i yul la brjod la /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i dngos po de yang sngon mthong ba'i shes pa'i yul la brjod la /
translated: That object that was seen previously is described as the object of the consciousness that saw it previously.

original: de yang de ltar mthong ba la yod ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang de ltar mthong ba la yod ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, that which is seen in that way does not exist.

original: sngar gyi mthong ba log na de'i yul yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi mthong ba log na de'i yul yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the previous seeing is reversed, its object is also reversed.

original: des na gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be apprehended.

original: gang zhig sngar mthong ba nyid du dngos po dpyod par mi nus pa de ji ltar na khyad par la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i don gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa sgro btags par 'dzin par byed ;
analyzed: gang zhig sngar mthong ba nyid du dngos po dpyod par mi nus pa de ji ltar na khyad par la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i don gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa sgro btags par 'dzin par byed ;
translated: How can one who is unable to analyze an entity that is seen previously apprehend a superimposed object that is not the nature of an entity that produces distinctions, etc.?

original: de'i phyir khyad par la sogs pa btags par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can gyi dngos por rnam par rtog pa ni de la 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par la sogs pa btags par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can gyi dngos por rnam par rtog pa ni de la 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to conceive of a distinctive entity that has the nature of apprehending distinctions, etc., which are superimposed.

original: dpyod pa nyid du khas len na ni dbang po'i shes pa dang yid kyi shes pa nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid du khyad par med par thal bar @56b 'gyur te /
analyzed: dpyod pa nyid du khas len na ni dbang po'i shes pa dang yid kyi shes pa nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid du khyad par med par thal bar @56b 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that it is an analysis, then it follows, absurdly, that there is no difference between the apprehension of an object that is not present to a sensory consciousness and the apprehension of an object that is present to a mental consciousness.

original: sngar mthong ba dang phyis mthong ba dag shes pa gcig gis gzung ba ni nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba dang phyis mthong ba dag shes pa gcig gis gzung ba ni nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the object seen previously and the object seen later are apprehended by a single consciousness, because they are not distant objects.

original: des na gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa dbang pos byas pa yin yang tha dad pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa dbang pos byas pa yin yang tha dad pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, although the form is ascertained by the sense faculty, it is not different.

original: tha dad pa med par thal ba'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa dpyod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par thal ba'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa dpyod pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because it follows that it is not different, the sense consciousness is non-analytical.

original: nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin par khyad par med na ni /üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin par khyad par med na ni / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: If there is no difference in apprehending a non-distant object,üîΩthen the distinction of past and future and the distinction of impermanent, suffering, and so on,

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo de dbang po'i shes pas kyang 'dzin pa dang / yid kyi shes pas kyang mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo de dbang po'i shes pas kyang 'dzin pa dang / yid kyi shes pas kyang mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: which are the reasons for the distinction of the different intrinsic natures, would be apprehended by the sense consciousness and also apprehended by the mental consciousness.

original: de dag dang dpog pa ste dbang po'i shes pas kyang gzhan du mi 'thad pa mthong ba las ma mthong ba rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag dang dpog pa ste dbang po'i shes pas kyang gzhan du mi 'thad pa mthong ba las ma mthong ba rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: And the sense consciousnesses that apprehend them are also not tenable as other.

original: mi dpog pa ste yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang de las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dpog pa ste yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang de las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mental consciousness that does not apprehend them is the opposite of that.

original: de dag dang don yod pa ni bdog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang don yod pa ni bdog pa'o //
translated: Those that exist with objects are possessed.

original: de la ltos pa ni de dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa ni de dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: That which depends on them is related to them.

original: yid kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa'o //
translated: That is mental consciousness.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi ltos pa ste dbang po'i shes pa'o //üîΩde dag dang zhes bzla bar dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi ltos pa ste dbang po'i shes pa'o // de dag dang zhes bzla bar dbye ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is not dependent, which is sense consciousness.üîΩThose and so on are the divisions of the words and so on.

original: de dag la sogs pa 'dod pa tsam la rag las ba la sogs pa de dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa 'dod pa tsam la rag las ba la sogs pa de dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that those who assert mere desire are dependent and so on.

original: 'di la shes pa'i chos 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin par shes par byed pa po nyid ni nye ba ma yin pa'i yul 'dzin pa tsam la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la shes pa'i chos 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin par shes par byed pa po nyid ni nye ba ma yin pa'i yul 'dzin pa tsam la rag las pa yin la /
translated: Here the consciousness that apprehends the phenomena of consciousness and so on is not the apprehender of a nearby object alone.

original: dpyod par byed pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa la yang nye ba ma yin pa'i yul can nyid yod pa de'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan tsam gyi chos su yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa la yang nye ba ma yin pa'i yul can nyid yod pa de'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan tsam gyi chos su yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it analyzes, the sense consciousnesses also have objects that are not present. Therefore, it follows that they would be phenomena that are mere reasons.

original: de la yod kyang dpog pa la sogs pa ma yin na ni yid kyi shes pa yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yod kyang dpog pa la sogs pa ma yin na ni yid kyi shes pa yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not inferred and so on even though it exists, then the mental consciousness would not exist.

original: de la yang yul nye ba ma yin pa nyid las 'das pa la sogs pa'i rgyu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu lhag pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang yul nye ba ma yin pa nyid las 'das pa la sogs pa'i rgyu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu lhag pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it also is not present to the object, it does not see any other cause of apprehending past and so on.

original: de bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa'i yul mi nye ba can yin yang gal te don yod pa la ltos pa yin na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa'i yul mi nye ba can yin yang gal te don yod pa la ltos pa yin na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, even though the object of a sense consciousness is not present, if it depends on an existent object, it follows that the mental consciousness would also be so.

original: dbang po'i shes pa de'i rnam par 'dzin pa nyid kyis don la ltos pa zhes bya bar gnas ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa de'i rnam par 'dzin pa nyid kyis don la ltos pa zhes bya bar gnas ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the sense consciousness is said to depend on the object because it apprehends the aspect of that.

original: ltos pa med pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on @57a * //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // 'on @57a * //
translated: because it apprehends the past, etc., without any regard for them.

original: kyang shes pa nyid las yin la de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kyang shes pa nyid las yin la de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is a difference in the mental consciousness.

original: yang na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yang ltos pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yang ltos pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the sensory consciousnesses would be without regard,

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: de bzhin du yul nye ba can ma yin pa nyid kyis 'dod pa tsam gyi 'jug pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul nye ba can ma yin pa nyid kyis 'dod pa tsam gyi 'jug pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the sensory consciousnesses would not engage their objects because they are not present, but this is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir nye ba ma yin pa 'dzin pa nyid btang na dpyod pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum rtog pa med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye ba ma yin pa 'dzin pa nyid btang na dpyod pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum rtog pa med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if you abandon the position that they apprehend what is not present, then, because there is no analysis, perception is established as nonconceptual.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon bar 'dus byas pa ste brda'i tshe goms pa'i khyad par can la sogs pas sbyar ba byas pa la dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin par byed pa des na dbang po'i shes pas 'das pa la sogs pa dran pa la sogs par
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon bar 'dus byas pa ste brda'i tshe goms pa'i khyad par can la sogs pas sbyar ba byas pa la dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin par byed pa des na dbang po'i shes pas 'das pa la sogs pa dran pa la sogs par
translated: The mental consciousness has directly produced the object, and the sense consciousness apprehends it through the special power of habituation to signs and so on. Therefore the sense consciousness does not remember the past and so on.

original: bya bar ma yin te /
analyzed: bya bar ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the sense consciousness itself remembers the past and so on,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mental consciousness that remembers the past and so on.

original: dbang po'i shes pa khyad par can du 'dzin pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar khas blangs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa khyad par can du 'dzin pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar khas blangs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The sense consciousness also apprehends the special object. This shows that the sense consciousness is accepted as apprehending the special object.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa zlog par byed do //üîΩgtan tshigs bshad pa ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pas na de ltar khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa zlog par byed do // gtan tshigs bshad pa ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pas na de ltar khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is not so. This rejects the opponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: yongs su gcod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense consciousness does not apprehend the special object, because it does not apprehend the special object as explained by the reason. Therefore it is not reasonable to understand the sense consciousness as special.üîΩIt is not reasonable to understand the sense consciousness as special because it is not reasonable to understand it as a fully apprehending consciousness.

original: 'di snyam du yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyis nye ba ma yin pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i khyad par can de la dbang po'i shes pas rtogs pa des na ji ltar rtogs par mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyis nye ba ma yin pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i khyad par can de la dbang po'i shes pas rtogs pa des na ji ltar rtogs par mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you think that the special object that is not near is perceived by the sense consciousness because it is made manifest by the mental consciousness, then how could it be perceived?

original: bshad pa yul ma yin pa khyad par can dang / sngar mthong ba la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa yul ma yin pa khyad par can dang / sngar mthong ba la mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a special nonobject and because it is not the cause of engaging what was previously seen.

original: gang gi phyir yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas bkod kyang dbang po'i shes pa 'jug pa ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas bkod kyang dbang po'i shes pa 'jug pa ma ma yin te /
