translated: Even though the mental consciousness establishes the special object, etc., the sense consciousness does not engage it because it is not an object.

original: nye ba ma yin pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas khyad par can du zin kyang nye ba ma yin pa nyid spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba ma yin pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas khyad par can du zin kyang nye ba ma yin pa nyid spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the mental consciousness makes the special object that is not near manifest, it is still not near and is not abandoned.

original: des na yul ma yin te /
analyzed: des na yul ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is not an object.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzhag pa'i sgra ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzhag pa'i sgra ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Sound that is established by auditory consciousness is not an object of visual consciousness.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir rigs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚Äúwith regard to the universals, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa zhes bya bas ni bya ba dang yon tan bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya bas ni bya ba dang yon tan bsdu ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes action and quality.

original: de'i 'brel pa dang 'das pa dang sgra'i tha snyad de khyad par @57b la sogs pa gang zhig sgras tha snyad du bya ba ni sgra'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa dang 'das pa dang sgra'i tha snyad de khyad par @57b la sogs pa gang zhig sgras tha snyad du bya ba ni sgra'i tha snyad do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúverbal conventions‚Äù refers to the relation, the past, and the verbal conventions.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni ma 'ongs pa dang dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni ma 'ongs pa dang dngos po'i rab tu dbye ba bsdu ste /
translated: The expression ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the future and the classification of entities.

original: de dag ni dbang po'i shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po'i shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the objects of the sense consciousnesses.

original: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar gzhag pa la yang 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pas don dang don gzhan du sbyor ba'i sbyor ba de nyid ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar gzhag pa la yang 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pas don dang don gzhan du sbyor ba'i sbyor ba de nyid ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the mental consciousness is not a sense consciousness, the apprehension of the object and the object different from it is not a sense consciousness.

original: der ma gtogs pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: der ma gtogs pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not included in that is not a sense consciousness.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis shes pa gcig la snang ba nyid la brten nas rigs la sogs pa sbyor ba'i rtogs pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis shes pa gcig la snang ba nyid la brten nas rigs la sogs pa sbyor ba'i rtogs pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, by two verses, he has cleared up the idea that the application of the caste system, etc. is based on the appearance in a single consciousness.

original: dbang po las skyes ba de na rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang ba ste bcug pa yin na'o //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes ba de na rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang ba ste bcug pa yin na'o //
translated: That which arises from the sense faculty is instigated by conceptualization, i.e., is caused by it.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni skyon sogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni skyon sogs par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means ‚Äúin addition.‚Äù

original: 'dod pas ldog dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod pas ldog dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni thal bar 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy desire, etc.,‚Äù shows the reductio.

original: thal ba gzhan yang ston par byed pa ni nye ba'i don te rung ba'i yul na gnas pa nyid la dbang po las skyes pa'i blo rgyu'i dngos por mi ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thal ba gzhan yang ston par byed pa ni nye ba'i don te rung ba'i yul na gnas pa nyid la dbang po las skyes pa'i blo rgyu'i dngos por mi ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ‚Äúnearer‚Äù object, i.e., the object that is present, would not depend on the sense faculty as a cause for the arising of the cognition.

original: tshig le'ur byas pas bstan pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba gnyis po nyid rim pa bzhin dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pas bstan pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba gnyis po nyid rim pa bzhin dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to explain the two reductios that are taught in the verse, he says:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa ba sogs pa'i don to /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa ba sogs pa'i don to /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means ‚Äúin addition.‚Äù

original: re zhig yul ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir yid kyi shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don la dbang po'i shes pa mi 'jug go zhes brjod zin pa yin la /
analyzed: re zhig yul ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir yid kyi shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don la dbang po'i shes pa mi 'jug go zhes brjod zin pa yin la /
translated: It has already been explained that the sense consciousness does not engage the object that is the object of mental consciousness because it does not engage any object for a while.

original: de 'dzin na yang 'dod pas ldog pa nyid dang don la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro zhes skyon bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin na yang 'dod pas ldog pa nyid dang don la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro zhes skyon bsags pa'o //
translated: If it did apprehend that, it would be impossible to stop it by desire and it would not depend on the object.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni dbang po las skyes pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni dbang po las skyes pa'i blo'o //
translated: This refers to the mind that arises from the sense faculties.

original: khyad par ni rnam par gcod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni rnam par gcod par byed pa ste /
translated: Distinction is that which excludes.

original: dbyig pa la sogs pa'i don rnam sgra'o //
analyzed: dbyig pa la sogs pa'i don rnam sgra'o //
translated: The object of a stick and so on is sound.

original: de la sogs pa khyad par can dang 'brel pa dang 'das pa dang sgra'i tha snyad dang de lta bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa gzhan gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: de la sogs pa khyad par can dang 'brel pa dang 'das pa dang sgra'i tha snyad dang de lta bu la sogs pa'i rtog pa gzhan gang yin pa dag go //
translated: That and so on are connected to distinctions and past sound terms and any other concepts such as that.

original: des kun nas bslang ba ni bcug ba ste bcug ba nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa'i yul dbyig pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba ni bcug ba ste bcug ba nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa'i yul dbyig pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: That which is motivated by that is the instigator, and the instigator is a conception that apprehends an object distinguished by the distinction of a stick and so on.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the apprehender of the object that is imagined.

original: gang gi phyir de rnam par brtags pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir des kun nas bslang ba yin no //üîΩyul la gtod @58a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnam par brtags pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir des kun nas bslang ba yin no // yul la gtod @58a * //
translated: Because it is the apprehender of the object that is imagined, therefore it is that which is motivated.üîΩThe conceptualization that directs the mind to the object is also the producer of the object.

original: bar byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de yang don gyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba yin gyi 'dir kun nas slong ba po skyed par byed pa po la ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bar byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de yang don gyis skyed par byed par 'gyur ba yin gyi 'dir kun nas slong ba po skyed par byed pa po la ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But here, the motivator is not the producer,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa med pa dang thun mong ba'i skyed par byed pa yin pa des na de la skyon med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa med pa dang thun mong ba'i skyed par byed pa yin pa des na de la skyon med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because conceptualization is the common producer of non-conceptual as well. Therefore, there is no fault in that.

original: yin na zhes bya ba ni rtog pas kun nas bslang ba gtan tshigs yin par ston pa ste /
analyzed: yin na zhes bya ba ni rtog pas kun nas bslang ba gtan tshigs yin par ston pa ste /
translated: If it is, means if it is the reason that is motivated by conceptualization.

original: de yin par gyur na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yin par gyur na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúif it is.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'jug par bstan pas rgyu tshang ba nyid du ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'jug par bstan pas rgyu tshang ba nyid du ston par byed pa'o //
translated: And the engagement means that it is taught that the continuity of engagement is complete.

original: de rgyu dang ldan pa yang 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de rgyu dang ldan pa yang 'dod pas ldog par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: and since it is accepted that it has a cause, it is reversed.

original: rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i tshogs pa tshang ba can gyi skyes bu gang yin pa de'i'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i tshogs pa tshang ba can gyi skyes bu gang yin pa de'i'o //
translated: It is the one who is complete in the assemblage that produces conceptual thought.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and it is engaged.

original: rgyu ma tshang na ni rang nyid ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid la 'dod bas ldog pa'i byed pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang na ni rang nyid ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid la 'dod bas ldog pa'i byed pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When the cause is incomplete, it is reversed by itself. Therefore, the activity of reversal is understood in the case of completeness of cause, not otherwise.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin na ji ltar ldog ce na /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin na ji ltar ldog ce na /
translated: If the cause is complete, how can it be reversed?

original: rgyu de nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause itself is incomplete.

original: yang ni phyi nas so //
analyzed: yang ni phyi nas so //
translated: Again means later.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i rnam rtog las gzhan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ji ltar 'dod pas ldog pa de bzhin du de yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i rnam rtog las gzhan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ji ltar 'dod pas ldog pa de bzhin du de yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Any conceptual thought that is other than the conceptual thought of a sense consciousness is reversed in the same way that it is accepted that it is reversed.

original: 'di ni chos gnyis kyi khyad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos gnyis kyi khyad par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches the difference between two dharmas.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid la ni 'dod pas ldog pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid la ni 'dod pas ldog pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: The reason is that the apprehension of a conceptually-constructed object is pervaded by the mere reversal of desire.

original: 'di ltar sgro btags pa'i don 'bad pas nye bar gzhag pa ni sgro 'dogs par 'dod pa log par 'gyur ba nyid la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgro btags pa'i don 'bad pas nye bar gzhag pa ni sgro 'dogs par 'dod pa log par 'gyur ba nyid la /
translated: Thus, the object of superimposition, which is established by effort, is the mere reversal of the desire to superimpose.

original: de ldog pa na de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ldog pa na de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: When that is reversed, the conceptual thought that has it as its object is also reversed.

original: des na 'dod pas ldog pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa tsam nyid yin pas de'i khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dod pas ldog pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa tsam nyid yin pas de'i khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason for the mere reversal of desire is the mere apprehension of a conceptually-constructed object, and that is the pervader.

original: gal te rnam par brtags pa 'dzin pa nyid yin yang 'dod pas ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur na ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos par 'gyur na rgyu mtshan gzhan ni rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gal te rnam par brtags pa 'dzin pa nyid yin yang 'dod pas ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur na ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos par 'gyur na rgyu mtshan gzhan ni rtogs pa med do //
translated: If the apprehension of a conceptually-constructed object were not to become the mere reversal of desire, then the reasoned would depend on another reason, but there is no other reason.

original: de'i phyir brtags pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir brtags pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of a conceptually-constructed object

original: 'dod pas ldog pa nyid kyi gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pas ldog pa nyid kyi gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: is the reason that does not depend on another for the mere reversal of desire.

original: gal te 'di yod na yang 'dod pas ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe @58b khyab par byed pa ltos pa med ba nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod pas ldog pa ni brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa'i khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di yod na yang 'dod pas ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe @58b khyab par byed pa ltos pa med ba nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod pas ldog pa ni brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa'i khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: If, even though this is present, the desire to stop it does not occur, then at that time, the pervader, independence, would be lost, and so the desire to stop it is the pervader that apprehends the object of imputation.

original: des na dbang po'i shes pa la khyab par bya ba brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid yod na /
analyzed: des na dbang po'i shes pa la khyab par bya ba brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid yod na /
translated: Therefore, if the object of the pervasion of the sense consciousness is present,

original: nges par khyad par byed pa'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par khyad par byed pa'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it must definitely possess the quality of being the pervader.

original: khyab par byed pa ldog na khyab par bya ba yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ldog na khyab par bya ba yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the pervader is stopped, the pervaded is also stopped.

original: thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du bshad pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: thal ba dang thal ba bzlog pa dag nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du bshad pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: The reductio and the reversal of the reductio are taught in order to show the meaning of the explanation. Conceptual consciousnesses are called ‚Äúinvestigating.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul dang mi mthun pa'i brtags pa las bzlog par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul dang mi mthun pa'i brtags pa las bzlog par nus pa yin no //
translated: They are able to stop the object of engagement that is the opposite of the investigation.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i rjes su byung ba sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig bzlog par nus pa ma yin la bum pa la sogs pa la gcig pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i kun rdzob kyi yul can gzhan yang yod pa ma
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i rjes su byung ba sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig bzlog par nus pa ma yin la bum pa la sogs pa la gcig pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i kun rdzob kyi yul can gzhan yang yod pa ma
translated: It is not possible to refute some of the conceptual thoughts that arise after the sense consciousnesses, such as the thought of blue, but there is no other conventional consciousness that conceives of a pot as being one.

original: yin nam ; de'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: yin nam ; de'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
translated: So how could the pervasion be established?

original: 'di nye bar bkod de rgyun du 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa rnams ni de ltar ni 'di brtag par mi bya'o zhes rang gi ngo bos bzlog par nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di nye bar bkod de rgyun du 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa rnams ni de ltar ni 'di brtag par mi bya'o zhes rang gi ngo bos bzlog par nus pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the doubt that is addressed. The conceptual thoughts that occur in a continuous stream should not be analyzed in this way. They can be refuted by their own nature.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes yul bkag pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin no zhes yul bkag pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But the object that is being analyzed does not exist, so it is not refuted by the negation of the object.

original: des na gcig la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa yang de srid kyi dus su 'dod pas bzlog par nus pa yin pa de'i phyir 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig la sogs pa kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa yang de srid kyi dus su 'dod pas bzlog par nus pa yin pa de'i phyir 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is accepted that conceptual thoughts of one and so on are also reversed at that time, error does not exist.

original: 'di snyam du dbang po'i shes pa yang 'dod pas mig 'dzums pa na ldog pa ni nges par 'dod pa nyid kyis ldog par 'gyur ba yin pas na 'dod pas ldog pa ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dbang po'i shes pa yang 'dod pas mig 'dzums pa na ldog pa ni nges par 'dod pa nyid kyis ldog par 'gyur ba yin pas na 'dod pas ldog pa ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSince the sense consciousness is also accepted, when the eye closes, it definitely ceases due to the desire to close it, so the reversal due to desire does not lead to an absurd consequence,‚Äù

original: dbang po'i blo ni ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe sense consciousness is not.‚Äù

original: don ni 'di yin te rgyu byed pa dang ldan pa nyid la 'dod pas rgyu'i nus pa nyams par byas pas 'bras bu ldog pa na byed pa nges par 'gyur ba yin na 'di la ni rgyu dbang po nyid 'dod pas 'jug pa dang ldog par byed pa
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te rgyu byed pa dang ldan pa nyid la 'dod pas rgyu'i nus pa nyams par byas pas 'bras bu ldog pa na byed pa nges par 'gyur ba yin na 'di la ni rgyu dbang po nyid 'dod pas 'jug pa dang ldog par byed pa
translated: The meaning is this: If the mere presence of a cause is accepted, when the effect ceases due to the potency of the cause being impaired, the agent is ascertained. Here, the cause is accepted as the sense faculty itself, which engages and ceases.

original: yin gyi rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the consciousness.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar mngon du gnas pa'i yul la dbang po 'jug pa na mthong bar mi 'dod kyang mthong ba yin no //üîΩde @59a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar mngon du gnas pa'i yul la dbang po 'jug pa na mthong bar mi 'dod kyang mthong ba yin no // de @59a * //
translated: Therefore, when the sense faculty engages the object that is present in this way, one sees even though one does not wish to see.

original: bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this is:

original: ba lang gi blo bzlog cing zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi blo bzlog cing zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven when the thought of a cow is averted.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni ba lang gi blo la 'dod pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni ba lang gi blo la 'dod pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that there is no desire for the thought of a cow.

original: rtar rnam par brtags kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gal ba'i rnam par rtog pa la 'dod pa bstan te /
analyzed: rtar rnam par brtags kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gal ba'i rnam par rtog pa la 'dod pa bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven when the thought of a horse is imagined‚Äù shows that there is desire for a contradictory thought.

original: des na ba lang gi blo la 'dod pa med cing 'gal bar 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgyun du 'jug kyang mig la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ba lang nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na ba lang gi blo la 'dod pa med cing 'gal bar 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgyun du 'jug kyang mig la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ba lang nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the thought of a cow is not desired and the thought of a contradictory object is engaged continuously, one sees the sign of the eye, etc., as a cow.

original: des na de'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bzlog cing zlog par byed la 'gal ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan nye bar byas kyang mi 'dod pa'i mthong ba bzlog par nus pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bzlog cing zlog par byed la 'gal ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan nye bar byas kyang mi 'dod pa'i mthong ba bzlog par nus pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though the thought of its object is averted and is being averted, and another contradictory thought is brought near, one is not able to avert the undesired seeing.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa 'dod pas mi ldog pas na brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa 'dod pas mi ldog pas na brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the sense consciousnesses are not averted by desire, it is established that they do not apprehend a conceptually imputed object.

original: thal ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i don du smras pa /
analyzed: thal ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i don du smras pa /
translated: To present the second absurd consequence, it is said:

original: don nye ba rung ba'i yul na gnas pa la rgyu'i dngos por mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: don nye ba rung ba'i yul na gnas pa la rgyu'i dngos por mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: It would not depend on the presence of an object that is suitable to appear.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi don nye ba la mi ltos pas ni brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa las 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi don nye ba la mi ltos pas ni brtags pa'i don 'dzin pa las 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Since conceptual consciousnesses do not depend on the presence of an object, they would apprehend a conceptually imputed object.

original: 'di ltar rnam par brtag pa'i dngos po de ni med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par brtag pa'i dngos po de ni med pa yin la /
translated: Because the object that is imagined does not exist,

original: de'i 'dzin pas na don nye ba la ltos pa nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'dzin pas na don nye ba la ltos pa nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the apprehension of that would be impaired in dependence on the presence of an object.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam par brtags pa 'dzin pa yin na ni des na nye ba ma yin pa 'dzin pas na de yang don nye ba la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam par brtags pa 'dzin pa yin na ni des na nye ba ma yin pa 'dzin pas na de yang don nye ba la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a sense consciousness also apprehended an imagined object, then since it would apprehend what is not present, it would also not depend on the presence of an object.

original: yul nye ba la ltos pa med pa nyid ni brtags pa'i don nye ba ma yin pa 'dzin pa tsam la ltos pa yin la de yang khyab par byed pa yin pa de bas na snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so
analyzed: yul nye ba la ltos pa med pa nyid ni brtags pa'i don nye ba ma yin pa 'dzin pa tsam la ltos pa yin la de yang khyab par byed pa yin pa de bas na snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so
translated: The fact that it does not depend on the presence of the object is dependent on the mere apprehension of the object that is not present. And that is the pervader. Therefore, the argument is of the same nature as the previous one.

original: // chos gnyis kyis khyab par bstan pa'i don du smras pa /
analyzed: // chos gnyis kyis khyab par bstan pa'i don du smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the two properties are pervaded, he says:

original: gang gi phyir ba lang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa ni ba lang la sogs pa'i don nye ba nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa ni ba lang la sogs pa'i don nye ba nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The conceptual thought that has the form ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on does not arise from the mere presence of the object, the cow and so on.

original: 'dis ni nye ba las gzhan du yang 'gyur ba ma yin pa de la ltos pa ma yin no zhes nges ba 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye ba las gzhan du yang 'gyur ba ma yin pa de la ltos pa ma yin no zhes nges ba 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: This refutes the assertion that it is not dependent on the presence of the object, but it is not dependent on anything else.

original: cig shos kyis ni 'di yang gzhan du min zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni 'di yang gzhan du min zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The other one says, ‚ÄúNor is it from another.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig ni don nye ba la mi ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig ni don nye ba la mi ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Some conceptual thoughts are not dependent on the presence of the object.

original: ji lta bu ma yin na /
analyzed: ji lta bu ma yin na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di nyid ces bya @59b bas 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya @59b bas 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word this is a remainder of the phrase this is the engagement.

original: 'di'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'di'i dngos po ste /
translated: This is the entity of that.

original: 'di'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don gyi dngos po ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don gyi dngos po ni 'di nyid do //
translated: The entity of the object that is expressed by the word that is this.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gsum pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of that kind of entity is the third.

original: 'di khyad par can gyi don snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni don nye ba la ltos pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di khyad par can gyi don snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni don nye ba la ltos pa yin no ;
translated: That conceptualization which is the appearance of the special object is dependent on the proximity of the object.

original: / ga las she na /
analyzed: / ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir 'di la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ba lang nye ba yin na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ba lang nye ba yin na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the conceptualization this is a cow is not dependent on the proximity of a cow.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the negative pervasion.

original: shugs kyis don yod na ni 'gyur ro zhes rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs te /
analyzed: shugs kyis don yod na ni 'gyur ro zhes rjes su 'gro ba 'phangs te /
translated: If the object exists, it is dependent. Thus the positive pervasion is implied.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa grub pa yin no //
translated: By the positive and negative pervasions, the dependence is established.

original: gal te de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Even if that is so, there are two kinds of conceptualization:

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa dang ltos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa dang ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: and that which is dependent and that which is independent.

original: de la mngon sum ltos pa med par thal ba ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de la mngon sum ltos pa med par thal ba ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Now, is not perception independent?

original: kho bo cag gi zhes smos te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi zhes smos te /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúOur perception,‚Äù etc.

original: bdag cag gi mngon sum yang 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag cag gi mngon sum yang 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Our perception is just this, and not anything else.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig don la mi ltos pa yin yang mngon sum la mi ltos par dogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig don la mi ltos pa yin yang mngon sum la mi ltos par dogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though some conceptual thought is not dependent on an object, it is not suspected of not being dependent on perception.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis yin yang 'di'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir mngon sum don nye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis yin yang 'di'i don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir mngon sum don nye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, although conceptual thought is of two kinds, it is shown that perception is dependent on the presence of the object, because it has an object.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid sbyar ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid sbyar ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to apply the definition of perception, he says,

original: nye ba yang de yin la don kyang yin pa de nges pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa dngos po ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba yang de yin la don kyang yin pa de nges pa'i mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa dngos po ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe presence of the object‚Äù is that which is present and is also the object. The nature which has that as its definition is a thing. Because of that,

original: gzhan dag gi don nye ba snang ba yin la bdag cag gi don nye ba nges pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi don nye ba snang ba yin la bdag cag gi don nye ba nges pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The appearance of the object is the proximity of the object for others, but the ascertainment of the object is the definition of direct perception for us.

original: gang gi phyir nges pa 'di ni dbang po'i byed pa yod na 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'di nyid mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa 'di ni dbang po'i byed pa yod na 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'di nyid mngon sum yin no //
translated: Since this ascertainment occurs when there is the activity of the sense faculty, therefore this is direct perception.

original: don nye ba la ltos pa nyid de ni 'di'i don gyi khyad par can gyi dngos por rnam par rtog pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don nye ba la ltos pa nyid de ni 'di'i don gyi khyad par can gyi dngos por rnam par rtog pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The dependence on the proximity of the object does not exist for the conception of the object as having a particular nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir 'di'i don du snang ba'i blo mig gi byed pa yod pa la mthong ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i byed pa med par nges pa las kyang 'gyur bar mthong ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir 'di'i don du snang ba'i blo mig gi byed pa yod pa la mthong ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i byed pa med par nges pa las kyang 'gyur bar mthong ste /
translated: It is said: Because the cognition that appears as the object, which is seeing when there is the activity of the eye, is seen to occur even from ascertainment without the activity of the sense faculty.

original: mig gi bya ba byed par yang 'di bum pa zhes mthong ba'i yul du rtog pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi bya ba byed par yang 'di bum pa zhes mthong ba'i yul du rtog pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Even when the eye is functioning, there is the conception of the object as a pot.

original: gal te dbang po'i byed pa yod dam med kyang @60a * //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i byed pa yod dam med kyang @60a * //
translated: Whether there is the activity of the sense faculty or not,

original: rung ste reg pa las 'di'i don du snang ba ni nye ba'i bum pa nyid la 'di bum pa'o zhes rtog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rung ste reg pa las 'di'i don du snang ba ni nye ba'i bum pa nyid la 'di bum pa'o zhes rtog pa ma yin nam /
translated: But it is not the case that the object that appears in the cognition of the pot is the pot itself.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di don nye ba la ltos pa med pa yin zhes brjod ce na /üîΩmed dang tha dad pa med pa'ang //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di don nye ba la ltos pa med pa yin zhes brjod ce na / med dang tha dad pa med pa'ang //
translated: Why is it said that this conceptual cognition does not depend on a nearby object?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because it is not different from the non-existent.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don gang zhig yod pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa de bskyed pa la don de med pa las tha dad pa med ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don gang zhig yod pa yin yang rnam par rtog pa de bskyed pa la don de med pa las tha dad pa med ba nyid yin no //
translated: The object that is to be conceptually cognized, even if it exists, is not different from the non-existent in the production of that conceptual cognition.

original: gang zhig gang bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa de ni de la ltos nas med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa de ni de la ltos nas med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which lacks the ability to produce something is said to be non-existent in relation to that.

original: gtan tshigs ci'i phyir med pa dang tha dad pa med ce na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ci'i phyir med pa dang tha dad pa med ce na /
translated: Why is it said that it is not different from the non-existent?

original: bshad pa / gzugs la sogs pa'i don de dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzugs la sogs pa'i don de dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is explained: That object, such as form, is not the domain of the sense faculties.

original: rang gi dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the domain of one's own sense faculties, this is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i yul gyi don ni byed pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po dang lhan cig tu rang gi shes ba skyed par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i yul gyi don ni byed pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po dang lhan cig tu rang gi shes ba skyed par byed pa yin na /
translated: Because the object of the sense faculty generates its own consciousness in dependence on the sense faculty that possesses activity.

original: spyod yul ma yin pa de la ni dbang po'i byed pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa de la ni dbang po'i byed pa med pa yin no //
translated: But that which is not the object of the sense faculty does not have the activity of the sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir rang gi yul can gyi shes pa ba skyed pa la med pa dang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi yul can gyi shes pa ba skyed pa la med pa dang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not different from that which does not generate its own object-possessing consciousness.

original: de'i tshe gzugs yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzugs yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: At that time, is form not existent?

original: de'i phyir med pa las tha dad pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa las tha dad pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, how could it be not different from that which is nonexistent?

original: dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response to this qualm, the root text states, ‚ÄúThat which is not the object of the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir don gang zhig dbang po'i yul ma yin pa de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa las tha dad ci yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gang zhig dbang po'i yul ma yin pa de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa las tha dad ci yod de /
translated: Because that which is not the object of the sense faculty, what difference is there between it and a rabbit‚Äôs horns, which are nonexistent?

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is not the slightest difference.

original: yul ma yin pa'i don de nyid kyi dbang po gang yin pa de shes par pha rol pos 'dod pa gang yin pa de skyed pa ste yul nyid du 'gyur ba la tha dad pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa'i don de nyid kyi dbang po gang yin pa de shes par pha rol pos 'dod pa gang yin pa de skyed pa ste yul nyid du 'gyur ba la tha dad pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculty that is the object of that nonobject is the one that the opponent asserts generates consciousness. There is not the slightest difference between that and an object.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin no //üîΩgal te yod pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa yin yang yul ma yin pas byed pa med pa'i phyir dbang po'i de'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba la ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin no // gal te yod pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa yin yang yul ma yin pas byed pa med pa'i phyir dbang po'i de'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba la ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa kho na'o //
translated: This is what is being said.üîΩEven though it is different by way of its own nature because it exists, since it is not an object, it does not function to generate the consciousness of that sense faculty, and it is not different from a rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on.

original: nye ba'i rang bzhin shes pa skyed par byed pa yin yang med pa las tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i rang bzhin shes pa skyed par byed pa yin yang med pa las tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Even though it generates the consciousness of its own nature, how could it not be different from a nonexistent?

original: bshad pa / yul ma yin pa'i don de'i nus pa ste byed pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rang gi dbang po'i shes pa de las dngos su ste bar du mchod pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / yul ma yin pa'i don de'i nus pa ste byed pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rang gi dbang po'i shes pa de las dngos su ste bar du mchod pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The capacity of that object that is not an object, that is, its function, is directly from that sense consciousness that apprehends its nature, because it is obstructed from the object.

original: yul ma yin pa'i @60b don dngos su rang gi yul gyi dbang po'i shes pa skyed par mi byed pas nus pa med pa de'i phyir de la ltos te med pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa'i @60b don dngos su rang gi yul gyi dbang po'i shes pa skyed par mi byed pas nus pa med pa de'i phyir de la ltos te med pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Since the object that is not an object does not directly generate a sense consciousness of its object, it is powerless. Therefore it is similar to nonexistence in dependence on that.

original: gal te de ltar na yang med pa ni brgyud pas kyang nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir mi nye ba nyid yin la yod pa ni de las bzlog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang med pa ni brgyud pas kyang nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir mi nye ba nyid yin la yod pa ni de las bzlog pa ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, then since nonexistence is not applied even indirectly, it is not applied at all, and existence is the opposite of that, is it not?

original: nges na ji ltar khyad bar med pa yin /
analyzed: nges na ji ltar khyad bar med pa yin /
translated: If so, then how can there be no difference?

original: 'di la brgyud pas phan 'dogs pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la brgyud pas phan 'dogs pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Here, existence is indirectly beneficial.

original: gzugs med na ni reg pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs med na ni reg pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: If form does not exist, contact would not exist.

original: de med na de'i shes pa de med na 'di nyid kyi yul can gyi mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur ba des na tha dad pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de med na de'i shes pa de med na 'di nyid kyi yul can gyi mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par 'gyur ba des na tha dad pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: If it did not exist, then the cognition of it would not exist, and the conceptual thought that has it as its object would not exist. Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that they are not different.

original: brgyud pas nye bar sbyor ba de ni 'das pa las kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: brgyud pas nye bar sbyor ba de ni 'das pa las kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response to this is: ‚ÄúBecause it is seen that it is connected to the past.‚Äù

original: kyang gi sgra ni 'das pa las da ltar byung ba khyad par med par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni 'das pa las da ltar byung ba khyad par med par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the present is not different from the past.

original: gang gi phyir de 'das pa la yang mthong ba de'i phyir de mthong ba las don gyi byed pa rnam par gnas par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'das pa la yang mthong ba de'i phyir de mthong ba las don gyi byed pa rnam par gnas par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since it is seen that it is connected to the past, how can the function of the object be established on the basis of seeing it?

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i dus na ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i dus na ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Because the past is like the horn of a rabbit when it is the time to produce its effect.

original: de'i phyir de las byed pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no function in it.

original: nye bar sbyor ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it connected?

original: de'i rgyu skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir phan 'dogs par nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir phan 'dogs par nye bar gdags te /
translated: It is designated as connected because it is the cause that produces it.

original: don dam par ni de la byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni de la byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, it is not a creator.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang gang brgyud pas nye bar sbyor ba de ni don dam par ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang gang brgyud pas nye bar sbyor ba de ni don dam par ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, in other cases, that which is indirectly related is not ultimately a cause.

original: de rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ltar nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ltar nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that way because it is the cause of the cause.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa la blta bar bya ba'i dngos por yin na yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar rang gi dbang po'i shes pa skyes ba la nus pa med par bsgrubs nas dbang po'i yul ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa la blta bar bya ba'i dngos por yin na yang ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar rang gi dbang po'i shes pa skyes ba la nus pa med par bsgrubs nas dbang po'i yul ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i
translated: Thus, although it is an object of seeing that is not an object of the senses, like the horn of a donkey, it is established that it has no capacity to produce its own sensory consciousness.

original: phyir / de la 'dzin pa'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa mjug bsdu ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: phyir / de la 'dzin pa'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa mjug bsdu ba bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, because it is not an object of the senses, it is concluded that the consciousness that apprehends it is not a form of direct perception.

original: de'i phyir reg pa'i dbang po byed pa dang bcas pa can gyi skyes bu 'di mngon sum dang ldan pa mngon sum can du brtag par rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa'i dbang po byed pa dang bcas pa can gyi skyes bu 'di mngon sum dang ldan pa mngon sum can du brtag par rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: Thus it is not tenable to posit that this person, who has a sense faculty that is capable of contact, possesses direct perception.

original: / reg pa yin yang yul gang la mngon sum dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: / reg pa yin yang yul gang la mngon sum dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is a contact, how can it not be a direct perception?

original: byed pa'i sgo nas yul ston par byed pa ni med pa las khyad par med pa la rtogs pa ste shes pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i sgo nas yul ston par byed pa ni med pa las khyad par med pa la rtogs pa ste shes pa'o //
translated: It is a cognition that is not distinguished from a non-existent object by way of its activity.

original: 'di skad du med pa las khyad par du ma gyur pa'i yul la rtogs pas ni mngon sum dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du med pa las khyad par du ma gyur pa'i yul la rtogs pas ni mngon sum dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: In other words, a cognition that is not distinguished from a non-existent object is not a direct perception.

original: @61a * // 'di bum pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i rnam par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: @61a * // 'di bum pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i rnam par brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthis is a pot‚Äù is a verbal expression of a cognition.

original: ji ltar na de med pa dang khyad par med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de med pa dang khyad par med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not distinguished from a non-existent object?

original: yul ma yin pa nyid kyis zhes smos te /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa nyid kyis zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that it is not an object.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i yul ma yin pa de'i phyir rang gi yul can gyi dbang po'i shes pa la med pa dang khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i yul ma yin pa de'i phyir rang gi yul can gyi dbang po'i shes pa la med pa dang khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not an object of the senses, it is not distinguished from a non-existent object by the sensory cognition that has it as its object.

original: 'di ci zhig byas pas rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig byas pas rtogs she na /
translated: How is it cognized?

original: reg pa las zhes smos te /
analyzed: reg pa las zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that it is cognized by contact.

original: mun pa'i gnas skabs su mig gi byed pa med pa na reg pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'og rol du de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i gnas skabs su mig gi byed pa med pa na reg pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'og rol du de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood after the tactile consciousness, when the function of the eye is absent in the state of darkness.

original: de'i tshe reg par bya ba'i dngos po nyid reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i don gyi khyad par can gyi dngos por rtog pas gzung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe reg par bya ba'i dngos po nyid reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i don gyi khyad par can gyi dngos por rtog pas gzung ba ma yin nam /
translated: At that time, is not the object of touch conceived as a particular object generated from the tactile faculty?

original: reg bya de yang reg pa'i dbang po'i yul ma yin na gang gis na de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la med pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: reg bya de yang reg pa'i dbang po'i yul ma yin na gang gis na de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la med pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: And if that tactile object is not the object of the tactile faculty, how could it be similar to a non-existent object in generating a consciousness based on it?

original: des na dbang po'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po las skyes ba dang don nye ba la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po las skyes ba dang don nye ba la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it grasps the object of the faculty, it is generated from the faculty and depends on the proximity of the object.

original: ci ste reg pa ni reg bya yin la de'i tshe gzung ba'i bum pa ni blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar pha rol gyi 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste reg pa ni reg bya yin la de'i tshe gzung ba'i bum pa ni blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar pha rol gyi 'dod pa yin na /
translated: But if the opponent's assertion is that touch is the tactile object, and at that time the apprehended pot is the visible object,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir reg pa'i dngos por gyur pas na reg pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg pa'i dngos por gyur pas na reg pa ste /
translated: Because it is a tactile object, it is touch.

original: reg bya gang yin pa de nyid ni mthong ba'i rdzas yin no //
analyzed: reg bya gang yin pa de nyid ni mthong ba'i rdzas yin no //
translated: That which is tangible is the substance that is seen.

original: des na mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la reg nas 'di'i don gyi khyad par can du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la reg nas 'di'i don gyi khyad par can du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having touched that which is seen, one understands it as having the particular characteristics of an object.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'di ni gzhan gyi khas blangs pa'o zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'di ni gzhan gyi khas blangs pa'o zhes ston pa'o //
translated: If means this is what the opponent accepts.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba yin no zhes khyed kyis gang brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba yin no zhes khyed kyis gang brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: The explanation of the commentary is: It is not the case that what you say, that it is as if it does not exist because it is not an object of the sense faculties,

original: gang gi phyir reg pa ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg pa ni reg bya'o //
translated: is not so, because contact is a tangible object.

original: yang gi sgra ni mthong ba ma yang yin pa de rtogs nas 'di ni bum pa'o zhes rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni mthong ba ma yang yin pa de rtogs nas 'di ni bum pa'o zhes rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The word also means that having understood what is seen, one understands it as a pot.

original: de'i phyir de ltar shes pa de ni reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar shes pa de ni reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de'i don to //
translated: Therefore, that cognition arises from the contact faculty.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'di ni reg pa'i dbang po'i yul 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'di ni reg pa'i dbang po'i yul 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means that this conceptual cognition does not apprehend the object of the tactile faculty.

original: 'dir 'di ni bum pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la kha dog snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni bum pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la kha dog snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, in a cognition such as ‚Äúthis is a pot,‚Äù color appears.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The commentary explains this point:

original: shes pa 'di ni reg pa'i dbang po de nyid las skyes par mi rigs te'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni reg pa'i dbang po de nyid las skyes par mi rigs te'o //
translated: It is not reasonable that this cognition arises from that tactile faculty itself.

original: 'di bum pa'o snyam pa @61b zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam par ston pa sta /
analyzed: 'di bum pa'o snyam pa @61b zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam par ston pa sta /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis is a pot‚Äù indicates the form of the cognition.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: reg pa'i dbang po'i byed pa'i gnas skabs su bum pa de kha dog gi khyad par can du sngon ji ltar mthong ba de ltar rnam pa de nyid kyis de nyid 'di yin no zhes mthong ba dang reg pa gcig tu mtshams sbyar nas sems pa na /
analyzed: reg pa'i dbang po'i byed pa'i gnas skabs su bum pa de kha dog gi khyad par can du sngon ji ltar mthong ba de ltar rnam pa de nyid kyis de nyid 'di yin no zhes mthong ba dang reg pa gcig tu mtshams sbyar nas sems pa na /
translated: When the tactile faculty is in a state of activity, that pot is seen as having a particular color, just as it was previously seen. In that very same aspect, it is seen as ‚Äúthis is it.‚Äù When seeing and touching are combined, the mind thinks,

original: tshogs pa las skyes pa'am skyes de las gzhan bcos su yang rung ste kha dog snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa las skyes pa'am skyes de las gzhan bcos su yang rung ste kha dog snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is a modification of the collection, because color is perceived.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //üîΩkha dog ni de'i tshe rang gi yul can gyi dbang po'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o // kha dog ni de'i tshe rang gi yul can gyi dbang po'i shes pa bskyed par bya ba la /
translated: It is not the domain of the senses.

original: med pa dang 'dra ba yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: med pa dang 'dra ba yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: At that time, color is as if it did not exist, in that it is not capable of producing a sense consciousness that has it as its object.üîΩThis is the position.

original: de bzhin du mthong du zin kyang reg pa'i gnas skabs dran pa na 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni don nye ba la mi ltos pa yang yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong du zin kyang reg pa'i gnas skabs dran pa na 'di bum pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni don nye ba la mi ltos pa yang yin par blta'o //
translated: In the same way, even when it is seen, when memory of the state of contact is recalled, the cognition that thinks ‚Äúthis is a pot‚Äù is seen to not depend on the presence of the object.üîΩNow, what is this conception?

original: 'o na rnam par rtog pa 'di ci zhig yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas mjug bsdu bar 'dod pas bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rtog pa 'di ci zhig yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas mjug bsdu bar 'dod pas bshad pa /
translated: In order to answer this question and to conclude, he says:

original: nges na dran pa ste dran pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di ni don nye ba la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges na dran pa ste dran pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'di ni don nye ba la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this conception, which is memory, is not dependent on the presence of the object.

original: 'o na dbang po'i byed pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbang po'i byed pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how does it occur immediately after the operation of the sense faculty?

original: bshad pa / gzugs dang reg pa de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de nyid gang la yod pa shes pa gnyi ga'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzugs dang reg pa de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de nyid gang la yod pa shes pa gnyi ga'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: The cause of the form and the tactile objects and the consciousness of those two exists in the same way in the cause of both consciousnesses, but it is not produced from the sense faculty.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni yid ces bya ba yin no ;üîΩ/ yid kyi rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad par thal ba'i sgo nas don nye ba la mi ltos pa dang / sogs pa smos pas 'phangs pa 'dod pa dang 'brel ba nyid du dbang po'i shes pa brjod du zin kyang dbang po'i shes pa yid kyi shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don 'dzin par dogs pa la yang brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni yid ces bya ba yin no ; / yid kyi rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad par thal ba'i sgo nas don nye ba la mi ltos pa dang / sogs pa smos pas 'phangs pa 'dod pa dang 'brel ba nyid du dbang po'i shes pa brjod du zin kyang dbang po'i shes pa yid kyi shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don 'dzin par dogs pa la yang brjod pa yin te /
translated: That itself is indicated by the term ‚Äúmind.‚ÄùüîΩAlthough it is stated that the sense consciousness is related to desire because it is not different from mental consciousness and because it does not depend on the object being present, and so on, it is also stated that the sense consciousness apprehends the object that is the object of mental consciousness because of the doubt that the sense consciousness is produced by mental consciousness.

original: dbang po'i shes pa yang 'dod pa la rag las par dogs pa bsal ba'i don du ba lang gi blo bzlog cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa yang 'dod pa la rag las par dogs pa bsal ba'i don du ba lang gi blo bzlog cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yin la /
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt that the sense consciousness also depends on desire, the phrase ‚Äúthe cow‚Äôs mind is reversed‚Äù and so on is stated to refute that.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig 'di'i don du 'dzin pa ni don nye ba la ltos pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa dgag pa'i phyir ma yin 'di ni bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig 'di'i don du 'dzin pa ni don nye ba la ltos pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa dgag pa'i phyir ma yin 'di ni bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis is a pot‚Äù and so on refutes the idea that some conceptual cognition apprehends an object that is not present.

original: de'i phyir gang zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba sngar spyir brjod pa nyid yang bshad pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba sngar spyir brjod pa nyid yang bshad pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not meaningless to explain again what was previously stated in general terms, which would be the fault of repetition.

original: gang gi phyir sngar ni nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid kyis dbang po'i shes pa dang yid kyi shes pa dag khyad par med par @62a * //üîΩthal bar brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar ni nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa nyid kyis dbang po'i shes pa dang yid kyi shes pa dag khyad par med par @62a * // thal bar brjod pa yin la /
translated: Previously, it was stated that the distinction between a sense consciousness and a mental consciousness is not made on the basis of whether or not the object is present.

original: da lta ni yid kyis nye bar gtad pa brtags pa'i dngos po 'dzin pas don nye ba la mi ltos pa dang / 'dod pa tsam la rag las bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: da lta ni yid kyis nye bar gtad pa brtags pa'i dngos po 'dzin pas don nye ba la mi ltos pa dang / 'dod pa tsam la rag las bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Now, it is stated that the mental consciousness apprehends an object that is a conceptual image, which is not dependent on a present object and is dependent on mere desire.

original: brtags pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa nyid ni brtags pa 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa nyid ni brtags pa 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The apprehension of a conceptual image is the apprehension of a conceptual object.

original: de nyid kyang nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa yin pa des na 'di nyid kyis 'dod pa ldog pa dang don nye ba la mi ltos par brjod pa'i phyir zlos par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyang nye ba ma yin pa'i don 'dzin pa yin pa des na 'di nyid kyis 'dod pa ldog pa dang don nye ba la mi ltos par brjod pa'i phyir zlos par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is also the apprehension of a meaning that is not present, it is suspected that this would be redundant because it would express the reversal of the assertion and the apprehension of a meaning that does not depend on a present object.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don gyis khyad par du bya ba'i don 'dzin pa ma yin par bsgrubs nas sgra'i khyad par yid kyis sbyar ba la yang 'dzin pa ma yin par bsgrub
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don gyis khyad par du bya ba'i don 'dzin pa ma yin par bsgrubs nas sgra'i khyad par yid kyis sbyar ba la yang 'dzin pa ma yin par bsgrub
translated: Therefore, having thus established that a sense consciousness is not an apprehender of a meaning that is qualified by a meaning that is manifestly assembled by a mental consciousness, in order to establish that it is not an apprehender of a sound that is connected by the mental faculty,

original: pa'i phyir / gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩbrda'i dus su don gang zhig yod pa ste snang ba'i rang bzhin la sgra gang mthong nas yang dus gzhan du lhan cig spyod pa grub pa'i don de mthong ba'i rgyu las /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te / brda'i dus su don gang zhig yod pa ste snang ba'i rang bzhin la sgra gang mthong nas yang dus gzhan du lhan cig spyod pa grub pa'i don de mthong ba'i rgyu las /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù

original: brda'i dus su mthong ba'i sgra de dran par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus su mthong ba'i sgra de dran par rigs pa yin no //
translated: and so on. At the time of the convention, the meaning that exists, that is, the nature that appears, is seen in dependence on a sound. Later, at another time, when the meaning that is the object of the convention is seen, the sound that was seen at the time of the convention is recalled.

original: brda'i yul du gyur pa'i don de rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: brda'i yul du gyur pa'i don de rtogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning that is the object of the symbol is realized.üîΩ

original: mthong ba med na ni dus gzhan du sgra'i khyad par te sgra'i bye brag ji ltar dran /
analyzed: mthong ba med na ni dus gzhan du sgra'i khyad par te sgra'i bye brag ji ltar dran /
translated: If one does not see the object that is the referent of the sign, then how could one remember the particularity of the word, i.e., the specific word, at another time?

original: nges pa nyid kyis ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa nyid kyis ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The point is that one could not remember it by means of ascertainment.

original: sgra de ma dran na sgra de dang don yid kyi rnam par shes pas sbyar zhing bsres pa'i don ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pas rtogs /
analyzed: sgra de ma dran na sgra de dang don yid kyi rnam par shes pas sbyar zhing bsres pa'i don ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pas rtogs /
translated: If one does not remember the word, how could one understand the object that is connected with and mixed up with that word by means of a mental consciousness?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang zhig khas blangs pas nyes pa 'di'i skabs su 'gyur ba'i khas blangs pa de ston to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang zhig khas blangs pas nyes pa 'di'i skabs su 'gyur ba'i khas blangs pa de ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif you accept‚Äù and so on shows what is accepted that would give rise to this fault.

original: rang gis rjod par byed pa ni rang rjod byed de smra bar byed pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: rang gis rjod par byed pa ni rang rjod byed de smra bar byed pa'i sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-expressive‚Äù means that which expresses itself, i.e., a speaking sound.

original: de nyid ni khyad par te de la ltos pa'i don de nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni khyad par te de la ltos pa'i don de nyid do //
translated: That is the particularity, i.e., the object that depends on it.

original: shes pas zhes bya ba ni dbang po la brten pa ste yid la ni rnam par rtog pa can nyid la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas zhes bya ba ni dbang po la brten pa ste yid la ni rnam par rtog pa can nyid la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of consciousness‚Äù means in dependence on a sense faculty, because there is no dispute that the mental faculty is conceptual.

original: brda byang bas kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: brda byang bas kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven by the label‚Äù is the distinction.

original: gzhan dag gis ni rjod par byed pa'i sgras khyad par can du sbyor mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni rjod par byed pa'i sgras khyad par can du sbyor mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to connect the word ‚Äúexpressing‚Äù to the qualifier in other cases.

original: gal te de ltar nges par khas len pa yin na da ni de ltar khas blangs pa na dbang po'i shes pa'i brjod pa dbang po'i shes pa yod do zhes thos pa gang yin pa de yang ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nges par khas len pa yin na da ni de ltar khas blangs pa na dbang po'i shes pa'i brjod pa dbang po'i shes pa yod do zhes thos pa gang yin pa de yang ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: If one definitely accepts it in this way, then when one accepts it in this way, the expression of the sense consciousness, ‚ÄúThe sense consciousness exists,‚Äù which is heard, will also be reversed.

original: nyams su myong ba lta ci smos zhes smra ba'i tshul gyis ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba lta ci smos zhes smra ba'i tshul gyis ston par byed pa'o //
translated: What need is there to mention experience? This is the way of teaching.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid khyad par te de las gzhan @62b las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid khyad par te de las gzhan @62b las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction is the expressing itself, because it is distinguished from anything else.

original: de la dran pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dran pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because memory is impossible there.

original: ji ltar dran pa mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa mi rigs she na /
translated: How is memory impossible?

original: bshad pa gang gi phyir brda'i dus su goms pa'i don mthong ba yod na ni don mthong ba de las brda'i dus su don nye ba la mthong ba sgra dran par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa gang gi phyir brda'i dus su goms pa'i don mthong ba yod na ni don mthong ba de las brda'i dus su don nye ba la mthong ba sgra dran par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If one sees the object that is the object of habituation at the time of the sign, then from seeing that object, one would remember the sound that is the sign at the time of the sign.üîΩJust as the relation between fire and smoke is established, when fire is seen, one definitely generates memory of smoke.

original: ji ltar me dang du ba de dag gi 'brel pa grub pa ni me mthong ba na nges pa dang ldan pa'i du ba'i dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar me dang du ba de dag gi 'brel pa grub pa ni me mthong ba na nges pa dang ldan pa'i du ba'i dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, when one sees the simultaneous occurrence of sound and object, one definitely generates memory of the object.üîΩBut if one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one definitely generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.

original: sgra dang don dag kyang lhan cig spyod pa grub pa cig mthong na nges pa can gyi dran par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag kyang lhan cig spyod pa grub pa cig mthong na nges pa can gyi dran par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.üîΩIf one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does not see the object, one does not generate memory of the sound.

original: 'o na don mthong nas sgra nges par dran pa yin no zhes dogs pa la bshad pa brda goms pa 'dis don gang la sgra med pa de mi mthong ba la mthong na yang ste mthong ba med pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshul gyis sgra de mi dran la
analyzed: 'o na don mthong nas sgra nges par dran pa yin no zhes dogs pa la bshad pa brda goms pa 'dis don gang la sgra med pa de mi mthong ba la mthong na yang ste mthong ba med pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshul gyis sgra de mi dran la
translated: If one sees the object, one generates memory of the sound.üîΩIf one does

original: ma dran na ste ma dran pa'i phyir don la sgra sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: ma dran na ste ma dran pa'i phyir don la sgra sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: If there is no memory, i.e., if there is no memory, one does not apply a sound to the object.

original: yid kyis don la sgra ma sbyar na rtogs par mi 'gyur te mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: yid kyis don la sgra ma sbyar na rtogs par mi 'gyur te mi mthong ngo //
translated: If one does not apply a sound to the object with the mind, one does not understand, i.e., one does not see.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: nges pa can du dran pa las ni don mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: nges pa can du dran pa las ni don mthong ba yin la /
translated: From a determinate memory, one sees the object.

original: don mthong ba las kyang nges pa can du dran pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pas 'gro ba ma lus pa long ba ste mthong ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don mthong ba las kyang nges pa can du dran pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pas 'gro ba ma lus pa long ba ste mthong ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from seeing the object, there is a determinate memory. Therefore, because of the fault of mutual dependence, all beings are blind, i.e., devoid of sight.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi tshul ni 'di nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi tshul ni 'di nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: Because this is the way it is for everyone,

original: des na ma lus pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ma lus pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said that ‚Äúall‚Äù are blind.

original: nye ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nye ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNearby‚Äù means present.

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa can yin no //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa can yin no //
translated: It is that which is in a suitable place.

original: nang gi ste nang na yod pa'i 'du byed sgra dran pa'i bag chags sad pas byas pa ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la mngon du phyogs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi ste nang na yod pa'i 'du byed sgra dran pa'i bag chags sad pas byas pa ni rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la mngon du phyogs par byas pa ste /
translated: The internal, i.e., the internal, formative forces, are the sound-memory traces that are activated. They are directed toward the production of their own effect.

original: bag chags sad pa de sgra dran par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag chags sad pa de sgra dran par 'gyur te /
translated: The latent impression is awakened by the sound, and memory occurs.

original: ji ltar mthong bas nges pa can du dran pa ltar don nye bas dran pa'i bag chags sad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma mthong yang dran pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong bas nges pa can du dran pa ltar don nye bas dran pa'i bag chags sad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma mthong yang dran pa yin no //
translated: Just as memory occurs with certainty from what was seen, so too memory occurs from the awakening of the latent impression of the object. Therefore, even though the object is not seen, memory occurs.

original: thag ring po na gnas pa nyid kyang dran pa'i rgyu yin na ni rtag tu dran par thal ba'i phyir nye ba nyid las dran pa'i rgyur brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thag ring po na gnas pa nyid kyang dran pa'i rgyu yin na ni rtag tu dran par thal ba'i phyir nye ba nyid las dran pa'i rgyur brjod pa yin no //
translated: If the fact that the object is distant is the cause of memory, then it follows that memory would always occur. Therefore the cause of memory is said to be proximity.

original: dogs pa bsu nas ma yin te zhes smos te de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas ma yin te zhes smos te de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Anticipating this qualm, the treatise states, ‚ÄúNo, because . . .‚Äù This is not the case.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni ngo bo med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni ngo bo med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The treatise responds, ‚ÄúBecause the nature of the relationship between the sound and its meaning is unreal.‚Äù

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unreal because it is not a thing.

original: gang la dngos po'i 'brel pa yod pa de la ni rang gi yul can gyi shes pa la ma ltos par bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa yod pa @63a * //
analyzed: gang la dngos po'i 'brel pa yod pa de la ni rang gi yul can gyi shes pa la ma ltos par bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa yod pa @63a * //
translated: That which has a real relationship is that which gives rise to the cognition of its object without depending on the cognition itself.

original: yin te / sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: yin te / sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
translated: Because they are like the seed and sprout.

original: gal te sgra dang don dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa yin na ni de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis don rang gi sgra'i dran pa sad pa'i rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur ba yin na don gyi rang bzhin ni sgra'i brjod bya ma yin pa des na
analyzed: gal te sgra dang don dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa yin na ni de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyis don rang gi sgra'i dran pa sad pa'i rgyu nyid du yang 'gyur ba yin na don gyi rang bzhin ni sgra'i brjod bya ma yin pa des na
translated: If the word and the object are related by intrinsic reality, then at that time, the object would be the cause of the word‚Äôs memory, but the object‚Äôs nature is not the word‚Äôs referent.

original: 'brel pa med pas de des yul can gyi dran pa sad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pas de des yul can gyi dran pa sad par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no relation, it does not cause the memory of the word.

original: de ni sgra dang 'brel pas dran par byed pa yin gyi nye ba med par ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni sgra dang 'brel pas dran par byed pa yin gyi nye ba med par ni ma yin la /
translated: It is the word‚Äôs relation that causes the memory, not its presence.
