original: 'brel pa de yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩsngar don nye bas byas pa'i nang gi rnam par 'gyur ba med na sgra'i byed brag dran par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba der ni rang gi ngo bos 'brel pa khas blangs nas dran pa sad pa'i rgyu nyid yin na dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu
analyzed: 'brel pa de yang yod pa ma yin no // sngar don nye bas byas pa'i nang gi rnam par 'gyur ba med na sgra'i byed brag dran par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba der ni rang gi ngo bos 'brel pa khas blangs nas dran pa sad pa'i rgyu nyid yin na dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu
translated: And that relation does not exist.üîΩPreviously, it was said that if the internal change produced by the presence of the object does not exist, it is not logical for the word‚Äôs distinction to be remembered.

original: nyid bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: nyid bkag pa yin la /
translated: There, having accepted that the relation is by intrinsic reality, the cause of the memory is refuted.

original: da ltar ni de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mthong ba la ltos pa nyid kyis dran par 'gyur ba yin no zhes khyad par can du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mthong ba la ltos pa nyid kyis dran par 'gyur ba yin no zhes khyad par can du brjod pa yin no //
translated: But now, since that object does not exist, memory is dependent on seeing, and this is a special case.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i blos sbyar ba'i 'brel pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i rang bzhin la yod pa yin la /üîΩrnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhi de yang mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa des na mthong ba yod na rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'i yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i blos sbyar ba'i 'brel pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i rang bzhin la yod pa yin la / rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhi de yang mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa des na mthong ba yod na rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'i yul nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, the relationship that is created by the mind of a person exists in the nature of the appearance of conceptual thought.

original: de la yang de'i sgra nges par dran pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang de'i sgra nges par dran pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, that nature of the appearance of conceptual thought is preceded by seeing. Therefore, when seeing exists, the experience of the object that is the nature of the appearance of conceptual thought exists, and the sound of that is definitely remembered.

original: me dang du ba dag ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa yin yang gcig nye ba tsam gyis gzhan dran pa bag chags sad pa'i rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: me dang du ba dag ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa yin yang gcig nye ba tsam gyis gzhan dran pa bag chags sad pa'i rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Even though fire and smoke are related by their very nature, is it not the case that the mere proximity of one causes the memory of the other to arise, and that this is the cause of the activation of the latent impressions?

original: des na ci'i phyir sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don nye ba sgra dran pa'i bag chags sad pa'i rgyu ma yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don nye ba sgra dran pa'i bag chags sad pa'i rgyu ma yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, why is it said that the relation between a word and its meaning does not exist inherently, and that the word does not cause the recollection of the meaning?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: me dang du ba ni shes pa la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed bya skyed byed du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: me dang du ba ni shes pa la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed bya skyed byed du gnas pa yin te /
translated: Fire and smoke exist as that which is produced and that which produces, respectively, without depending on consciousness.

original: des na phan tshun dran pa sad pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phan tshun dran pa sad pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not causes of the mutual recollection.

original: rang gi ngo bor grub pa'i sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ni shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor grub pa'i sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ni shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The relation between a word and its meaning, which exist inherently, is the nature of the object of consciousness.

original: des na rtogs pa po'i rgyud la phan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas don sgra rnams dang 'brel ba yang /
analyzed: des na rtogs pa po'i rgyud la phan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas don sgra rnams dang 'brel ba yang /
translated: Therefore, the relation between a word and its meaning is also established by way of its benefit to the continuum of the cognizer.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos 'brel pa yin na 'gyur ba yin na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos 'brel pa yin na 'gyur ba yin na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the relation existed essentially, it would be permanent, but that does not exist.

original: des na pha rol pos sad pa'i rgyur brjod pa ni mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na pha rol pos sad pa'i rgyur brjod pa ni mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that the opponent‚Äôs claim that it is the cause of recollection is untenable.

original: yang ci'i phyir rngo bo nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rngo bo nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there no relationship of inherent nature?

original: @63b brda ste brdar btags pa nyams su ma myong ba la sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa med pas so //
analyzed: @63b brda ste brdar btags pa nyams su ma myong ba la sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa med pas so //
translated: Because there is no relationship between a word and its meaning for one who has not experienced the convention, i.e., the designation.

original: 'brel ba med pa yang brda med pa'i sgra las don mi rtogs pa dang / don nye bas sgra dran par mi 'gyur ba las khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa yang brda med pa'i sgra las don mi rtogs pa dang / don nye bas sgra dran par mi 'gyur ba las khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: And because one understands that there is no relationship when one does not understand the meaning from a word that is not a convention, and when the word is not recalled because the meaning is not present.

original: 'di snyam du brda mthong ba'i lhan cig byed pa dang rang gi nye bar len pa las don brjod par bya ba'i ngo bor skye ba yin no zhes dogs pa las bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du brda mthong ba'i lhan cig byed pa dang rang gi nye bar len pa las don brjod par bya ba'i ngo bor skye ba yin no zhes dogs pa las bshad pa /
translated: One might think that the meaning arises in the nature of the expressed object due to the simultaneous action of seeing the convention and one‚Äôs own appropriation.

original: brda'i dus su skyes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: brda'i dus su skyes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: The response to this is: The nature that arises at the time of the convention is not tenable.

original: de lta na ni gang zhig skyes bus brjod par bya ba'i ngo bor 'dod pa de kho na brjod par bya ba yin no zhes khas blangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang zhig skyes bus brjod par bya ba'i ngo bor 'dod pa de kho na brjod par bya ba yin no zhes khas blangs par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, one would be accepting that only that which is asserted to be the nature of the expressed object is the expressed object.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The nature of things is not changed by the wishes of beings.üîΩ

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyongs su 'gyur ba yin na ni gzhan brda ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // yongs su 'gyur ba yin na ni gzhan brda ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Because the nature of things is not transformed by the desire of a person.üîΩIf it were transformed, then even those who do not see the convention,

original: brda mthong ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la yang 'brel pa rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //üîΩci'i phyir snyam na smras pa /
analyzed: brda mthong ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la yang 'brel pa rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir snyam na smras pa /
translated: who are not endowed with the knowledge of the convention, would understand the relation.

original: don de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don de de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because that object is of its nature.

original: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the relation.

original: don de rtogs par byed pa gcig la ltos nas sgra dang 'brel pa'i ngo bor skyes ba'i phyir gzhan dag gis kyang 'brel par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de rtogs par byed pa gcig la ltos nas sgra dang 'brel pa'i ngo bor skyes ba'i phyir gzhan dag gis kyang 'brel par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is produced in the nature of the relation to the word in dependence on the one who understands that object, others also understand the relation.

original: gang gis brda ma byas pa de la ni de'i ngo bo de 'dra ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis brda ma byas pa de la ni de'i ngo bo de 'dra ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But for one who does not know the convention, it is not of that nature.

original: skyes bu so so la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes bu so so la zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúBecause of the individual person.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu dang skyes bu las brjod par bya ba'i don rnams bdag nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan brda rig pa ma yin pa thams cad la 'brel pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu dang skyes bu las brjod par bya ba'i don rnams bdag nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan brda rig pa ma yin pa thams cad la 'brel pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the person and the objects that are the topics of expression are not different from each other, therefore all those who are not aware of the convention would be related to the object.

original: ji ltar ba bzhin bdag nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa 'di nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ba bzhin bdag nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa 'di nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the person and the objects that are the topics of expression are not different from each other?

original: bshad pa / bdag nyid gang las nyams pa de ni bdag med pa ste der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / bdag nyid gang las nyams pa de ni bdag med pa ste der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In response to this question, it is said: ‚ÄúThat which is impaired in its own nature is selfless.‚Äù This is because it would follow that it is selfless.

original: gal te skyes bu so so la brda'i dus na bdag nyid gzhan dang gzhan du grub pa yin na ni des na bdag med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu so so la brda'i dus na bdag nyid gzhan dang gzhan du grub pa yin na ni des na bdag med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the person were established as different from one another at the time of the convention, then it would follow that it is selfless.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid gcig yin la de yang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid gcig yin la de yang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the same nature, and that is the relation.

original: du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt it follow that there would be multiplicity?

original: bdag med par thal ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: bdag med par thal ba ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: It is not the case that it follows that it is selfless.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: bdag nyid gnas pa ste rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir bdag @64a * //üîΩnyid 'ga' yang gnas pa med de /
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas pa ste rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir bdag @64a * // nyid 'ga' yang gnas pa med de /
translated: Because it is the nature of the self to abide in its own nature.üîΩSince the self does not abide in any way,

original: thams cad ldog pa med pa de'i phyir bdag med par thal ba yin no //üîΩ'di ltar brda shes pa dang de las bzlog pa gnyis po dag gis mthong ba'i don gcig po de'i rang bzhin gang zhig brda shes pa'i mthong ba'i yul de ni /
analyzed: thams cad ldog pa med pa de'i phyir bdag med par thal ba yin no // 'di ltar brda shes pa dang de las bzlog pa gnyis po dag gis mthong ba'i don gcig po de'i rang bzhin gang zhig brda shes pa'i mthong ba'i yul de ni /
translated: it follows that the self does not exist.

original: cig shos kyi mthong ba'i yul du med pa yin zhing gang brda mi rig pas mthong ba de yang gzhan la med pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyi mthong ba'i yul du med pa yin zhing gang brda mi rig pas mthong ba de yang gzhan la med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the object seen by the two, the one who knows the sign and the one who does not, is not the nature of that object. The object seen by the one who knows the sign does not exist as the object seen by the other. The object seen by the one who does not know the sign also does not exist for the other.

original: des na gang zhig brda mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa'i bdag nyid de ni cig shos la med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na gang zhig brda mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa'i bdag nyid de ni cig shos la med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature that is the object seen by the one who knows the sign does not exist for the other,

original: des de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other sees it as having a nature that is incompatible with that.

original: cig shos kyi gang yin pa de yang brda rig pa la ltos na gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyi gang yin pa de yang brda rig pa la ltos na gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature that is the object seen by the one who does not know the sign does not exist for the one who knows the sign.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun ltos nas ngo bo gnyi ga yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir bdag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun ltos nas ngo bo gnyi ga yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir bdag med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since neither of the two natures exists in mutual dependence, there is no self.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam zhig lus par 'gyur gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam zhig lus par 'gyur gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
translated: Only consciousness remains, not external reality.

original: bdag nyid du ma yang yin la gcig kyang yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid du ma yang yin la gcig kyang yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyams pa yin te /
translated: The claim that the self is both one and many is undermined,

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because different things are characterized by different natures.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brda rig pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa long bar thal bar bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis thal ba las bstan pa'i don du de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brda rig pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa long bar thal bar bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis thal ba las bstan pa'i don du de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, having shown that the entire world of those who know language would be blind, he concludes by stating the point of the reductio: ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .

original: sgra sbyar ba ni sgra dang sbyar ba'o //üîΩdon gang la sgra sbyar ba med pa'i don de mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra sbyar ba ni sgra dang sbyar ba'o // don gang la sgra sbyar ba med pa'i don de mthong ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äù The term ‚Äúgrammatical‚Äù means ‚Äúconnected with grammar.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot connected with grammar‚Äù is ‚Äúseen.‚Äù

original: mthong bas na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
analyzed: mthong bas na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSeen‚Äù is the meaning of the reason.

original: de la thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'di yin te /
translated: The syllogism that is the reverse of the reductio is this:

original: gang zhig mthong ba de ni sgra dang 'dres pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig mthong ba de ni sgra dang 'dres pa med pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is seen is not mixed with sound.

original: nyams su myong ba 'di yang mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba 'di yang mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And this experience is a seeing. This is a syllogism of nature.

original: 'di la sgra dang 'dres par 'dzin pa la ni nges pa dang ldan par sgra dran pas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sgra dang 'dres par 'dzin pa la ni nges pa dang ldan par sgra dran pas khyab pa yin te /
translated: In this case, in the apprehension of the object as mixed with sound, it is pervaded by the presence of the memory of sound.

original: ma dran na ni nye ba ma yin pa'i sgras khyad par du byas pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dran na ni nye ba ma yin pa'i sgras khyad par du byas pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if it is not remembered, it is not tenable to apprehend it as qualified by a sound that is not present.

original: mthong ba la yang sgra nges pa dran pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba la yang sgra nges pa dran pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: And in the case of seeing, it is pervaded by the nature of being free from the memory of sound.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na sgra dang ma 'brel pa'i don 'dzin pas khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na sgra dang ma 'brel pa'i don 'dzin pas khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the pervader is not observed, when it is reversed from the discordant class, it is pervaded by the apprehension of an object that is not mixed with sound.

original: mthong ba'i spyi'i gtan tshigs yin zhing mthong ba'i khyad par chos can yin pa de bas na dam bcas pa'i @64b don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i spyi'i gtan tshigs yin zhing mthong ba'i khyad par chos can yin pa de bas na dam bcas pa'i @64b don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The general reason for seeing is that the particular thing seen is the subject. Therefore, one part of the meaning of the thesis does not become the reason.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang rtog pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yang na zhes smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang rtog pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yang na zhes smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate non-conceptuality by another method, he says, ‚Äúor else.‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang bral ba ste rtog pas dben pa gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba ste rtog pas dben pa gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: That which is free from conceptuality, which is devoid of conceptualization, is the means of valid cognition of direct perception.

original: gang du mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyis snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nges pa la snang ba mi dmigs pas tha snyad 'ba' zhig byed pa de la ni mngon sum nyid dngos po med pa'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyis snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nges pa la snang ba mi dmigs pas tha snyad 'ba' zhig byed pa de la ni mngon sum nyid dngos po med pa'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Where direct perception itself is ascertained as free from the conceptualization of appearance, and where mere verbal expression is made by the non-apprehension of appearance, there direct perception is said to be the means of valid cognition that establishes the non-existence of things.

original: gal te snang ba'i bum pas dpen pa'i sa phyogs dmigs pa de bzhin du snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' yang dmigs pa med pa yin nam zhes dgongs pa la /
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i bum pas dpen pa'i sa phyogs dmigs pa de bzhin du snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' yang dmigs pa med pa yin nam zhes dgongs pa la /
translated: If you think that just as a place devoid of an appearing pot is perceived, so too a state of consciousness devoid of an appearing thought is perceived,

original: bshad pa / g-yo med pa ste don gcig la chags shing 'gyur ba med pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi gnas pa dang ldan pa na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / g-yo med pa ste don gcig la chags shing 'gyur ba med pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi gnas pa dang ldan pa na'o //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: When the mind is still, that is, when it is not attached to a single object and is not changing, it is in a state of stability.

original: ci zhig byas nas de ltar gnas she na /üîΩthams cad las te /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas de ltar gnas she na / thams cad las te /
translated: What is it that makes it remain in that way?üîΩIt is when the mind is withdrawn from everything.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don thams cad las sems te yul can gyi rtogs pa bsdus nas te bzlog nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don thams cad las sems te yul can gyi rtogs pa bsdus nas te bzlog nas gnas pa'o //
translated: The mind, the subject, is withdrawn from and stops engaging with all objects of conceptualization.

original: gnas pa yang rgyun 'jug pa yin par blta'o //üîΩsems bsdus pa'i rgyus g-yo ba med pa nyid dang 'gyur ba med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas pa yang rgyun 'jug pa yin par blta'o // sems bsdus pa'i rgyus g-yo ba med pa nyid dang 'gyur ba med pa yin gyi /
translated: Stability should be seen as a continuous process.üîΩIt is due to the cause of the mind being withdrawn that it is still and unchanging.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rgyu las ni sems bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rgyu las ni sems bsdus pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: But it is not the case that the mind is withdrawn due to the cause of being still.

original: des na sems bsdus pa las g-yo ba med pa dang gnas par gsungs so //
analyzed: des na sems bsdus pa las g-yo ba med pa dang gnas par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mind is unmoving when it is concentrated, and it is said to be still when it is not distracted.

original: de ltar gnas pa na gang zhig mig rgyur gyur pas gzugs mthong ba ste lta ba'i mig gis gzugs mthong ba gang yin pa de 'dra ba de ni snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben pa mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yin no
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa na gang zhig mig rgyur gyur pas gzugs mthong ba ste lta ba'i mig gis gzugs mthong ba gang yin pa de 'dra ba de ni snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben pa mngon sum gyis dmigs pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yin no
translated: When it is still in this way, the eye that is the cause of seeing is the eye that sees forms. The eye that sees forms is the cognition that arises from the sense faculty, which is directly perceived and free from the appearance of conceptual thought.

original: // 'di nyid legs par bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: // 'di nyid legs par bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to establish this point, it is said:

original: brjod pa rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba med pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de ni srog chags thams cad kyis mngon sum nyid du myong zhing nges pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba med pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de ni srog chags thams cad kyis mngon sum nyid du myong zhing nges pa yin no //
translated: The appearance that is free from the appearance of conceptual thought is directly experienced and ascertained by all living beings.

original: thams cad smos pa ni srog chags thams cad kyi rgyu mngon sum ma yin yang 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gang la yod pa de thams cad gcig la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang gi rgyud bzhin du thams cad la khyad par med
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni srog chags thams cad kyi rgyu mngon sum ma yin yang 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gang la yod pa de thams cad gcig la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang gi rgyud bzhin du thams cad la khyad par med
translated: The reason for mentioning all is this: although the cause of all living beings is not directly perceived, whatever is directly perceived as having such a nature is all the same in being without difference in one or the other, and therefore there is no difference between all of them, just as there is no difference between one‚Äôs own continuum and another‚Äôs.

original: par bstan pa'i @65a * //
analyzed: par bstan pa'i @65a * //
translated: This is taught in order to show that.

original: phyir ro // gzhan gyi rgyud gzhan gyi mngon sum du 'dod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang snang ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs ci 'dra ba ste de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa gzhan thams cad kyang de 'dra ba las mi ldog
analyzed: phyir ro // gzhan gyi rgyud gzhan gyi mngon sum du 'dod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang snang ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs ci 'dra ba ste de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa gzhan thams cad kyang de 'dra ba las mi ldog
translated: Even though it is not accepted that the continuum of another is the direct perception of another, still, whatever is the nature of the person who possesses the apprehension of the nature of appearance, the nature of the apprehension of all others is not different from that.

original: pa'i phyir thams cad kyang gcig bzhin du grub bo //
analyzed: pa'i phyir thams cad kyang gcig bzhin du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, all are established as being the same as one.

original: dngos po gang mngon sum gyi grub pa de la ni tshad ma gzhan gyi byed pa don med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gang mngon sum gyi grub pa de la ni tshad ma gzhan gyi byed pa don med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the operation of another valid cognition is meaningless with regard to any thing that is established by direct perception, it is said:

original: 'di la sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di la sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes smos so //
translated: What else is there to do here?

original: 'di snyam du gang gi phyir de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa yod kyang mi rtogs pa'i phyir g-yo ba med par 'dod pa na mthong ba'i gnas skabs su snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben par ma grub pa yin nam zhes bya ba de bsal ba'i phyir gang
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gi phyir de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa yod kyang mi rtogs pa'i phyir g-yo ba med par 'dod pa na mthong ba'i gnas skabs su snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben par ma grub pa yin nam zhes bya ba de bsal ba'i phyir gang
translated: If you think that when there is a conceptual thought at that time, it is not understood because it is not admitted that there is movement, then the absence of the conceptual thought that is the basis of seeing is not established.üîΩIn order to dispel that, he says,

original: gis yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gis yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: because of which, even though it exists, etc.

original: gang gis de rig par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis yod pa bdog pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba tshor bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis de rig par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis yod pa bdog pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba tshor bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of which, it is not understood that it exists, it is not realized, it is not experienced.

original: 'di dag smos pa ni rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum nyid yin par bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dag smos pa ni rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum nyid yin par bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The point of mentioning these is to show that conceptual thought is direct perception.

original: rig par mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni nyams su myong ba ma nges pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rig par mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni nyams su myong ba ma nges pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not that it is not understood, it is not that the experience is not ascertained.

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis nyams su myong ba nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis nyams su myong ba nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of this is that the experience of the two negations is ascertained.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yod pa dang med pa dag ston to //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gis ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yod pa dang med pa dag ston to //
translated: By arising and ceasing, the cause of conceptualization is shown to be existent and nonexistent.

original: 'dir don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don 'di yin te /
translated: Here, this is the meaning:

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i gnas skabs rtogs pa des na ldog pa'i rang bzhin yang rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i gnas skabs rtogs pa des na ldog pa'i rang bzhin yang rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Because the state of arising is realized, the nature of cessation is also realized.

original: ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is ascertained as cessation itself.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin par 'dod de /
translated: Here, this is the meaning that is accepted:

original: nyams su myong bas ma rtogs pa yin na ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas ma rtogs pa yin na ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not realized through experience, that is not reasonable.

original: rang rig pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would prove reflexive awareness.

original: dper na skad cig bzhin du nyams su myong yang ma nges pas ma rtogs pa yin na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na skad cig bzhin du nyams su myong yang ma nges pas ma rtogs pa yin na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, if it is not realized because it is experienced but not ascertained, that is also unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rang gi don 'dzin pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rang gi don 'dzin pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: Because this is the apprehension of one's own object by conceptual thoughts.

original: 'di lta ste yul yongs su gcod pa'o //üîΩbdag nyid byed pa por gyur pas yul yongs su gcod pa na yang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste yul yongs su gcod pa'o // bdag nyid byed pa por gyur pas yul yongs su gcod pa na yang /
translated: It is as follows: the determination of the object.üîΩWhen the self, as the agent, determines the object,üîΩ

original: bdag nyid kyang de'i khyad par du gyur pas yongs su bcad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang de'i khyad par du gyur pas yongs su bcad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when the object is apprehended by the self, which is the agent, the self is also apprehended as a particular of that object.

original: dper na rnam @65b par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas don mthong ba na rang gi bdag nyid kyang nyams su myong ba'i phyir mthu las de'i 'og tu 'di bdag gis mthong ngo zhes de'i byed pas khyad par du byas pa'i don nges pa skye ba de bzhin
analyzed: dper na rnam @65b par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas don mthong ba na rang gi bdag nyid kyang nyams su myong ba'i phyir mthu las de'i 'og tu 'di bdag gis mthong ngo zhes de'i byed pas khyad par du byas pa'i don nges pa skye ba de bzhin
translated: For example, when an object is seen by a nonconceptual cognition, the self is also experienced, and subsequently, the cognition of the object qualified by the action of the self arises, as in ‚ÄúI see this.‚Äù

original: du rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam par brtag par bya ba la bdag gis 'di ltar brtags so zhes nges pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: du rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam par brtag par bya ba la bdag gis 'di ltar brtags so zhes nges pa skye ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the cognition of the object qualified by the action of conceptualization arises, as in ‚ÄúI have conceptualized this object in this way.‚Äù

original: dran ba'i sa bon 'jog pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba nges pa yin yang phyis mi dran pa yin no zhe na yang de lta na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran ba'i sa bon 'jog pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba nges pa yin yang phyis mi dran pa yin no zhe na yang de lta na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the experience is not remembered later because the capacity to deposit the seed of memory is absent, then that is not logical.

original: gang gi phyir brgyal ba la sogs pas nyams pa'i yid ni nus pa med par mthong gi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brgyal ba la sogs pas nyams pa'i yid ni nus pa med par mthong gi /
translated: Because the mind that is impaired by fainting and so on is seen to be powerless,

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not one that is abiding in its intrinsic nature.

original: 'di snyam du chags pa'i yul mthong ba'i don gzhan gyis yul gzhan la rnam par rtog pa bskal pa yin pa des na rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po yang dran par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yod kyang ma rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chags pa'i yul mthong ba'i don gzhan gyis yul gzhan la rnam par rtog pa bskal pa yin pa des na rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po yang dran par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa yod kyang ma rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that when one sees an object of attachment, the object of another conception is interrupted, and therefore the object of conception is remembered, then conception exists but is not realized.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs mthong ba'i rang bzhin rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa na chags pa khyad par med kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs mthong ba'i rang bzhin rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa na chags pa khyad par med kyang /
translated: Because when the nature of seeing form engages without interruption, attachment is not distinguished.

original: gnas skabs kyi cha 'ga' zhig tu ni rnam par rtog pa dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi cha 'ga' zhig tu ni rnam par rtog pa dran pa ma yin te /
translated: In some part of the state, conception is not remembered.

original: brtan par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brtan par brjod pa'o //
translated: This is a stable statement.

original: kha cig tu ni dran pa nyid bsdus pa las langs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin par ro //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni dran pa nyid bsdus pa las langs pa'i gnas skabs gang yin par ro //
translated: In some cases, it is the state of rising from the collected state of memory.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i don nges par byed nus pa'i mthong ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i don nges par byed nus pa'i mthong ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is seeing that is able to ascertain the object seen.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, seeing is either the seeing that is able to ascertain its object or else it is the conception that has the aspect of determining the object to be examined.

original: de'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni de 'chad pa'i tshe bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi zhen pa skyed nus par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni de 'chad pa'i tshe bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi zhen pa skyed nus par mthong ngo //
translated: The continuum of that is engaged because it is seen that it is able to generate the conception that has it as its object at the time of explaining it.

original: dus gzhan du dran par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dus gzhan du dran par 'gyur ram /
translated: It is remembered at another time.

original: rgyu gzhan 'ga' zhig las ma gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan 'ga' zhig las ma gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: It is not the case that it is not from some other cause.

original: rgyun gyi mthar byung ba'i zhen pa ni mngon sum gyis shes pa tsam gyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyi mthar byung ba'i zhen pa ni mngon sum gyis shes pa tsam gyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: The conception that occurs at the end of the continuum is the cause of mere knowledge by direct perception.

original: rgyun chad pa na yang yongs su gcod par byed par nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i myong ba zhen par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa na yang yongs su gcod par byed par nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i myong ba zhen par byed pa nyid do //
translated: When the continuum is interrupted, the experience that is the cause of the ascertainment is the conception that conceives the experience.

original: 'dir gzugs gcig lta ba'i skabs yin yang dus ci tsam gnas nas rang gi rgyud la zhen par byed kyang rnam par rtog par ni zhen par mi byed la /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs gcig lta ba'i skabs yin yang dus ci tsam gnas nas rang gi rgyud la zhen par byed kyang rnam par rtog par ni zhen par mi byed la /
translated: Here, even though it is the occasion of seeing one form, for as long as it endures, it is conceived in one‚Äôs continuum, but it is not conceived as a conception.

original: phyis ni rang gi rgyud la zhen pa dang rnam par rtog pa yang sdom par byed pa yin no //üîΩdes na mngon du @66a * //
analyzed: phyis ni rang gi rgyud la zhen pa dang rnam par rtog pa yang sdom par byed pa yin no // des na mngon du @66a * //
translated: Later, he also restrains the conceptualization that is attachment to his own continuum.

original: byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam las byung ba'i zhen pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam las byung ba'i zhen pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is without conceptualization because he is without attachment that arises from mere conceptualization that is manifest.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúIn this way‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba de ni re zhig gzugs rgyun du mthong nas de'i 'og tu bdag gis dus 'di tsam 'das kyi bar ci zhig mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba de ni re zhig gzugs rgyun du mthong nas de'i 'og tu bdag gis dus 'di tsam 'das kyi bar ci zhig mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù means that, having seen form as continuous, he then thinks, ‚ÄúFor this long a time, what will I see?‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par brtag pa yang gang gi tshe bdag gis ci zhig rnam par brtags zhes rnam par rtog pa'i rgyud sdom pa de'i tshe /üîΩsngar ni kho bo rnam rtog 'di 'drar gyur //
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa yang gang gi tshe bdag gis ci zhig rnam par brtags zhes rnam par rtog pa'i rgyud sdom pa de'i tshe / sngar ni kho bo rnam rtog 'di 'drar gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization‚Äù is when he thinks, ‚ÄúWhat have I conceptualized?‚Äù and restrains the continuum of conceptualization.

original: ces rig pa yin te /
analyzed: ces rig pa yin te /
translated: At that time, he knows, ‚ÄúPreviously, I was like this in terms of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: kho bos gzugs 'di mthong zhing de la yang 'di ltar brtags so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: kho bos gzugs 'di mthong zhing de la yang 'di ltar brtags so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: He knows, ‚ÄúI saw this form and I conceptualized it in this way.‚Äù

original: sngar bshad rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad rang bzhin te /
translated: The author of the treatise replies:

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsdus par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs kyi dbang po las rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsdus par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs kyi dbang po las rtogs pa ste /
translated: The conceptual thought that is included in the previously mentioned nature of conceptual thought is understood in terms of the state of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa la ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa la ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for the consciousness that is based on the sense faculty.

original: rang gi rgyud la lta bar byed kyang rnam par rtog pa ni cung zad kyang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la lta bar byed kyang rnam par rtog pa ni cung zad kyang rtogs pa med do //
translated: Even though it observes its own continuum, it does not understand anything at all.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rgyun du mthong ba'i gzugs de nyid la rtogs pa po bar du rtogs par byed pa na /
analyzed: rgyun du mthong ba'i gzugs de nyid la rtogs pa po bar du rtogs par byed pa na /
translated: When the perceiver of a form that is seen continuously is in the middle of perceiving,

original: rnam par rtog pa zhen pa med la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhen pa med la /
translated: conceptual thought is not attached.

original: phyis mthong ba'i gzugs de nyid la ji ltar yang brtags nas rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad pa'i dus su sngar gyi gnas skabs la brtags na /
analyzed: phyis mthong ba'i gzugs de nyid la ji ltar yang brtags nas rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad pa'i dus su sngar gyi gnas skabs la brtags na /
translated: Later, when the form that is seen is investigated in any way, and when the time of the cessation of conceptual thought has arrived, if the previous state is investigated,

original: kho bos ni 'di ltar brtags so zhes rnam par rtog pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bos ni 'di ltar brtags so zhes rnam par rtog pa nges pa yin no //
translated: conceptual thought is ascertained as ‚ÄúI investigated this.‚Äù

original: des na gal te gnas skabs de gnyis su rnam par rtog pa yod pa dang med pa ma yin na gzugs mthong bar mtshungs pa la dus cung zad cig ni rtog pa med par mthong bar zhen cing /
analyzed: des na gal te gnas skabs de gnyis su rnam par rtog pa yod pa dang med pa ma yin na gzugs mthong bar mtshungs pa la dus cung zad cig ni rtog pa med par mthong bar zhen cing /
translated: Therefore, if there is no difference in the presence or absence of conceptual thought in these two situations, then why is it that, in the case of seeing form, one is aware of a time when one sees without conceptual thought,üîΩand why is one aware of a time when one sees with conceptual thought?

original: yang cung zhig ni rnam par rtog pa can du zhen pa ci'i phyir don 'di dag nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa de zhes bya ba ni gzugs lta ba'o //
analyzed: yang cung zhig ni rnam par rtog pa can du zhen pa ci'i phyir don 'di dag nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa de zhes bya ba ni gzugs lta ba'o //
translated: In order to resolve this question, he says, ‚ÄúThe seeing of form is like this.‚Äù

original: bsdus pa ni mngon sum rnam par rtog pa can du smra ba'i ltar na ni rnam par rtog pa shas chung bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni mngon sum rnam par rtog pa can du smra ba'i ltar na ni rnam par rtog pa shas chung bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: In the case of the theory of direct perception with conceptual thought, conceptual thought is weak,

original: nged kyi ltar na ni thams cad du log pa'o //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni thams cad du log pa'o //
translated: but in our theory it is completely absent.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bsdus pa de las langs te log sems gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bsdus pa de las langs te log sems gang la yod pa'o //
translated: One who has arisen from such a state of concentration has a mind that is turned away from that.

original: cung zad ces bya ba ni mthong ba chags par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba ni mthong ba chags par gyur pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúA little‚Äù means that the seeing is attached or

original: gzhan la rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: it is understood by another.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni phyis te rnam par @66b rtog pa'i rgyun chad pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni phyis te rnam par @66b rtog pa'i rgyun chad pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù means later, at the time of the cessation of the stream of conceptualization.

original: sngar gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pas na chad pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pas na chad pa yin la /
translated: The stream of previous conceptualization is ‚Äúcut off‚Äù because a conceptualization of a different type is produced.

original: rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang sngar dngos po rnam par rtog pa las phyis rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang sngar dngos po rnam par rtog pa las phyis rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in type is because of the conceptualization of an entity previously and the conceptualization of a conceptualization later.

original: rang gi sems kyi rgyun ni rgyud do //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi rgyun ni rgyud do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe stream of one‚Äôs own mind‚Äù is a continuum.

original: rigs du ma'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa sdom par byed cing gcig tu byas nas 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rigs du ma'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa sdom par byed cing gcig tu byas nas 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It is a collection of conceptualizations of various types. Having collected them and made them one, one holds them.

original: ril por byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ril por byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmakes a unity‚Äù is ‚Äúmakes a whole.‚Äù

original: 'di 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdom pa'i rnam pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdom pa'i rnam pa nyid ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù and so on indicates the form of the collection.

original: 'di 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu'i rnam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means ‚Äúof this kind.‚Äù

original: rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po tha dad pa las de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po tha dad pa las de'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The different aspects of the conceptual thought are different from the different things that are conceptually differentiated.

original: 'di dang 'di 'dra ba zhes bya bas kyang bsdoms pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba tha dad pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di 'dra ba zhes bya bas kyang bsdoms pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba tha dad pa ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike this and that‚Äù indicates the different appearances of the conceptual thought that is a composite.

original: bsdus pa'i gnas skabs mthar thug pa na rang gi sems kyi rgyud sdom par byed kyang rnam par rtog pa'i zhen pa med do zhes sngar nyid du bshad pa de'i phyir na 'di dag mngon sum yin na rnam par rtog pa log pa'i mthong ba la ci'i phyirüîΩrtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i gnas skabs mthar thug pa na rang gi sems kyi rgyud sdom par byed kyang rnam par rtog pa'i zhen pa med do zhes sngar nyid du bshad pa de'i phyir na 'di dag mngon sum yin na rnam par rtog pa log pa'i mthong ba la ci'i phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: We have already explained that, in the final stage of the composite, the continuum of one‚Äôs mind is bound, but there is no conceptual attachment. Therefore, if these are direct perceptions, why would the vision of the cessation of conceptual thought not be understood?

original: sdom pa'i shes pas ji ltar mi 'dzin zhes 'di tshad ma'i 'bras bu bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa'i shes pas ji ltar mi 'dzin zhes 'di tshad ma'i 'bras bu bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Why would the cognition of the composite not apprehend it? This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: rgyun gang zhig mngon sum du byas pa de ni rgyun chad pa'i tshe na sdom pa'i shes pas 'dzin par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyun gang zhig mngon sum du byas pa de ni rgyun chad pa'i tshe na sdom pa'i shes pas 'dzin par nus pa yin te /
translated: The continuum that is made manifest can be apprehended by the cognition of the composite when the continuum is severed.

original: dper na mthong ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun gang yin pa de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mthong ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun gang yin pa de nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the continuum of a visible form that is seen.

original: de bzhin du rtog pa yang mngon sum du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtog pa yang mngon sum du byas pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, an inference is also made manifest.

original: rgyun mthar thug pa na 'jug pa'i nges par 'dzin pa'i shes pas gzung ba'i rgyu mtshan ni mngon sum tsam yin te /
analyzed: rgyun mthar thug pa na 'jug pa'i nges par 'dzin pa'i shes pas gzung ba'i rgyu mtshan ni mngon sum tsam yin te /
translated: At the end of the continuum, the reason that is apprehended by a cognition that ascertains the engagement is a mere direct perception,

original: gang gi phyir de rgyu med pa can ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rgyu med pa can ma yin la /
translated: because it is not without a cause,

original: mngon sum gyi byed pa las rgyun gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi byed pa las rgyun gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because there is no continuum that is other than the activity of a direct perception.

original: mngon sum yod pa nyid yin yang de med na ni de de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mngon sum yod pa nyid yin yang de med na ni de de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Even though a direct perception exists, if it does not exist, it would not be the cause of that.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum rgyu yin par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum rgyu yin par mthong ba yin no //
translated: However, it is seen that a direct perception is a cause.

original: des na khyab par byed pa med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs mi 'jug pas rang gi bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs mi 'jug pas rang gi bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Therefore, because there is no pervasion, the reason does not apply to the discordant side. Because it is pervaded by its own probandum, it is a reason based on a nature.

original: mngon sum du gyur kyang rgyun chad pa'i mthar 'byung ba'i zhen par byed pa'i shes pas de la @67a * //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur kyang rgyun chad pa'i mthar 'byung ba'i zhen par byed pa'i shes pas de la @67a * //
translated: Even though it is manifest, it is not apprehended by a cognition that would cause it to be conceived as existing at the end of a continuum.

original: gzung ba med pa de'i phyir de'i tshe de dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa de'i phyir de'i tshe de dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, at that time, it is not an object of apprehension.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that the non-apprehension of what is suitable to appear establishes the convention of non-existence, the summary is taught.

original: bltar rung ba ma dmigs pa las kyang med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mjug bsdu ba bstan pa des na de'i phyir mthong ba'i bdag nyid 'di mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis gzung ba'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba ma dmigs pa las kyang med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mjug bsdu ba bstan pa des na de'i phyir mthong ba'i bdag nyid 'di mngon sum zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis gzung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this very seeing is called ‚Äúperception,‚Äù which is the apprehension by reflexive awareness.

original: ma 'dres pa ni rtogs pa dang de'i bdag nyid dang mi ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni rtogs pa dang de'i bdag nyid dang mi ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnmixed‚Äù means that which is not possessed by the realization and its nature.

original: 'am smos pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'am smos pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates the consideration of the conceptualization that will be explained.

original: 'dis ni bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa la khyad par med pa'i mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa la khyad par med pa'i mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: This non-apprehension, which is not distinguished in the negation of identity, is presented as the very reason.

original: de rnam par rtog pa de'i bdag nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi shes pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa de'i bdag nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi shes pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the nature of that conception is not observed, this direct perception does not have the nature of conception.

original: bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa la ni snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis khyad par du byas pa la dgos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi gzhan 'gog pa la ni dgos pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa la ni snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis khyad par du byas pa la dgos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi gzhan 'gog pa la ni dgos pa yod pa yin no //
translated: In the refutation of identity, there is no purpose at all in qualifying it with the word ‚Äúappearance.‚Äù But in the refutation of difference, there is a purpose.üîΩThus, even those who assert that the invisible, such as the smell of things, is different from the visible, blue, refute the identity of the invisible with the nature of the visible.

original: 'di ltar mi snang ba sha za la sogs pa snang ba'i sngon po las rnam pa tha dad par dam bcas pa rnams kyang ji srid du snang ba'i rang bzhin de la de'i bdag nyid yin pa 'gog par byed pa de ji srid du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyidüîΩdu gyur pa khas blangs pa nyid las yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi snang ba sha za la sogs pa snang ba'i sngon po las rnam pa tha dad par dam bcas pa rnams kyang ji srid du snang ba'i rang bzhin de la de'i bdag nyid yin pa 'gog par byed pa de ji srid du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa khas blangs pa nyid las yin te /
translated: As long as they refute the identity of the invisible with the nature of the visible, they are, by their very assertion,

original: gal te snang ba'i don 'di sha za yin na ni rang gi rnam pa kho na dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te snang ba'i don 'di sha za yin na ni rang gi rnam pa kho na dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: engaged in the ascertainment of the nature of the visible. If the object of the visible were a smell, it would be perceived only in its own form.

original: des na snang ba'i rang bzhin la sha za 'gog pa ni snang ba nyid kyis byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na snang ba'i rang bzhin la sha za 'gog pa ni snang ba nyid kyis byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of appearance is what prevents the existence of the flesh-eater, and it is appearance itself that does so.

original: 'dir ni gcig mngon sum du byed pas de las gzhan 'gog pa yin la ;
analyzed: 'dir ni gcig mngon sum du byed pas de las gzhan 'gog pa yin la ;
translated: Here, by the perception of one thing, the other is excluded.

original: tha snyad ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa khyad par med pas byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa khyad par med pas byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Convention is performed by the absence of non-perception, because there is no error, and this is the ultimate.

original: yang na mthong ba gzhir gyur pa la snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: yang na mthong ba gzhir gyur pa la snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: Or, it is based on seeing, by the nature of appearance.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi snang bas te ma dmigs pas ni spangs pa yin no zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi snang bas te ma dmigs pas ni spangs pa yin no zhes 'brel te /
translated: By the non-appearance, the non-perception, of the conceptual thought that has the characteristic of apprehension, the abandonment is connected.

original: dbang po'i shes pa la gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa ste rtog pa yod pa'i tha snyad gang byas pa de bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa ste rtog pa yod pa'i tha snyad gang byas pa de bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Any convention that is made by another conceptual thought, by conceptualization, in regard to the sense consciousness, that is refuted.

original: 'dis kyang dbang po'i shes pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod par dam bcas pa la mi dmigs pa khyad par can 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs su @67b bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang dbang po'i shes pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod par dam bcas pa la mi dmigs pa khyad par can 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs su @67b bkod pa yin no //
translated: This is the proof that refutes the special non-apprehension of the thesis that there is a conception that is different from the sense consciousness.

original: gcig pa 'gog pa la ni khyad par med pas byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa 'gog pa la ni khyad par med pas byed pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference in the refutation of identity, it is the proof.

original: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid la ni rnam par rtog pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid can du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bdag nyid la ni rnam par rtog pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid can du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they were different, the conception would not have the nature of seeing.

original: de la yod par ni 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de la yod par ni 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: It would be as if it existed there.

original: dper na bltar mi rung ba 'ga' zhig sa phyogs la brten par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bltar mi rung ba 'ga' zhig sa phyogs la brten par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it would be as if something invisible were to be based on a place.

original: des na tha dad pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma dmigs pa gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma dmigs pa gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of the characteristic of the object of the refutation of difference is taught as the proof.

original: ji ltar bum pa dang sa phyogs dag dbang po gcig gis gzung ba yin pas phan tshun 'khrul pa med par dmigs pa ni shes pa gcig la 'dre ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag rgyud gcig la
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa dang sa phyogs dag dbang po gcig gis gzung ba yin pas phan tshun 'khrul pa med par dmigs pa ni shes pa gcig la 'dre ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa dag rgyud gcig la
translated: In the same way, here, seeing and conception exist in a single continuum.

original: yod pa'i rang rig la 'khrul pa med par dmigs pa na shes pa gcig la tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i rang rig la 'khrul pa med par dmigs pa na shes pa gcig la tshogs pa yin no //
translated: When they are observed without confusion in reflexive awareness, they are combined in a single cognition.

original: yid la brten nas skyes pa rgyud gcig la yod pa de dag ni nyams su myong bar byed pa gcig gis lhan cig nyid du nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: yid la brten nas skyes pa rgyud gcig la yod pa de dag ni nyams su myong bar byed pa gcig gis lhan cig nyid du nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: Those that arise in dependence on the mind and exist in a single continuum are experienced by a single experiencer,

original: gcig nyams su myong na gnyis pa yang myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyams su myong na gnyis pa yang myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one is experienced, the other is also experienced.

original: de'i phyir de ltar g-yo ba med par mthong ba'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pa la mi dmigs pa ni gcig yin pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa tsam gyis bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar g-yo ba med par mthong ba'i gnas skabs su rnam par rtog pa la mi dmigs pa ni gcig yin pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa tsam gyis bkag pa yin la /
translated: Thus, in the state of seeing without movement, the nonobservation of conception is one, and the negation of being one is merely nonobservation.

original: tha dad pa nyid kyang khyad par can gyi mi dmigs pas bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyang khyad par can gyi mi dmigs pas bkag pa yin no //
translated: The difference is also refuted by the non-apprehension of the qualified.

original: skabs su babs pa mi snang ba'i gzhi mthong ba spangs nas dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi gzhan dgod pa ni dbang po'i shes pa mtha' dag yul nyid du bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: skabs su babs pa mi snang ba'i gzhi mthong ba spangs nas dbang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi gzhan dgod pa ni dbang po'i shes pa mtha' dag yul nyid du bstan pa'i don te /
translated: Having abandoned the non-appearing basis that is relevant, the setting forth of another basis called ‚Äúsense consciousness‚Äù is for the purpose of teaching that all sense consciousnesses are objects.

original: 'di ltar mi dmigs pas rang gi yul du gyur pa'i phyogs gcig la rnam par rtog pas ston par bstan pas kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dmigs pas rang gi yul du gyur pa'i phyogs gcig la rnam par rtog pas ston par bstan pas kyang /
translated: Thus, by teaching that the conception of one part of the object that is its domain is by non-apprehension,

original: rgyu 'dra ba can gyi dbang po'i shes pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no zhes don gyis bstan no //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba can gyi dbang po'i shes pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no zhes don gyis bstan no //
translated: the sense consciousnesses that have similar causes are all non-conceptual.

original: des na phyogs gcig la 'jug pa de nyid ni dbang po'i shes pa thams cad la rtog pa spong par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs gcig la 'jug pa de nyid ni dbang po'i shes pa thams cad la rtog pa spong par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, just that engagement in one part is the refutation of conception in all sense consciousnesses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rnam par rtog pa med pa sgrub pa'i 'thad pa ma bkod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rnam par rtog pa med pa sgrub pa'i 'thad pa ma bkod de /
translated: For that very reason, the master DignƒÅga did not set forth a proof of non-conceptuality.

original: de ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: It is established by direct perception.

original: gzhan du na phyogs gcig la spangs pas thams cad de'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na phyogs gcig la spangs pas thams cad de'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the abandonment of one part make the whole have that nature?

original: @68a * // shes pa nyams su myong bar nges pas shes pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas bsgrub byar med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: @68a * // shes pa nyams su myong bar nges pas shes pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas bsgrub byar med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that since the experience of consciousness is certain, the convention of the absence of other consciousnesses is established by non-apprehension, that is not so.

original: bden te / yul tha dad pas tha dad pa'i rig pa rnams ni gcig rig pa'i tha snyad kyis gzhan med par tha snyad du byed pa yin no //üîΩg-yo ba med pa'i mthong ba la ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: bden te / yul tha dad pas tha dad pa'i rig pa rnams ni gcig rig pa'i tha snyad kyis gzhan med par tha snyad du byed pa yin no // g-yo ba med pa'i mthong ba la ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: It is true, but the different cognitions due to different objects are conventionally designated as the absence of other by the convention of the cognition of one.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan dang yul gcig pa nyid du pha rol gyis brtags pa yin pa des na rnam par rtog pa ma dmigs kyang the tshom za bas 'bad pas sgrub pa dang med pa'i tha snyad du yang bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan dang yul gcig pa nyid du pha rol gyis brtags pa yin pa des na rnam par rtog pa ma dmigs kyang the tshom za bas 'bad pas sgrub pa dang med pa'i tha snyad du yang bya ba yin no ;
translated: In the case of non-moving seeing, the opponent imagines the identity of conceptualization or the identity of another conceptualization to be the same as the object. Therefore, even though conceptualization is not apprehended, there is doubt. Therefore, it is to be established with effort, and the convention of absence is also to be applied.

original: / gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpyod pa po'i dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
analyzed: / gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpyod pa po'i dogs pa bsu bar byed do //
translated: By whoever and so on, he anticipates the doubt of the investigator.

original: gang gi phyir de rnam par rtog pa snang ba mi dmigs pa ma bzod nas smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnam par rtog pa snang ba mi dmigs pa ma bzod nas smras pa /
translated: Since he cannot bear the non-apprehension of the appearance of conceptualization, he says:

original: blo mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition is not manifest.

original: de don mngon sum du byed pa nyid yin yang blo ni mngon sum du yang bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de don mngon sum du byed pa nyid yin yang blo ni mngon sum du yang bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though it makes the object manifest, the cognition is not made manifest.

original: gal te blo mngon sum yin na cir 'gyur zhes dogs pa la smras pa /
analyzed: gal te blo mngon sum yin na cir 'gyur zhes dogs pa la smras pa /
translated: If the cognition is manifest, what follows?

original: blo mngon sum nyid yin pa gang gis dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa ste rnam par rtog pa can no //
analyzed: blo mngon sum nyid yin pa gang gis dbang po'i shes pa rnam par rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa ste rnam par rtog pa can no //
translated: Since the cognition is manifest, the sense perception is conceptual, that is, it has conceptualization.

original: des khas blangs par gyur pa la gnod pa 'gal bar 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: des khas blangs par gyur pa la gnod pa 'gal bar 'gyur ba'o//
translated: By that, the acceptance is undermined, that is, contradicted.

original: 'di skad du brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te blo mngon sum yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa dang mthong ba mngon sum yin pa'i phyir chos can grub cing gtan tshigs snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid kyang 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te blo mngon sum yin na ni de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa dang mthong ba mngon sum yin pa'i phyir chos can grub cing gtan tshigs snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid kyang 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the mind were direct perception, then at that time, since conceptual thought and seeing would be direct perception, the subject would be established and the sign, the non-observation of the perceptible, would also be established.

original: de nyid ni mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not direct perception.

original: des na mngon sum rnam par rtog pa can du khas blangs kyang snang ba mi dmigs pas cung zad kyang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum rnam par rtog pa can du khas blangs kyang snang ba mi dmigs pas cung zad kyang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though one accepts that direct perception is conceptual, the non-observation of the perceptible does not undermine it in the least.

original: de ni slob dpon de la brgal zhing brtag pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de ni slob dpon de la brgal zhing brtag pa mdzad de /
translated: This is the argument and investigation that the master [DignƒÅga] made.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ming thams cad pa mngon sum gyi tshig gis ni rnam par rtog pa bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ming thams cad pa mngon sum gyi tshig gis ni rnam par rtog pa bzung ba yin te /
translated: The word this is a universal term for direct perception. By the word direct perception, conceptual thought is included.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is explained as conceptual cognition.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don gsal ba na rang nyid gsal bar gyur pa ni rig pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don gsal ba na rang nyid gsal bar gyur pa ni rig pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: When the object that is conceptualized is clear, it itself becomes clear, and that is called cognition.

original: don kyang bkag par thal bar ma gyur cig ces gsal ba'i rang bzhin 'di med do zhes ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don kyang bkag par thal bar ma gyur cig ces gsal ba'i rang bzhin 'di med do zhes ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible to say that the nature of manifestation does not exist, lest the meaning be reduced to a negation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @68b nang du 'du ba la brtag par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @68b nang du 'du ba la brtag par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, he undertakes the examination of the internal composition.

original: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arising is origination.

original: 'gag pa ni ldog pa sta ldog pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa la rig pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni ldog pa sta ldog pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa la rig pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Cessation is reversion; and the determination of the nature of reversion is called knowledge.

original: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim pa ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim pa ston par byed pa ste /
translated: For the time being is an expression that indicates the sequence.

original: blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du thal ba ni re zhig spang dka' ba yin la skyon gzhan yang 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du thal ba ni re zhig spang dka' ba yin la skyon gzhan yang 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: If the intellect is not direct perception, then the experience of non-conceptualization is difficult to avoid for the time being, and other faults will be explained.

original: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di gang zhes bya ba ni gzhi 'dri ba ste dngos po gang zhig la 'di bdag nyid du rnam par gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di gang zhes bya ba ni gzhi 'dri ba ste dngos po gang zhig la 'di bdag nyid du rnam par gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is this conceptualization? is an inquiry into the basis, i.e., what is the entity in which this is present as its nature?

original: don ni 'di yin te re zhig 'di yod pa ni bzlog par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te re zhig 'di yod pa ni bzlog par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: The meaning is as follows: First, the existence of this cannot be refuted.

original: nyams su myong bar yod pa 'di yang shes bya'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: nyams su myong bar yod pa 'di yang shes bya'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ram /
translated: And this experience exists as the nature of the object of cognition.

original: shes bya'i bdag nyid 'gyur zhes gang ston pa ni don nam blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i bdag nyid 'gyur zhes gang ston pa ni don nam blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is taught by ‚Äúas the nature of the object of cognition‚Äù? The meaning is ‚Äúas the nature of the mind.‚Äù

original: don ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gis brtags pa bdag nyid 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: don ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gis brtags pa bdag nyid 'gog par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object is not‚Äù means that he refutes the nature imagined by himself.

original: bdag tu gnas pa ni nang ste phyi rol gyi don las tha dad par bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnas nyid du yongs su gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu gnas pa ni nang ste phyi rol gyi don las tha dad par bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnas nyid du yongs su gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in the self‚Äù is the internal, because it is clearly the basis of the apprehension of the self as different from the external object.

original: yongs su gsal ba ni snang ba ste rang gi ngo bor gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba ni snang ba ste rang gi ngo bor gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúClearly‚Äù means appearance, which means ‚Äúclear in its own nature.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnas su yod pa yin la ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnas su yod pa yin la ;
translated: Whatever is imagined exists as the basis of the apprehension of the self.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma yin par snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma yin par snang ngo //
translated: The object imagined does not appear as the basis of the apprehension of the self.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don ni yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel par snang la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don ni yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel par snang la /
translated: Because the object of conceptualization appears as connected with a particular place,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de'i yul can ma yin pa nang du nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de'i yul can ma yin pa nang du nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: and conceptualization, which is not the object of that, abides internally.

original: de bzhin du rnam bar rtog pa ni da ltar gyi dus su bdag rnam par rtog par byed do zhes 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam bar rtog pa ni da ltar gyi dus su bdag rnam par rtog par byed do zhes 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, conceptualization is apprehended as the self that is conceptualizing in the present time.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i don ni 'das pa'am ma 'ongs par rnam par rtog pa las tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i don ni 'das pa'am ma 'ongs par rnam par rtog pa las tha dad pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And the object of conceptualization is apprehended as distinct from the conceptualization of the past and future.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan bshad pa /
translated: Another reason is stated:

original: 'dod pa ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni bsam pa'o //
translated: Desire is intention.

original: de'i dbang ni mthu ste des skye ba dang 'gag pa de dag rigs pa ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang ni mthu ste des skye ba dang 'gag pa de dag rigs pa ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: The power of that is the force of that, and it is unreasonable that those are produced and cease due to that.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni 'dod pa'i stobs kyis skye ba dang 'gag par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni 'dod pa'i stobs kyis skye ba dang 'gag par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is unreasonable that external objects are produced and cease due to the force of desire.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di ni 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis skye ba dang 'gag pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur @69a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di ni 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis skye ba dang 'gag pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur @69a * //
translated: This conceptualization arises and ceases due to the cause of desire. How can it be external?

original: te ; 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: te ; 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
translated: It is different because it possesses contradictory properties.

original: de ltar gyi don dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis skyed pa'am 'gag par byar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi don dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis skyed pa'am 'gag par byar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of that conceptualization, whether past or future, cannot be produced or caused to cease by the power of desire.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the past and future do not exist,

original: da ltar byung ba la yang 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la yang 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the present is not subject to the power of desire.

original: de'i phyir de ltar nang du yongs su gsal ba dang 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi rol gzung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar nang du yongs su gsal ba dang 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi rol gzung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid do //
