translated: Thus, because it is clearly internal and because it possesses arising and ceasing due to the power of desire, it is not external by nature as the object of perception.

original: de'i phyir 'dir te nang du yongs su gsal ba dang 'dod pa'i dbang gis skye ba dang 'gag pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir te nang du yongs su gsal ba dang 'dod pa'i dbang gis skye ba dang 'gag pa dag tu'o //
translated: Therefore, here, i.e., internally, in the state of full evidence, and in the state of origination and cessation, by the power of desire.

original: gal te yang mi rigs pa'i sgra mthar gnas pa'i bsdu ba yin pa de lta na yang don gyi shugs kyis skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang mi rigs pa'i sgra mthar gnas pa'i bsdu ba yin pa de lta na yang don gyi shugs kyis skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: And even if the word ‚Äúhere‚Äù is a locative tatpurusa compound, the meaning is still that origination and cessation are referred to by implication.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba 'dir zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba 'dir zhes 'brel to //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúhere‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúfollowing desire.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: yongs su gsal ba'i rgyur yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i phyir nang du yongs su gsal ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i ched du /
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba'i rgyur yongs su gsal bar bya ba'i phyir nang du yongs su gsal ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i ched du /
translated: In order to make full evidence the cause of full evidence, i.e., in order to experience full evidence,

original: de'i byed pa dang ldan par blo nyid 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i byed pa dang ldan par blo nyid 'gyur ba'am /
translated: the mind itself becomes endowed with its activity,

original: 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'am de'i rgyu mtshan can skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'am de'i rgyu mtshan can skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or it becomes endowed with following desire, or it becomes endowed with origination and cessation, which have that as their reason.

original: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni 'gyur bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni 'gyur bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: Because the apprehension of its nature is called ‚Äúchange.‚Äù

original: nang du yongs su gsal ba dang 'dod pa la rag las pas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni blo nyid la rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nang du yongs su gsal ba dang 'dod pa la rag las pas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni blo nyid la rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to think that the mind itself is that which is fully evident internally, which arises and ceases in dependence on desire, and which apprehends the nature of the object.

original: de ni yongs su gsal ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa dang ldan par 'jug kyang gsal ba ma yin zhing nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yongs su gsal ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa dang ldan par 'jug kyang gsal ba ma yin zhing nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
translated: Although it engages in the object that is fully evident and so on, as previously explained, it is not evident and is not experienced.

original: de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is hidden.

original: 'di snyam du gal te blo lkog tu gyur pa yin pa de lta na yang gsal ba'i don de'i chos rjes su 'brel pa dang ldan par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te blo lkog tu gyur pa yin pa de lta na yang gsal ba'i don de'i chos rjes su 'brel pa dang ldan par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If you think that even though the mind is hidden, it is understood to be connected with the qualities of the evident object,

original: gsal bar byed pa'i chos gsal bar bya ba'i don la bzhag pa des na de nyid du nang du gsal bar gyur pa dang / 'dod pa dang 'brel pas skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan par de'i rang bzhin ma yin par yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i chos gsal bar bya ba'i don la bzhag pa des na de nyid du nang du gsal bar gyur pa dang / 'dod pa dang 'brel pas skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan par de'i rang bzhin ma yin par yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then the qualities that make it evident are placed in the object that is made evident. Therefore, it is understood that the mind is not its nature, since it is not evident internally in the same way, and it arises and ceases in dependence on desire.

original: de ni de lta mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni de lta mi rigs te /
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i gzung ba gsal ba na gsal bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro bas nang du yongs @69b su gsal ba'am 'dod pa'i dbang gis skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid du rtogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i gzung ba gsal ba na gsal bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro bas nang du yongs @69b su gsal ba'am 'dod pa'i dbang gis skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid du rtogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because when the object of the sense faculty is clear, there is no realization of arising and destruction due to the clarity of the internal or due to desire, because it follows the clarity.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsal ba'i don kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsal ba'i don kyang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of the clear is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: de ltar na nang du yongs su gsal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bur 'gyur bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nang du yongs su gsal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bur 'gyur bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the transformation of the internal, such as clarity, is like that.

original: 'di snyam du gsal bar gyur pa'i don yang ma yin la lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gsal bar gyur pa'i don yang ma yin la lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks that the object of the clear is not tenable, nor is the cognition of the hidden tenable,

original: 'on kyang gzhan nyid yin no snyam na 'di nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i don gyi tshogs 'ga' zhig dang rjes su 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan nyid yin no snyam na 'di nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i don gyi tshogs 'ga' zhig dang rjes su 'brel pa ste /
translated: but rather, it is just different, then this is connected to a collection of objects that are experienced.

original: 'brel pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But there is no connection.

original: nyams su myong bar byed pa dang nyams su myong bar bya ba dag las gzhan du gyur pa nyams su myong ba la yang 'di 'dra ba'i chos yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed pa dang nyams su myong bar bya ba dag las gzhan du gyur pa nyams su myong ba la yang 'di 'dra ba'i chos yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And apart from the experience and the object of experience, there is no other experience that has such a nature.

original: nyams su myong ba 'di lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa yin yang lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba 'di lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa yin yang lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And even though it has such a nature, it is not, because it is hidden.

original: don dang rjod pa de dag gi rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: don dang rjod pa de dag gi rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Imagination is that which has the nature of following the meaning and the expression. It has the nature of being mixed with expression.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of experience.

original: nyams su myong ba ni myong ba ste myong bar byed pa dang myong bar byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni myong ba ste myong bar byed pa dang myong bar byed pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Experience is the experiencing of the object of experience and the experiencer.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te /üîΩdes na nyams su myong bar bya ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin te / des na nyams su myong bar bya ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Imagination has the nature of both.üîΩTherefore, it is called the object of experience.

original: nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Or it is called experience.

original: nyams su myong bar byed pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par thal bar bstan to //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par thal bar bstan to //
translated: The author replies: The statement ‚Äúit is experienced‚Äù indicates that there is no conceptual thought.

original: thal ba las bzlog pa yang don gyis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: thal ba las bzlog pa yang don gyis blta bar bya ste /
translated: The reverse of the reductio is to be understood as follows:

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di yod pa nyid yin zhing 'di don kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa 'di ni blo yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di yod pa nyid yin zhing 'di don kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa 'di ni blo yin no //
translated: Since the conceptual thought ‚Äúit is experienced‚Äù exists and since its object is not nonexistent, this cognition is direct perception.

original: gzung ba'i don yod pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa la ni thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i don yod pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa la ni thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This reductio does not apply to the sense consciousnesses because their objects exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la ni de'i tshe don nye bar yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don ni ston par byed pa'i mngon sum 'ga' zhig gis 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir thal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la ni de'i tshe don nye bar yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don ni ston par byed pa'i mngon sum 'ga' zhig gis 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir thal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: It is only to conceptual consciousnesses that this reductio applies, because at that time the object does not exist and because the object is revealed by some direct perception.

original: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa de'i myong ba ni blo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa gang yin pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa de'i myong ba ni blo nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, the experience of pleasure and so on is itself cognition.

original: myong ba ni blo'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba ni blo'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because experience is the nature of cognition.

original: blo de yang lkog tu gyur pa de'i phyir @70a * //
analyzed: blo de yang lkog tu gyur pa de'i phyir @70a * //
translated: And that cognition is hidden.

original: de'i bdag nyid bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yang skyes bu'i lkog tu gyur par skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid bde ba la sogs pa myong ba yang skyes bu'i lkog tu gyur par skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the experience of pleasure, etc., which is of the nature of that, is also hidden to the person.

original: phan par 'dod pa nyams su myong ba dang gnod pa mi 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan par 'dod pa nyams su myong ba dang gnod pa mi 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not experience the desire for benefit, nor the aversion to harm.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal las so //
translated: From that means from pleasure and pain.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis skyes bu la phan pa dang gnod pa ni myong ba'i rang bzhin kho nas yin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis skyes bu la phan pa dang gnod pa ni myong ba'i rang bzhin kho nas yin no //
translated: The benefit and harm to the person from pleasure and pain is only due to the nature of experience.

original: myong ba de'ang lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa las phan pa dang gnod pa dag tu yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: myong ba de'ang lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa las phan pa dang gnod pa dag tu yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And because that experience is hidden, benefit and harm would also be hidden.

original: dper na skyes bu gzhan gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba skyes bu gzhan gyi lkog tu gyur pa de'i phyir pha rol po'i rgyud la yod pa /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gzhan gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba skyes bu gzhan gyi lkog tu gyur pa de'i phyir pha rol po'i rgyud la yod pa /
translated: For example, the experience of the pleasure and pain of another person is hidden to another person.

original: gzhan gyis yang dag par myong ba'i bdag nyid de dag gis phan pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //üîΩbu la sogs pa la bde bar yod par shes pa las phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba gzhan kho na zhig skye ba yin gyi rgyud la yod pa nyid las ni phan pa dang gnod pa ma yin te
analyzed: gzhan gyis yang dag par myong ba'i bdag nyid de dag gis phan pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no // bu la sogs pa la bde bar yod par shes pa las phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba gzhan kho na zhig skye ba yin gyi rgyud la yod pa nyid las ni phan pa dang gnod pa ma yin te
translated: Therefore, the benefit or harm of those that exist in the continuum of another person is not the same as the benefit or harm that exists in one‚Äôs own continuum.üîΩThe pleasure that exists in the continuum of another person is generated from the knowledge that a son and so on exists in a state of pleasure. The benefit and so on that exists in one‚Äôs own continuum is generated from the knowledge that a son and so on exists in a state of pleasure.üîΩThe benefit and harm that exist in one‚Äôs own continuum is not generated from the knowledge that a son and so on exists in a state of pleasure.

original: / de'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dgra la sogs pa'i bde ba shes pa las kyang phan pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa las gnod par yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dgra la sogs pa'i bde ba shes pa las kyang phan pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa las gnod par yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no difference in their nature. It follows that the benefit from the knowledge of the pleasure of an enemy and so on and the harm from the knowledge of the pain of a son and so on would also exist.

original: des na gzhan gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal shes pas ni gzhan la phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal shes pas ni gzhan la phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should see that the knowledge of the pleasure and pain of others does not benefit or harm others.

original: gal te phan pa dang gnod pa ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal des byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te phan pa dang gnod pa ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal des byas pa yin gyi /
translated: But isn‚Äôt benefit and harm produced by one‚Äôs own pleasure and pain that exist in one‚Äôs own continuum?

original: de myong ba mngon du byas pas ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de myong ba mngon du byas pas ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: It is not produced by the actual experience of that.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar gang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa rig pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams gzhan gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar gang gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa rig pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams gzhan gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the yogi/nis who know the pleasure of others, etc., do not have pleasure and pain from the pleasure and pain of others.

original: de lta yin na yang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis phan pa dang gnod par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis phan pa dang gnod par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: But even if that is so, the pleasure and pain that exist in the continuum of another cannot benefit or harm.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa ni nyams su ma myong yang phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa ni nyams su ma myong yang phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But those that exist in one‚Äôs own continuum can benefit and harm even if they are not experienced.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la zas zos pa dang ma zos pa dag gis lus rgyas pa dang zhum pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phan pa dang gnod pa gang yin pa de dag ni nyams su ma myong ba las kyang 'gyur ba yin gyi @70b bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis byas pa
analyzed: 'di la zas zos pa dang ma zos pa dag gis lus rgyas pa dang zhum pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phan pa dang gnod pa gang yin pa de dag ni nyams su ma myong ba las kyang 'gyur ba yin gyi @70b bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis byas pa
translated: In this case, the characteristics of the body‚Äôs growth and decline due to eating and not eating, and the benefits and harms that result, are experienced even when there is no pleasure or pain.

original: ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case with pleasure and pain.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba dag gis gsal ba nyid ni bsnyon par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba dag gis gsal ba nyid ni bsnyon par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the clarity of the experience of pleasure and pain cannot be denied.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis byas pa'i phan pa dang gnod pa ni gsal ba las gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis byas pa'i phan pa dang gnod pa ni gsal ba las gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The benefits and harms caused by pleasure and pain are not different from clarity.

original: gsal ba yang mngon sum du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba yang mngon sum du byas pa yin no //
translated: And clarity is directly perceived.

original: myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi blo ldog tu gyur ba nyid yin na ni gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i myong ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ngan pa dang gnod pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi blo ldog tu gyur ba nyid yin na ni gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i myong ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ngan pa dang gnod pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cognition characterized by experience were to cease, then the clarity of the experience of pleasure and pain would not exist, and the benefits and harms caused by pleasure and pain would not exist.

original: de'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas pas de la rag las pa'i phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal mngon sum du byas pas de la rag las pa'i phan pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since pleasure and pain are directly perceived, the benefit and harm that depend on them are also directly perceived.

original: gang yang rnal 'byor pa rnams gzhan gyi bde bas bde bar mi 'gyur ba de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang rnal 'byor pa rnams gzhan gyi bde bas bde bar mi 'gyur ba de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, it should be said that yogins do not experience pleasure from the pleasure of others.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the basis of self-grasping,

original: myong bar byed pa'i rnam pa'i 'dod pa'i rang bzhin ni skyes bu la phan pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: myong bar byed pa'i rnam pa'i 'dod pa'i rang bzhin ni skyes bu la phan pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: the nature of desire, which is the aspect of experiencing, is the nature of benefiting the person, not the nature of the object of experience,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi las phyi rol du gyur pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi las phyi rol du gyur pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as an external nature from the basis of self-grasping.

original: des na rnal 'byor pa rnams myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa rnams myong bar bya ba'i rnam pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, yogins experience pleasure and pain from the pleasure and pain of the aspect of the object of experience.

original: / bde ba ni phan pa tsam gyi bdag nyid yin zhing phan pa'i bdag nyid kyang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i sim pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: / bde ba ni phan pa tsam gyi bdag nyid yin zhing phan pa'i bdag nyid kyang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i sim pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Happiness is just the nature of benefit, and the nature of benefit is the nature of the satisfaction of the transformation of grasping.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i bde ba ni de tsam nyid yin gyi gzung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i bde ba ni de tsam nyid yin gyi gzung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the happiness of a person is just that, and not the form of grasping.

original: kho bo cag gi bde ba ni 'di tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi bde ba ni 'di tsam nyid yin te /
translated: Our happiness is just this much.

original: gang myong ba zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang myong ba zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is what will be explained as ‚Äúexperience.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa tsam dang gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du mngon sum du byas pa tsam ni phan pa dang gnod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'dzin pa rnam pa'i rang bzhin du gsal ba yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa tsam dang gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid du mngon sum du byas pa tsam ni phan pa dang gnod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'dzin pa rnam pa'i rang bzhin du gsal ba yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mere arising of happiness, etc., and the mere manifestation of the form of grasping are not beneficial or harmful. Rather, it is the manifestation of the form of grasping that is clear.

original: nyes pa gzhan bsags pa'i don du 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan bsags pa'i don du 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show another fault, he says, ‚ÄúThese, etc.‚Äù

original: blo 'di dag mngon sum rgyur gyur pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo 'di dag mngon sum rgyur gyur pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
translated: These cognitions are not the consciousnesses that are the cause of direct perception.

original: ma nges na bdag nyid gzhir gyur pa la rtogs par yang ste shes par ro //
analyzed: ma nges na bdag nyid gzhir gyur pa la rtogs par yang ste shes par ro //
translated: If it is not ascertained, then it is not known, i.e., cognized, in the self that is the basis.

original: 'di dag ces bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúthese‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúnot known.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù means ‚Äúit is impossible.‚Äù

original: 'chad par 'gyur @71a * //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur @71a * //
translated: The method of proof will be explained.

original: ba'i tshul gyis sgrub par byed pa'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir blo mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba'i tshul gyis sgrub par byed pa'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir blo mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not known by the direct perception of the mind, because there is no other method of proof.

original: bdag nyid gzhir gyur pa la shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhir gyur pa la shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not known in the self that is the basis.

original: blo bdag nyid la brten par ma shes na yang don shes pa tsam du 'dod par 'gyur gyi bdag gis don 'di shes so zhes bdag nyid nyams su myong ba por ni shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo bdag nyid la brten par ma shes na yang don shes pa tsam du 'dod par 'gyur gyi bdag gis don 'di shes so zhes bdag nyid nyams su myong ba por ni shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind is not known to be based on the self, it would be asserted to be merely the cognition of the object, but it would not be known as the experiencer of the self, i.e., ‚ÄúI know this object.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni shes par byed pa po 'dis don 'di shes so zhes shes pa po shes pa na don shes par 'gyur ba yin gyi shes pa po shes pa med par ni don shes pa med pa'i phyir shes pa po bdag nyid ma nges na dngos
analyzed: don dam par ni shes par byed pa po 'dis don 'di shes so zhes shes pa po shes pa na don shes par 'gyur ba yin gyi shes pa po shes pa med par ni don shes pa med pa'i phyir shes pa po bdag nyid ma nges na dngos
translated: In ultimate reality, when the knower knows ‚Äúthis object is known by this knower,‚Äù the object is known. But without the knower knowing, the object is not known. Therefore, if the knower is not ascertained, the object is not ascertained.

original: po yang nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po yang nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the object signified would not be ascertained.

original: rtags su gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de shes par 'gyur ba na rtags can gyi blo rjes su dpog pa 'byung ba yin la rjes su dpag pa de las rtogs pa pos blo khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags su gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de shes par 'gyur ba na rtags can gyi blo rjes su dpog pa 'byung ba yin la rjes su dpag pa de las rtogs pa pos blo khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: When the object signified is ascertained, the cognition of the signifier, the inference, occurs, and from that inference, the cognizer understands the object.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par khong du chud pa rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ma yin yang tshad ma dang de'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin dag las tha dad bar blta'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par khong du chud pa rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ma yin yang tshad ma dang de'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin dag las tha dad bar blta'o //
translated: Although in reality the understanding is not different from the inference, still, the valid cognition and its result are seen to be different.

original: yang ji ltar na don shes pa la blo rjes su dpog pa'i rtags yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na don shes pa la blo rjes su dpog pa'i rtags yin zhe na /
translated: How is the cognition of the object a sign of the inference of the cognition?

original: don ma shes par zhes smras te /
analyzed: don ma shes par zhes smras te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúWhen the object is not known.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ji srid don shes par ma gyur pa de ji srid du blo nges pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir blo grub pa ni don shes pa'i rgyu mtshan las yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji srid don shes par ma gyur pa de ji srid du blo nges pa ni ma yin pa de'i phyir blo grub pa ni don shes pa'i rgyu mtshan las yin no //
translated: Because as long as the object is not known, the cognition is not ascertained, therefore the establishment of the cognition is from the sign of knowing the object.

original: 'dis ni med na mi 'byung ba dang / don shes pa dang blo grub pa snga phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni med na mi 'byung ba dang / don shes pa dang blo grub pa snga phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the object and the cognition of it do not occur when the other is absent, and that the object and the cognition of it are established as simultaneous.

original: blo nges pa ni sngar ma yin zhing dus mnyam par yang ma yin la phyis kyang 'di'o zhes nges par nus pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: blo nges pa ni sngar ma yin zhing dus mnyam par yang ma yin la phyis kyang 'di'o zhes nges par nus pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The cognition is not ascertained as being prior to the object, nor as being simultaneous with it, nor as being subsequent to it.

original: 'on kyang yul rnam par 'chad par don rags pa mthong ba las gor ma chag par blo yod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul rnam par 'chad par don rags pa mthong ba las gor ma chag par blo yod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: However, one understands that the cognition must exist, because the gross object is seen to be divided into parts.üîΩThe cognition of the object is based on that.

original: don shes pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: don shes pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs thesis.

original: gzhan dag de ltar dogs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag de ltar dogs nas bshad pa /
translated: Others, fearing that this is the opponent‚Äôs position, explain as follows:

original: blun po ni rang gi smras pa yang don go bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: blun po ni rang gi smras pa yang don go bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: The fool is unable to understand the meaning of what he himself has said.

original: rgyal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba thob pa'o //
translated: The Victor is one who has attained victory.

original: ci zhig byas pas rgyal zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas pas rgyal zhe na /
translated: What is the victory?

original: 'jig rten gyi mdun du kho bo rgyal lo kho bo rgyal lo zhes rgyal ba'i sgra dam bcas pa'i sgra de bsgrags pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mdun du kho bo rgyal lo kho bo rgyal lo zhes rgyal ba'i sgra dam bcas pa'i sgra de bsgrags pa ste /
translated: In the presence of the world, he proclaims the sound of his victory cry, ‚ÄúI am victorious! I am victorious!‚Äù

original: gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: gsal bar byas so //
translated: He makes it clear.

original: gal te des de ltar gsal bar byas pa @71b de lta na yang ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i 'jig rten las rgyal ba thob ce na /
analyzed: gal te des de ltar gsal bar byas pa @71b de lta na yang ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i 'jig rten las rgyal ba thob ce na /
translated: Even though he makes it clear in this way, how does he attain victory over the world of consciousness?

original: bshad pa / gang gis 'di skad 'gal ba'i chos smra ba'i tshig las yang 'jig rten na mnyan par 'os par byed pas so //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gis 'di skad 'gal ba'i chos smra ba'i tshig las yang 'jig rten na mnyan par 'os par byed pas so //
translated: He explains: Because he makes the words of one who speaks contradictory doctrines worthy of being heard in the world.

original: gal te mkhas pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni 'di lta bu'i tshig bzlog par 'gyur gyi tshig 'di la rna gtod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na ma bzlog pa nyid kyis rgyal bar bsgrags bas 'jig rten las rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te mkhas pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni 'di lta bu'i tshig bzlog par 'gyur gyi tshig 'di la rna gtod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na ma bzlog pa nyid kyis rgyal bar bsgrags bas 'jig rten las rgyal ba yin no //
translated: If there were any wise people, they would refute such words and would not listen to them. But because they do not refute him, he proclaims his victory and so he is victorious over the world.

original: 'gal ba ci zhig smras she na /
analyzed: 'gal ba ci zhig smras she na /
translated: What contradiction does he speak of?

original: bshad pa / don shes pa blo'i sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa / don shes pa blo'i sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni rtogs pa yin la /
translated: He explains: The reason that establishes the cognition of an object is understanding.

original: rtags yongs su shes pa na ma rtogs pas rtags can du 'gyur ba'i blo ni ma yin no zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: rtags yongs su shes pa na ma rtogs pas rtags can du 'gyur ba'i blo ni ma yin no zhes zer ba'o //
translated: When the reason is fully understood, the mind that is not understood does not become a reason.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: shes pa dang blo dang rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: shes pa dang blo dang rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin la /
translated: Knowledge, mind, and understanding are synonyms.

original: sgra tha dad pas don tha dad pa'i grub pa dang ma grub par 'gyur ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sgra tha dad pas don tha dad pa'i grub pa dang ma grub par 'gyur ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that different words have different meanings that are established or not established.

original: de skad du smra ba'i tshig la rna ni mi gtod pa na yang sngar bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba'i tshig la rna ni mi gtod pa na yang sngar bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when one does not pay attention to the words of such a speaker, the previously explained fault arises.

original: gang gi phyir de skad smra ba na lha rnams dga' ba 'jig rten na bsngags par 'os pa'i shes rab can du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skad smra ba na lha rnams dga' ba 'jig rten na bsngags par 'os pa'i shes rab can du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because when one speaks in that way, one becomes one whose wisdom is worthy of praise in the world, one who is loved by the gods.

original: bsngags par bya zhing bstod par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: bsngags par bya zhing bstod par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: One is worthy of praise and worthy of honor.

original: de'i phyir blun po rgyal ba yin no zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir blun po rgyal ba yin no zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the fool is the victor. This is the conclusion.

original: yang gzhan gyi dogs pa smras pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi dogs pa smras pa /
translated: Again, stating the doubts of others,

original: blo dang shes pa dag ni rnam grangs kyi sgra yin pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can gyi don du rnam par gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: blo dang shes pa dag ni rnam grangs kyi sgra yin pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can gyi don du rnam par gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: because the terms ‚Äúmind‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù are synonymous terms, they are not established as the meaning of evidence and that which has evidence.

original: 'on kyang dbang po dang don 'di dag blo rjes su dpog pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po dang don 'di dag blo rjes su dpog pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: However, the faculties and objects are the evidence for inferring the mind.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po dang don yod pa de'i phyir dbang po la brten pas don gyi yul can gyi blor 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po dang don yod pa de'i phyir dbang po la brten pas don gyi yul can gyi blor 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the faculties and objects exist, therefore, based on the faculties, there is a mind that has objects as its domain.

original: slob dpon gyis mi 'khrul na gtan tshigs yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mi 'khrul na gtan tshigs yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúIf it is non-erroneous, it is evidence.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang zhig gang la mi 'khrul pa de ni de'i rtags yin no /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la mi 'khrul pa de ni de'i rtags yin no /
translated: That which is non-erroneous with regard to something is the evidence for that.

original: dbang po ni shes pa la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po ni shes pa la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The faculties are erroneous with regard to consciousness.

original: dbang po de yod pa yin yang de'i shes pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po de yod pa yin yang de'i shes pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though the faculties exist, their consciousness does not engage.

original: gzhan du na dbang po yod pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad kyi shes pa gtan du yod par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar ni mthong ba'am 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na dbang po yod pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad kyi shes pa gtan du yod par thal bar 'gyur na de ltar ni mthong ba'am 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that because the sense faculties exist, the consciousnesses of all the sense faculties would always exist, but that is not seen or accepted.

original: de bzhin du don gtan tshigs yin ba la yang yod pa tsam gtan tshigs yin @72a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du don gtan tshigs yin ba la yang yod pa tsam gtan tshigs yin @72a * //
translated: Similarly, if the object is the reason, then if mere existence is the reason,

original: na ni / de'i tshe thams cad du rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ni / de'i tshe thams cad du rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows, absurdly, that everything would be known.

original: nye bar gtan tshigs yin na nye ba ma lus pa dus gcig tu 'dzin par thal ba las de ltar rigs pa'am 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar gtan tshigs yin na nye ba ma lus pa dus gcig tu 'dzin par thal ba las de ltar rigs pa'am 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the object that is near is the reason, then it follows, absurdly, that all that is near would be apprehended at the same time, but that is not the way it is or the way it is accepted,

original: rnam par shes pa dus gcig tu 'jug par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dus gcig tu 'jug par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not accepted that consciousnesses operate simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang don dag ni shes pa la 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang don dag ni shes pa la 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is established that the sense faculties and the objects are the causes of error in regard to consciousness.

original: gang dag 'di ni dbang po dang don dag thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir 'khrul par brjod pa yin no zhes zer ba de la 'di skad du thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon 'di'i yul gang yin zhes 'dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'di ni dbang po dang don dag thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir 'khrul par brjod pa yin no zhes zer ba de la 'di skad du thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon 'di'i yul gang yin zhes 'dri bar bya'o //
translated: Those who say that this is called ‚Äúmistaken‚Äù because the sense faculty and object are common should be asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the object of the error that you explain as being common?‚Äù

original: gzhan yang dbang po dang don lhan cig pa nyid gtan tshigs yin pa de ni dbang po 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir tshogs pa yang 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po dang don lhan cig pa nyid gtan tshigs yin pa de ni dbang po 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir tshogs pa yang 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the mere simultaneity of the sense faculty and object is the reason, then because the sense faculty is nonerroneous, the collection would also be nonerroneous.

original: dbang po ni skyes bu so so la nges pa'i phyir ji ltar na thun mong ba'i skyon du 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po ni skyes bu so so la nges pa'i phyir ji ltar na thun mong ba'i skyon du 'gyur /
translated: And because the sense faculty is ascertained for each individual person, how could it be a common error?

original: gang yang gzhung 'dis shes pa ma grub na dbang po dang don dag kyang mi 'grub ba'i phyir 'khrul pa ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan par brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gzhung 'dis shes pa ma grub na dbang po dang don dag kyang mi 'grub ba'i phyir 'khrul pa ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan par brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is illogical to say that this passage shows that if consciousness is not established, then because the sense faculties and objects are not established, error is not established.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir don grub par khas blangs nas shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na nges par ji ltar 'gyur zhes ston pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir don grub par khas blangs nas shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na nges par ji ltar 'gyur zhes ston pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Because here, having accepted that the object is established, it is the occasion for showing how it is certain that consciousness is hidden.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ma thag tu ma grub pa'i skyon ni yid la brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ma thag tu ma grub pa'i skyon ni yid la brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault of non-establishment will be stated immediately after this.

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i skyon ni 'di nyid kyi mthar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i skyon ni 'di nyid kyi mthar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault of non-establishment of the relation will be explained at the end of this.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa snga ma nyid legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa snga ma nyid legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the former explanation is better.

original: yid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid rtags yin par dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid rtags yin par dogs pa'o //
translated: If you say it is the mind, it is suspected that the mind is the reason.

original: sun dbyung ba'i phyir de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i phyir de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute that, he says, ‚ÄúThat also is not established.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i yid gang yin pa de yang grub pa'i shes pa'i cig cang mi skye ba grub pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i yid gang yin pa de yang grub pa'i shes pa'i cig cang mi skye ba grub pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever mind is asserted by others, that also is not established as the single effect of an established consciousness, because it is to be inferred.

original: des na shes pa ma grub par de mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na shes pa ma grub par de mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, if consciousness is not established, that is not established.

original: skyon 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yid la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi yid la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: This objection applies equally to the mind that has the nature of consciousness.

original: shes pa gcig gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa 'di nyid yid yin par rigs kyi /
analyzed: shes pa gcig gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa 'di nyid yid yin par rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable that this consciousness itself is the mind because it is the cause of a single cognition.

original: snga na med par brtags pa'i yid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na med par brtags pa'i yid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that the mind is imagined to be prior to consciousness.

original: de nyid ston pa ni yid de yang rnam par shes pa yin par rigs pa yin gyi gzhan ni @72b ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni yid de yang rnam par shes pa yin par rigs pa yin gyi gzhan ni @72b ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this statement is that it is reasonable that the mind is a type of consciousness and not something else.

original: bar du ma chod pa bar chad med pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa snga ma yin te /
analyzed: bar du ma chod pa bar chad med pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa snga ma yin te /
translated: The prior moment of consciousness that is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness is the mind.

original: 'di nyid yid kyi bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid yid kyi bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it possesses the activity of the mind.üîΩThe meaning of this statement is that the prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.

original: bya ba de nyid ston pa ni shes pa snga ma de shes pa mi skye ba'i yul du 'dod pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i yul gzhan de la sems gtad cing chags pa dang nus pa nyams pa ste gnyid la sogs pas nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba de nyid ston pa ni shes pa snga ma de shes pa mi skye ba'i yul du 'dod pa las gzhan du gyur pa'i yul gzhan de la sems gtad cing chags pa dang nus pa nyams pa ste gnyid la sogs pas nyams pa'o //
translated: The prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.üîΩThe prior moment of consciousness is the mind because it is the cause of the uninterrupted, nondeficient consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnyi ga yang gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnyi ga yang gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, both are apprehended in this way.

original: kha cig sems gtad pa nyid kyis nus pa nyams pa yin par shes pa de ni thams cad bsdus par mi 'gyur bas ha cang 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig sems gtad pa nyid kyis nus pa nyams pa yin par shes pa de ni thams cad bsdus par mi 'gyur bas ha cang 'byor pa yin no //
translated: Some think that the capacity of the mind is impaired by the mere directing of the mind to the object, but that is too much, since it would not include all cases.

original: yul gzhan de yod kyang shes pa mi skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir de nyid yid yin par rigs te yid kyi dgos pa ni de cam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan de yod kyang shes pa mi skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir de nyid yid yin par rigs te yid kyi dgos pa ni de cam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable that the object itself is the mind, because it is the cause of the non-arising of consciousness even when the object exists. The purpose of the mind is just that.

original: de ltar skyon ni ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar skyon ni ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault in that?

original: de yang ma grub bo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang ma grub bo zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that that is also not established.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is consciousness itself.

original: ma grub pa de nyid kyis ma grub pa de nyid sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa de nyid kyis ma grub pa de nyid sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not established cannot establish that which is not established.

original: yul gsal ba zhes bya ba 'dis yul gsal ba rtags yin par dogs pa bstan nas bzlog pa'i phyir gsal ba de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yul gsal ba zhes bya ba 'dis yul gsal ba rtags yin par dogs pa bstan nas bzlog pa'i phyir gsal ba de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: By saying the object is clear, it is suspected that the clear object is the reason, so to refute that, it says that clarity itself... and so on.

original: gang gi phyir yul gsal ba shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul gsal ba shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'am /
translated: Because the clear object is the nature of the consciousness that knows the clear object, or

original: shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin tsam du gyur pa'i don yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin tsam du gyur pa'i don yin par 'gyur /
translated: It would be the object that is the mere nature of the object of consciousness.

original: de las gal te gsal ba shes pa yin par gzung bar bya ba de'i tshe de ma grub pa'i phyir de'i khyad par can gyi don gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub bo zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de las gal te gsal ba shes pa yin par gzung bar bya ba de'i tshe de ma grub pa'i phyir de'i khyad par can gyi don gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub bo zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: If the clarity of consciousness is taken to be the object, then because it is not established, the object that has that as its attribute is not established as a reason.

original: shes pa de'i khyad par can gyi don gang yin pa de yang ma grub bo //
analyzed: shes pa de'i khyad par can gyi don gang yin pa de yang ma grub bo //
translated: The object that has the attribute of that consciousness is also not established.

original: dbyig pa ma grub par dbyig pa can du grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: dbyig pa ma grub par dbyig pa can du grub pa ni med do //
translated: Without the establishment of the stick, the one who has the stick is not established.

original: gsal ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gnyis pa'i dogs pa spong ste /
analyzed: gsal ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gnyis pa'i dogs pa spong ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúclarity is . . .‚Äù and so on eliminates the qualm of the second party.

original: don gyi bdag nyid shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin rtags yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la don gyi bdag nyid kyi gsal ba yang shes pa'i yul du ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin rtags yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la don gyi bdag nyid kyi gsal ba yang shes pa'i yul du ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin
translated: The nature of the object of consciousness, which is the nature of the object, is the reason, but consciousness is not. In this case, the clarity that is the nature of the object is not established as the object of consciousness, so it should be said that it is not established.

original: mod kyi 'on kyang skabs 'dir don grub par khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir na skyon gzhan ston to //
analyzed: mod kyi 'on kyang skabs 'dir don grub par khas blangs pa yin pa'i phyir na skyon gzhan ston to //
translated: But in this context, since it is accepted that the object is established, another fault is shown.

original: de ji ltar te ci'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar te ci'i phyir ro //
translated: How? Why?

original: blos bskyed pa ni blos bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: blos bskyed pa ni blos bskyed pa'o //
translated: That which is generated by the mind is generated by the mind.

original: blos bskyed pa med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar blo go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: blos bskyed pa med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar blo go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: How can that which is not generated by the mind be understood by the mind?

original: ma yin @73a * //
analyzed: ma yin @73a * //
translated: It cannot.

original: pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the thought.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because there is no relation, it is said.üîΩA relation other than identity is a relation of origination, and that does not exist for the nonexistent. Therefore, how can it be understood?

original: de'i bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa ni de las byung ba nyid yin zhing de yang med pa de'i phyir ji ltar de go bar byed pa yin gzhan yang don gyi bdag nyid kyi gsal ba ni blo thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin pa des na
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa ni de las byung ba nyid yin zhing de yang med pa de'i phyir ji ltar de go bar byed pa yin gzhan yang don gyi bdag nyid kyi gsal ba ni blo thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin pa des na
translated: Moreover, the manifestation of the nature of the object is common to all minds.

original: bdag nyid kyi blo nyid ji ltar rjes su dpog par byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi blo nyid ji ltar rjes su dpog par byed /
translated: Therefore, how can one's own mind be inferred from that?

original: de'i phyir don thun mong ba yin ba'i phyir blo tsam du rjes su dpog pa na gzhan gyi blo yang rjes su dpog par thal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir don thun mong ba yin ba'i phyir blo tsam du rjes su dpog pa na gzhan gyi blo yang rjes su dpog par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, because the meaning is common, when one infers mere mind, it follows that one infers the mind of another.

original: skyon gzhan yang brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: rtags grub kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: rtags grub kyang zhes smos te /
translated: Even if the reason is established,

original: kyang gi sgras ni 'di skad ces re zhig rtags nyid du nye bar dgod par bya ba ni 'ga' yang ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni 'di skad ces re zhig rtags nyid du nye bar dgod par bya ba ni 'ga' yang ma grub pa'am /
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù means that it is said: ‚ÄúFirst, nothing is established as a reason,

original: yang na shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir rtags kyi dngos po thams cad ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir rtags kyi dngos po thams cad ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: or, because consciousness is not established, all things that are reasons are not established.‚Äù

original: rtags 'ga' zhig grub kyang blo rjes su dpog pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to ;
analyzed: rtags 'ga' zhig grub kyang blo rjes su dpog pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to ;
translated: Even if some reason is established, it is not inferred by the mind.

original: / gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: / gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: grub pa'i rtags de blo dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i rtags de blo dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that established reason is not related to the mind.

original: dngos po grub kyang ji srid rtags can dang lhan cig 'brel pa grub par ma gyur pa de srid du rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po grub kyang ji srid rtags can dang lhan cig 'brel pa grub par ma gyur pa de srid du rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if the thing is established, as long as the establishment of the relation with the one who has the reason is not accomplished, it does not cause understanding.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa ma grub ce na /
translated: How is the relation not established?

original: ma grub pas na zhes gsungs te blo ni dus thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis ma grub pa yin pas ma grub pa dang ji ltar yang 'brel pa nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pas na zhes gsungs te blo ni dus thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis ma grub pa yin pas ma grub pa dang ji ltar yang 'brel pa nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it is not established,‚Äù because the cognition is not established, since it is always hidden. How can the relation be ascertained with what is not established?

original: de'i phyir brjod pa med pa brjod pa dang bral ba mngon sum nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa med pa brjod pa dang bral ba mngon sum nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-expressed, free from expression, appears as direct perception itself.

original: des ni g-yo ba med par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: des ni g-yo ba med par gnas pa ni /
translated: By that, the non-moving, abiding

original: gcig gi bdag nyid dgag pa la ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum nyid go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid dgag pa la ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum nyid go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: is the direct perception itself, which is seen, that is the proof of the negation of a single nature.

original: mthong ba la rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa dgag pa la ni snang ba mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa dgag pa la ni snang ba mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin no //
translated: For the negation of different conceptual thoughts in the seen, the non-apprehension of appearance is the valid cognition.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa bsal nas spyod yul la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa bsal nas spyod yul la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having cleared away the misconception about the characteristic, in order to clear away the misconception about the domain,

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúwithout the activity of the sense faculties,‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum rnam pa bzhi yang ma brjod par dbang po'i mngon sum nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yul la log par rtogs pa bsal ba gang yin pa de ni gang gi phyir dbang po'i shes pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa de'i
analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa bzhi yang ma brjod par dbang po'i mngon sum nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yul la log par rtogs pa bsal ba gang yin pa de ni gang gi phyir dbang po'i shes pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa de'i
translated: This is because sense consciousness is not a subject that expresses objects,

original: phyir yang @73b rnam par rtog pa med par sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas 'thad pa gzhan bsags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: phyir yang @73b rnam par rtog pa med par sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas 'thad pa gzhan bsags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: and therefore, in order to establish that it is nonconceptual, another reason is added,

original: mdo mdzad pa'i go rims rjes su bskyang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo mdzad pa'i go rims rjes su bskyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or the order of the s≈´tra is followed.

original: dbang po'i shes pa de ni brjod med de //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa de ni brjod med de //
translated: That sense consciousness is inexpressible

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i don to //
translated: means that it is a cognition of what is inexpressible. This is the meaning of the thesis.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the reason:

original: sgras lhan cig 'dres pa'i don ni dbang po'i shes pas mthong ba bzhin du blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgras lhan cig 'dres pa'i don ni dbang po'i shes pas mthong ba bzhin du blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning mixed together with words does not appear to the mind in the same way that it is seen by sense consciousness,

original: rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no fixed correspondence.

original: 'khrul pa bsal ba'i phyir khyad par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'khrul pa bsal ba'i phyir khyad par bshad pa /
translated: In order to eliminate confusion, a distinction is explained:

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: It is that which is without the activity of the sense faculty.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni mtshan nyid bshad ma thag pa'i mngon sum de ni'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni mtshan nyid bshad ma thag pa'i mngon sum de ni'o //
translated: The explanation of the commentary on this is: That direct perception, whose characteristic has just been explained,

original: yang gi sgra brjod pa ni log par rtogs pa gzhan sel ba bsags pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra brjod pa ni log par rtogs pa gzhan sel ba bsags pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúalso‚Äù eliminates other misconceptions.

original: brjod du med pa ni bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which is inexpressible, whose object is not to be indicated.

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa gang yin pa la ste ;
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa gang yin pa la ste ;
translated: It is that which is without the activity of the sense faculty.

original: bya ba med pa nyid ni mig la sogs pa brjod par bya ba'i yul can gyi dbang po la blta bar bya'i rjod par byed pa'i yul can gyi dbang po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba med pa nyid ni mig la sogs pa brjod par bya ba'i yul can gyi dbang po la blta bar bya'i rjod par byed pa'i yul can gyi dbang po la ni ma yin no //
translated: The absence of activity is in the sense faculty whose object is to be seen, such as the eye, and not in the sense faculty whose object is to be expressed.

original: snang ba'i dngos po nyid nyan pa pos sgra las rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bya ba med pa zhes so //
analyzed: snang ba'i dngos po nyid nyan pa pos sgra las rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bya ba med pa zhes so //
translated: The listener understands from the sound that it is the very thing that appears. In order to eliminate that doubt, ‚Äúwithout activity‚Äù is said.

original: mthong ba bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa'i don skyes bu de'i blo la sgra dang lhan cig snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa'i don skyes bu de'i blo la sgra dang lhan cig snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object, such as a pot, does not appear to the cognition of that person together with the word, just as it is seen.

original: mi snang ba de'i phyir brjod par bya ba 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba de'i phyir brjod par bya ba 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not appear, it is not the object of verbal expression.

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba'i don rnam pa gzhan yin zhing sgra'i shes pa la snang ba sgra dang 'dres pa yang rnam pa gzhan yin du bcug pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba'i don rnam pa gzhan yin zhing sgra'i shes pa la snang ba sgra dang 'dres pa yang rnam pa gzhan yin du bcug pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if we allow that the object that appears to the sense cognition has a different aspect, and that the object that appears to the cognition of the word, mixed with the word, has a different aspect,

original: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bshad pa /
translated: how could the object that is to be understood by the sense faculty not be the object of verbal expression?

original: gang gi phyir sgra'i rgyu can gyi shes pa la sgra dang 'dres par mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra'i rgyu can gyi shes pa la sgra dang 'dres par mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don ma yin no //
translated: Because that which does not appear mixed with the word in the cognition that has the word as its cause is not the object of verbal expression by that word.

original: gang zhig sgra gang gi don yin pa de ni de dang 'brel par blo la snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig sgra gang gi don yin pa de ni de dang 'brel par blo la snang ba yin te /
translated: That which is the object of a certain word appears to the cognition as connected with that.

original: dper na ba lang gi gzugs ring po ba lang gi sgra dang 'dres par snang ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi gzugs ring po ba lang gi sgra dang 'dres par snang ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, the form of a cow appears mixed with the word cow.

original: brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason for being the object of expression is just this.

original: gang zhig sgra gang dang blo la snang ba nyid ma yin pa de ni de'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig sgra gang dang blo la snang ba nyid ma yin pa de ni de'i don ma yin te /
translated: That which does not appear mixed with a word in the mind is not the meaning of that word.

original: @74a * // dper na rta ba lang gi sgra dang 'dres par mi snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: @74a * // dper na rta ba lang gi sgra dang 'dres par mi snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the word horse does not appear mixed with the word cow.

original: dbang po'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i don gyi rnam pa yang sgra'i shes pa la sgra dang 'dres par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i don gyi rnam pa yang sgra'i shes pa la sgra dang 'dres par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, the aspect of an object that is to be understood by a sense consciousness does not appear in the cognition of a word mixed with the word.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not the meaning of the word.

original: gal te yang snang ba dang sgra'i don dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba yin pa de ltar na yang sgra dang 'brel pa'i don snang ba na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang snang ba dang sgra'i don dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba yin pa de ltar na yang sgra dang 'brel pa'i don snang ba na ni /
translated: Even if the appearance and the meaning of the word are clear or unclear, when the meaning that is related to the word appears,

original: mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhen par byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhen par byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not conceived to be of the nature of what is seen?

original: dper na nye ba dang ring pa na gnas pa'i rtogs pa po dag gi shes pa'i gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba yin yang blta bar bya ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po gcig nyid la shes pa gsalüîΩba dang mi gsal bar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na nye ba dang ring pa na gnas pa'i rtogs pa po dag gi shes pa'i gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba yin yang blta bar bya ba'i don tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po gcig nyid la shes pa gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba yin te /
translated: Likewise, in this case, a single thing appears as clear or unclear cognition.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i yul ji ltar zhen pa bzhin du snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa na sgra dang lhan cig tu snang ba ma yin par ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i yul ji ltar zhen pa bzhin du snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa na sgra dang lhan cig tu snang ba ma yin par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the object of sound is the nature that appears as it is conceived, it is not established that it does not appear simultaneously with sound.

original: ci ste zhen pa'i don ni bden pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste zhen pa'i don ni bden pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object of conception is not real,

original: de lta na yang nyams su myong ba nyid du mngon par zhen pa la gnod par byed pa brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang nyams su myong ba nyid du mngon par zhen pa la gnod par byed pa brjod dgos te /
translated: then you must state the refutation of the conception that it is experienced.

original: gnod par byed pa med par ni nyams su myong bar mngon par zhen par nus pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med par ni nyams su myong bar mngon par zhen par nus pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Without a refutation, it is not possible to refute the conception that it is experienced.

original: sgra'i yul nyid ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i yul nyid ni zhes smos te /
translated: To respond to that qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of sound itself.‚Äù

original: sgra'i yul ni gang zhig sgra brjod pa las sgra dang 'dres pa'i don snang ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i yul ni gang zhig sgra brjod pa las sgra dang 'dres pa'i don snang ba'o //
translated: The object of sound is that which appears as the meaning mixed with sound from the utterance of sound.

original: de nyid ni dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni don byed nus pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni don byed nus pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That itself is not a thing, that is, it is not capable of effective action.

original: gal te sgra'i yul ji ltar zhe na pa nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin na ni de nyid dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i yul ji ltar zhe na pa nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin na ni de nyid dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of sound were the nature of what is seen, then it would be a thing.

original: mthong ba ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because seeing is a thing.

original: sgra'i yul ni dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i yul ni dngos po ma yin no //
translated: The object of sound is not a thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / dngos po de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i mthong ba la sgra las byung ba'i rnam pa mi gsal ba las rnam pa gzhan du gsal bar snang ba'i phyir te gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i mthong ba la sgra las byung ba'i rnam pa mi gsal ba las rnam pa gzhan du gsal bar snang ba'i phyir te gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is explained: That thing, arising from the sense faculty, appears clearly in the seeing that arises from sound, unlike the unclear form. Because it is clear.

original: dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba'i gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa des ni don byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba'i gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa des ni don byed pa yin gyi /
translated: That which appears clearly in the sense consciousness is capable of effective action.

original: sgra las byung ba'i snang ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i snang ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: Not from the appearance arising from sound.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni dngos po ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni dngos po ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang po'i don nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a real entity, but rather it is the object of the sense faculty.

original: 'on te dbang po'i yul gsal bar snang ba ni dngos po yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i yul gsal bar snang ba ni dngos po yin zhing /
translated: Or, if the object of the sense faculty that appears clearly is a real entity,

original: sgra las byung ba'i yul mi gsal bar snang ba dngos po ma yin du chud pa de ltan yang tha mi dad @74b par zhen pa las ci'i phyir gcig pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i yul mi gsal bar snang ba dngos po ma yin du chud pa de ltan yang tha mi dad @74b par zhen pa las ci'i phyir gcig pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: and the object that arises from sound, which appears unclearly, is not a real entity, then even so, why is it not the same because of the conception of non-difference?

original: de nyid ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the absence of that very nature.‚Äù

original: don byed nus pa yod pa dang med pa 'gal ba'i chos dag gis khyad par du byas pa'i snang ba tha dad pa tsam ni de nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: don byed nus pa yod pa dang med pa 'gal ba'i chos dag gis khyad par du byas pa'i snang ba tha dad pa tsam ni de nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The mere difference in appearance characterized by the contradictory properties of the existence and non-existence of the ability to perform a function is the reason for the absence of that very nature.

original: de nyid ni de'i ngo bo ste de dang lhan cig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni de'i ngo bo ste de dang lhan cig pa nyid do //
translated: That very nature is the essence of that, which is the very state of being together with that.

original: de nyid kyis med pa ni de nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis med pa ni de nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: The absence of that very nature is the absence of that very nature.

original: kha cig bkag pa de nyid ma yin pa yin gyi tha dad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig bkag pa de nyid ma yin pa yin gyi tha dad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: That very negation is the absence of that very nature, but it is not difference.

original: dngos po gnyis la ni nus pa rjes su 'gro ba'i snang ba tha dad pa las tha dad par 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos po gcig nyid la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis la ni nus pa rjes su 'gro ba'i snang ba tha dad pa las tha dad par 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos po gcig nyid la ni ma yin te /
translated: In the case of two things, they would be different due to the difference in the appearance of the potency that follows them, but not in the case of a single thing.

original: ri bong gi rva las bum pa tha dad par snang ba na bum pa nyid ni ri bong gi rva ma yin no zhes gcig nyid med par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva las bum pa tha dad par snang ba na bum pa nyid ni ri bong gi rva ma yin no zhes gcig nyid med par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: When a pot appears as different from a rabbit‚Äôs horns, the pot itself is not a rabbit‚Äôs horn, and thus there is no singularity.

original: de tsam gyis bum pa las ri bong gi rva tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis bum pa las ri bong gi rva tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But that alone does not make the rabbit‚Äôs horn different from the pot.

original: tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa tsam gyi rgyu las yin zhing /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa tsam gyi rgyu las yin zhing /
translated: Difference is caused by the mere possession of contradictory properties.

original: nus pa yod pa dang med pa yang 'gal ba'i chos yin la /
analyzed: nus pa yod pa dang med pa yang 'gal ba'i chos yin la /
translated: And the existence and nonexistence of potency are contradictory properties.

original: de dag kyang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i don la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i don la yod pa yin te /
translated: And they exist in the sense of the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: de'i phyir gcig ma yin pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ni gcig nyid du zhen pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig ma yin pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ni gcig nyid du zhen pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the convention of non-sameness, the possession of contradictory properties, undermines the conception of sameness.

original: yang gang du snang ba 'ba' zhig tha dad pa der ni gcig med par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang gang du snang ba 'ba' zhig tha dad pa der ni gcig med par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, where there is only the appearance of difference, there is not non-existence of unity.

original: 'on kyang don byed nus pa yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par can gyi snang ba tha dad pa nyid la yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don byed nus pa yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par can gyi snang ba tha dad pa nyid la yin no //
translated: But it is the difference of appearance itself, which is qualified by the existence or non-existence of causal efficiency.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid ni don byed nus pa las yin la yod pa nyid kyang de nyid yin zhing yod pa yang de nyid ma yin pa yin no//
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid ni don byed nus pa las yin la yod pa nyid kyang de nyid yin zhing yod pa yang de nyid ma yin pa yin no//
translated: For, the existence of entities is due to causal efficiency, and existence is just that, and not something else.

original: snang ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin la /
analyzed: snang ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin la /
translated: Appearance is of the nature of cognition, not of an entity.

original: de yod pa las nges par dngos po yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa las nges par dngos po yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And, from the existence of that, the existence of an entity is not ascertained.

original: dper na rab rib can gyi shes pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyi shes pa'i snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the appearance in the cognition of one who suffers from an eye disease.

original: de bzhin du gyur pas dngos po gzhan du gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gyur pas dngos po gzhan du gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And, from the transformation of that, the transformation of an entity is not.
