original: gang gi phyir shes pa'i chos ni rkyen gzhan 'ga' zhig las don tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bar ti ka las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa'i chos ni rkyen gzhan 'ga' zhig las don tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bar ti ka las bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because the property of cognition is not different from other conditions, but becomes different. This is explained in the Vartika.

original: 'o na ni snang ba tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ni snang ba tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: But how can it be said to be the reason for the difference in appearance?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la so sor nges pa'i nus pa de ni snang ba'i mthar thug par dmigs pa @75a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin la so sor nges pa'i nus pa de ni snang ba'i mthar thug par dmigs pa @75a * //
translated: Because the nature of things is individually determined potential, that is observed to end in appearance.

original: de'i phyir nus pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i snang ba las yod pa dang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i snang ba las yod pa dang med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, existence and non-existence are from appearance without error in potential.

original: de tha dad pa nyid las kyang de nyid dang gzhan du rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de tha dad pa nyid las kyang de nyid dang gzhan du rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: And from that very difference, it is posited as the same and different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nus pa tha dad pa'i khyad par can gyi snang ba tha dad pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod par blta'o//
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nus pa tha dad pa'i khyad par can gyi snang ba tha dad pa ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod par blta'o//
translated: Therefore, the difference in appearance characterized by the difference in potential should be seen as stated to be the reason for the difference.

original: rtogs pa po nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pa la ni snang ba 'ga' zhig tha dad par zad kyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa po nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pa la ni snang ba 'ga' zhig tha dad par zad kyi /
translated: For the observer, whether near or far, there is only the difference in some appearances.

original: nus pa tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that there is a difference in the power of the cognition,

original: de'i phyir dngos po tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: and therefore there is no difference in the thing.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gzhan bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gzhan bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates another reason, becauseüîΩthe appearance of the cognition is not mistaken with regard to the power of the object, and because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i snang ba tha dad pa dang / rgyu mtshan de tsam gyis kyang gcig nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir sgra'i yul nyid ni dngos po ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i snang ba tha dad pa dang / rgyu mtshan de tsam gyis kyang gcig nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir sgra'i yul nyid ni dngos po ma yin la /
translated: And because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.

original: de las kyang snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gcig nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te mthong ba'i gzugs gsal bar snang ba'i dngos po med na ni sgra'i snang ba gang zhig yod pa nyid du zhen pa yin yang /
analyzed: de las kyang snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gcig nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro // gal te mthong ba'i gzugs gsal bar snang ba'i dngos po med na ni sgra'i snang ba gang zhig yod pa nyid du zhen pa yin yang /
translated: And because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.üîΩAnd because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.

original: mthong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: And because of the difference in the appearance, the object is not one.

original: nus pa med pa'i rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because of the difference

original: yang gang zhig mthong ba la snang ba gsal bar snang ba'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid du zhen par byas pa de ni snang ba'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang gang zhig mthong ba la snang ba gsal bar snang ba'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid du zhen par byas pa de ni snang ba'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Moreover, if one were to conceive of the entity that appears clearly in a vision as having the nature of that, then would it not become the entity that appears?

original: des na dbang po'i don sgra mi snang ba ma grub pa nyid so na 'dug pa yin no zhe na yod kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i don sgra mi snang ba ma grub pa nyid so na 'dug pa yin no zhe na yod kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the object of the sense faculty, sound, is not established as not appearing.

original: dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig la ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'ba' zhig la ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that it is only a non-entity.

original: yod kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa de'i blta bar bya ba'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa de'i blta bar bya ba'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Although it exists, the cognition that arises from sound does not apprehend the nature of that which exists as the object of vision.

original: blta bar bya ba snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba snang ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not appear as the object of vision.

original: snang ba de mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhen pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba de mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhen pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not the case that one conceives of that appearance as having the nature of what is seen?

original: zhen pa bden na yang ji ltar med pa'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid du zhen kyang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du yod pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: zhen pa bden na yang ji ltar med pa'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid du zhen kyang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du yod pa la yang yin no //
translated: Even if conception were true, just as one conceives of a non-existent entity as having that nature, it is not that nature. Likewise, it is also not the case for an existent entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni shes pa gang la med pa'i don snang ba'i shes pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni shes pa gang la med pa'i don snang ba'i shes pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Objection: Because the cognition that arises from sound is not different from the cognition that perceives the meaning of nonexistence.

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i snang ba ni med pa'i don snang ba dang khyad par med pa de'i phyir mthong ba snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i snang ba ni med pa'i don snang ba dang khyad par med pa de'i phyir mthong ba snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the appearance of this is not different from the appearance of the meaning of nonexistence, therefore seeing is not appearance. This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar khyad par med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par med ce na /
translated: How are they not different?

original: bshad pa dngos po med kyang sgra las byung ba'i snang ba @75b mi nyams pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa dngos po med kyang sgra las byung ba'i snang ba @75b mi nyams pa ste /
translated: In response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Although things do not exist, the appearance that arises from sound does not deteriorate.

original: mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir gang zhig sgra las byung ba'i snang ba yin pa de ni sgra dang 'dres pa yin la /üîΩgang sgra dang 'dres pa de yang sgra dang 'brel par mthong ba yin zhing /
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir gang zhig sgra las byung ba'i snang ba yin pa de ni sgra dang 'dres pa yin la / gang sgra dang 'dres pa de yang sgra dang 'brel par mthong ba yin zhing /
translated: Because it does not cease.üîΩBecause that which is the appearance that arises from sound is mixed with sound.üîΩAnd that which is mixed with sound is seen to be related to sound.

original: sgra dang 'brel bar mthong ba gang yin pa de yang sgra brjod pa las snang bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: sgra dang 'brel bar mthong ba gang yin pa de yang sgra brjod pa las snang bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: And that which is seen to be related to sound appears from the expression of sound.

original: / sgra las byung ba'i snang ba sgra brjod pa'i stobs kyis rjes su 'jug pa na dngos po med pa la yang 'byung bas nyams pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po yod pa la 'byung yang sgra tsam la rag las pa yod pa ma yin pa
analyzed: / sgra las byung ba'i snang ba sgra brjod pa'i stobs kyis rjes su 'jug pa na dngos po med pa la yang 'byung bas nyams pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po yod pa la 'byung yang sgra tsam la rag las pa yod pa ma yin pa
translated: The appearance that arises from sound, when it occurs by the power of the expression of sound, occurs even when the object does not exist. Therefore, even when it occurs in the case of an existent object, it is not dependent on sound alone.

original: snang ba de lta bu gzhan dang khyad par med par ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba de lta bu gzhan dang khyad par med par ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: That appearance is not seen to be different from others.

original: khyad par med par snang ba yin par 'dod pa de lta na yang de tsam gyis dngos po yod pa la 'byung ba dang de'i bdag nyid du zhen pa'i shes pa ci'i phyir dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin zhen bshad pa /
analyzed: khyad par med par snang ba yin par 'dod pa de lta na yang de tsam gyis dngos po yod pa la 'byung ba dang de'i bdag nyid du zhen pa'i shes pa ci'i phyir dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin zhen bshad pa /
translated: Even if it is accepted that the appearance is not different, why is the cognition that occurs in the case of an existent object and is attached to it as its nature not the cognition that apprehends the object?

original: de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir de 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir de 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the apprehender because it does not follow the existence or nonexistence of that.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because the cognition that follows the occurrence and cessation of the appearance is the apprehender.

original: med par snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i rnam pa ni dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa des na de'i 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med par snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i rnam pa ni dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa des na de'i 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The aspect that is no different from the appearance of what is nonexistent does not conform to the presence or absence of an entity, and therefore it does not apprehend it.

original: don 'di nyid ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this very point through the process of elimination and through positive concomitance, he says:

original: dpe gnyis dri la ro'i blo bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: dpe gnyis dri la ro'i blo bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the cognition of smell in the example of taste,‚Äù and so on.

original: ro'i blo ni dri 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ro'i blo ni dri 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of taste does not apprehend smell.

original: de'i phyir snang ba dri'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba dri'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the appearance does not conform to the presence or absence of smell.

original: yang gang gi snang ba gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni de'i 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gang gi snang ba gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni de'i 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which conforms to the presence or absence of something is the apprehender of it.

original: dper na gzugs la mig gi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs la mig gi blo bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cognition of form is of the eye.

original: gal te ro'i blo ni snang ba'i dri'i bdag nyid du zhen pa med pa'i phyir dri snang ba ma yin gyi sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa ni de'i snang ba mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhen pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ro'i blo ni snang ba'i dri'i bdag nyid du zhen pa med pa'i phyir dri snang ba ma yin gyi sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa ni de'i snang ba mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhen pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the cognition of the corpse is not the appearance of smell, because it is not conceived as having the nature of the appearance of smell, is not the cognition that arises from sound the appearance of what is seen, because it is conceived as having the nature of the appearance of what is seen?

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir mthong ba las byung ba'i shes pa'i rgyur ma gyur kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir mthong ba las byung ba'i shes pa'i rgyur ma gyur kyang /
translated: Therefore, because it does not conform to the rule of positive and negative concomitance, even though it is not the cause of the cognition that arises from seeing,

original: da snang bas na mthong ba'i 'di'i yul du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da snang bas na mthong ba'i 'di'i yul du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is the appearance of the corpse not the object of the cognition that arises from seeing?

original: bshad pa / bdag nyid kyi rnam pa sems la gtod pa nye bar @76a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / bdag nyid kyi rnam pa sems la gtod pa nye bar @76a * //
translated: In response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: 'jog pa der nus pa gang yin pa de ni yul yin zhing de nyid kyang rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jog pa der nus pa gang yin pa de ni yul yin zhing de nyid kyang rgyu kho na'o //
translated: That which has the capacity to deposit its aspect in the mind is the object, and that is the cause alone.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is a reason.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pas rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pas rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is not a cause because it does not conform to the rule of positive and negative concomitance is not an object.

original: de snang ba nyid kyis don shes pa'i rgyu ma yin nam ;
analyzed: de snang ba nyid kyis don shes pa'i rgyu ma yin nam ;
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the appearance of the object is the cause of the cognition of the object?

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis ni ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: So what is the point of following and reversing the object and cognition?

original: bshad pa gang zhig gang gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa gang zhig gang gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: We respond: That which does not follow and reverse the object is not the cause of the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: That which follows and reverses the object is the cause of the object.

original: de snang ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de snang ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the cause of the object by virtue of its appearance.

original: 'di ltar snang ba'i rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni snang ba'i 'brel ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba'i rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni snang ba'i 'brel ba can yin gyi /
translated: The cause of the appearance of the object is related to the appearance.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin du zhen pa de ni 'brel pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin du zhen pa de ni 'brel pa can ma yin no //
translated: But that which is conceived to be the essence is not related to the appearance.

original: gang gi phyir rab rib la sogs ba'i snang ba dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba nyid skra shad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du zhen par byas pa na de ltar mngon par zhen par byed pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de'i 'brel pa can nam bya bar 'gyur ba skra shad la sogs pa dang 'das pa la sogs pa de ni cung zad kyangüîΩyod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab rib la sogs ba'i snang ba dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba nyid skra shad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du zhen par byas pa na de ltar mngon par zhen par byed pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de'i 'brel pa can nam bya bar 'gyur ba skra shad la sogs pa dang 'das pa la sogs pa de ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Because the appearances of such things as floaters and the appearances of such things as past objects are conceived to be the nature of such things as floaters and the nature of such things as past objects, whatever appearances cause such manifest conceptions, the related or engaged objects such as floaters and past objects do not exist in the slightest.

original: / de'i phyir de snang ba nyid kyi phyir na don rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / de'i phyir de snang ba nyid kyi phyir na don rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because they appear, they are not causes of objects.

original: 'on kyang rgyu nyid kyi phyir de snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu nyid kyi phyir de snang ba nyid do //
translated: However, because they are causes, they appear.

original: gang gi phyir de snang ba nyid la rag las nas rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de snang ba nyid la rag las nas rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because they appear, they are not causes in dependence on appearance.

original: 'on kyang rgyu nyid la rag las pas de snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu nyid la rag las pas de snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: However, because they are causes in dependence on appearance, they appear.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa la rnam pa gzhan gyis 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rgyur 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa la rnam pa gzhan gyis 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rgyur 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that something is the cause of something else in some other way, without following the same and different natures.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de ni yul yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa la snang ba gang yin pa de ni yul yin la /
translated: Because whatever appears to consciousness is the object,

original: snang ba nyid dang 'brel pa can nyid kyang rgyu yin pa nyid las 'gyur ba de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa ni yul nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba nyid dang 'brel pa can nyid kyang rgyu yin pa nyid las 'gyur ba de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa ni yul nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the mere relation to the appearance is the cause, therefore, that which is not the cause does not become the object.

original: des na dngos po de rgyu ma yin yang de snang ba'i phyir shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos po de rgyu ma yin yang de snang ba'i phyir shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de gsal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is clear that you have said that although that thing is not the cause, it becomes the object of consciousness because it appears to it.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med par ni de snang ba 'di nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med par ni de snang ba 'di nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it appears to it without following the same and different natures.

original: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa @76b la 'byung ba yin yang snang ba dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa la mi ltos pa sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa @76b la 'byung ba yin yang snang ba dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa la mi ltos pa sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the thing exists, the cognition arising from words does not apprehend its nature, because the appearance does not depend on the presence or absence of the thing.

original: de nyid snang ba ma yin yang med pa snang ba dang khyad par med par snang ba 'di nyid las yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba ma yin yang med pa snang ba dang khyad par med par snang ba 'di nyid las yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Even though it is not the real thing that appears, it is this appearance that is indistinguishable from the appearance of the nonexistent that is the cause of the cognition.

original: de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa las de'i snang ba nyid du 'gyur zhing de snang ba nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa las de'i snang ba nyid du 'gyur zhing de snang ba nyid kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of the thing is due to the presence or absence of the presence or absence of the thing. And because of the appearance of the thing,

original: yul dang yul can du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: yul dang yul can du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: the object and subject are established.

original: des na shes pa gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa de ni de snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na shes pa gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa de ni de snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if a cognition does not conform to the presence or absence of something, it does not appear as that.

original: dper na gzugs kyi shes pa ro snang ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi shes pa ro snang ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cognition of form does not appear as taste.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang dbang pos rtogs par bya ba'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang dbang pos rtogs par bya ba'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cognition that arises from sound does not conform to the presence or absence of the object that is perceived by the sense faculty. This is a non-observation of a pervader.

original: nges pa'i dngos po snang ba la ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po snang ba la ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: In the case of a definite thing that appears, it is pervaded by having a reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med na yang rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med na yang rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no conformity to presence or absence, then there is no reason.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another reason is not tenable.

original: des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nges pa'i dngos po snang ba nyid chos gzhan las ldog pa na /
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa nges pa'i dngos po snang ba nyid chos gzhan las ldog pa na /
translated: Therefore, by the non-observation of a pervader, when the definite thing that appears has a reason, it is pervaded by the exclusion of other things.

original: don gyi dngos po de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir 'brel pa grub bo //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir 'brel pa grub bo //
translated: Because it conforms to the thing that is the object, the relation is established.

original: des na de ltar dngos po yod pa la yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de snang ba ma yin par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos po yod pa la yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de snang ba ma yin par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that the consciousness arising from words does not perceive existent things,

original: dngos po yod dam med na yang rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod dam med na yang rung ste /
translated: whether things exist or not,

original: sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po'i yul can ma yin par mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po'i yul can ma yin par mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to conclude that the conceptual consciousness arising from words does not have a real thing as its object, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir yul ni rgyu yin la dbang po'i don ni sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la ltos pa med pa sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa dag ni dngos po'i yul can ma
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul ni rgyu yin la dbang po'i don ni sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la ltos pa med pa sgra las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa dag ni dngos po'i yul can ma
translated: Because the object is the cause, the object of the sense faculty is not the cause of the conceptual consciousness arising from words. Therefore, those conceptual consciousnesses arising from words that do not depend on real things do not have real things as their objects.

original: yin no // des na sgra'i shes pa las gzhan du snang bar grub pa yin la /üîΩde las kyang dbang po'i shes pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rig par byed par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // des na sgra'i shes pa las gzhan du snang bar grub pa yin la / de las kyang dbang po'i shes pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rig par byed par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is established that they appear as different from the consciousness of words.üîΩAnd it is tenable that the sense consciousness is cognized by the inexpressible.

original: tshul 'dis rtog pa med pa nyid du yang bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul 'dis rtog pa med pa nyid du yang bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: By this method, it is also established that the sense consciousness is nonconceptual.

original: rnam 'grel du ni rtog pa med @77a * //
analyzed: rnam 'grel du ni rtog pa med @77a * //
translated: In the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, the argument for the non-existence of conceptual

original: par bsgrub pa'i 'thad pa 'dir rang rgyud du bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: par bsgrub pa'i 'thad pa 'dir rang rgyud du bkod pa yin no //
translated: thought is presented as an autonomous argument.üîΩIn order to present another argument for the non-existence of conceptual

original: rtog pa med par bsgrub pa dang / thun mong ba nyid kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul can gyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa med par bsgrub pa dang / thun mong ba nyid kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul can gyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: thought, and to show that the object of the non-conceptual is not a commonüîΩobject, it says,

original: sgra sbyor ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The application of the term . . .üîΩThe application of the term is for the purpose of understanding the objectüîΩthat was seen at the time of the convention, in order to indicate it. The meaning

original: sgra sbyar ba ni brda'i dus su mthong ba'i don bstan par bya ba la rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtogs par bya ba'i don du ste don rtogs pa'i dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra sbyar ba ni brda'i dus su mthong ba'i don bstan par bya ba la rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtogs par bya ba'i don du ste don rtogs pa'i dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is that the purpose of understanding the object is to understand the object.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used to include that which is not included in the followingüîΩverse.üîΩThe purpose of the application is to establish the term, which is preceded by

original: sbyor ba'i dgos pa de'i yang sgra nges par bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgos pa de'i yang sgra nges par bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: the determination of the object.

original: nges par bkod pa med par ni sbyar ba tsam las dgos pa de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bkod pa med par ni sbyar ba tsam las dgos pa de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that purpose is not seen to exist in mere application without a doubt.

original: de'i phyir brda byas pa ni sgra sbyar ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir brda byas pa ni sgra sbyar ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: Therefore, since the convention is made in order to understand the meaning that is preceded by the application of a word,

original: dbang po'i don la ni de'i 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po'i don la ni de'i 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: the object of the sense faculty does not have that as its effect.

original: 'di ltar brda'i dus su mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi tshe'am gzhan du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar brda'i dus su mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi tshe'am gzhan du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what is seen at the time of the convention is not seen at another time or in another place.

original: de la brdar byas pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la brdar byas pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the convention is meaningless.

original: brda byas pa la dgos pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan rjes su 'gro ba med pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir bsdu bar bya ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni dbang po'i don ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brda byas pa la dgos pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan rjes su 'gro ba med pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir bsdu bar bya ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni dbang po'i don ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this very absence of a reason for the convention being purposeless, another summary is explained: The object of the sense faculty is also not endowed with a reason,

original: rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin no //
translated: it is not endowed with a reason.

original: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba nyid yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates a summary.

original: des na don gang la brda byas pa'i don de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa la rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don gang la brda byas pa'i don de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa la rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe object to which a sign is assigned is the object that possesses the universal‚Äù is as follows.

original: yang gang zhig dgag par bya ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa de la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig dgag par bya ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa de la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What purpose is there in the object of negation possessing a universal?

original: gang las te gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir brda'i dus su sgra dang lhan cig brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i 'brel par mthong ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang las te gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir brda'i dus su sgra dang lhan cig brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i 'brel par mthong ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúBecause it possesses a universal‚Äù is as follows.

original: don de tha snyad kyi tshe ste don rtogs par byed pa'i dus su rtog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don de tha snyad kyi tshe ste don rtogs par byed pa'i dus su rtog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The object is conceptualized at the time of the expression, that is, at the time of the understanding of the object.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis dus gzhan du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir don de la sgra sbyor ba yin na dbang po'i don la ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa de nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis dus gzhan du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir don de la sgra sbyor ba yin na dbang po'i don la ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa de nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the word is applied to the object because it is related to the object, then the object of the sense faculty does not have that relation.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba yin @77b na ni dgos pa dang ldan pa'i brda byed pa de las sgra'i khyad par can gyi don rtogs pa na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid du mthong ba yin @77b na ni dgos pa dang ldan pa'i brda byed pa de las sgra'i khyad par can gyi don rtogs pa na /
translated: If it is seen to be related, then when the object qualified by the word is understood from the word that is used with a purpose,

original: brjod par bya ba rtogs par byed par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rtogs par byed par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: the object to be expressed would be understood.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that relation does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa gang gi phyir 'di ltar yul lam dus gcig tu mthong ba'i khyad par bye brag de ni /
analyzed: bshad pa gang gi phyir 'di ltar yul lam dus gcig tu mthong ba'i khyad par bye brag de ni /
translated: Because the particular thing that is seen in one place or at one time

original: yul lam dus gzhan du ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul lam dus gzhan du ma mthong ngo //
translated: is not seen in another place or at another time.

original: 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni gtan dgag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni gtan dgag pa'i don du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some cases‚Äù means ‚Äúin all cases.‚Äù

original: phyir gyi sgra ni gang gi phyir tha dad pa'i spyi yang mthong ba med pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i don ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: phyir gyi sgra ni gang gi phyir tha dad pa'i spyi yang mthong ba med pa de'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i don ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is to be connected to the other sentence, ‚Äúbecause a different universal is not seen.‚Äù

original: yang gsal ba 'di dag yul dang gzhan du mthong ba ma yin na yul dang dus gzhan du zhen pa gang yin pa 'di ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yang gsal ba 'di dag yul dang gzhan du mthong ba ma yin na yul dang dus gzhan du zhen pa gang yin pa 'di ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But if these manifestations are not seen in a different place, how is it that they are conceived in a different place and time?üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams te /üîΩrang gi ngo bo nges pa rnams phan tshun du rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams te / rang gi ngo bo nges pa rnams phan tshun du rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Because these manifestationsüîΩdo not mutually follow each other,

original: rjes su 'jug cing gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di skad du gcig tu zhen pa bden pa gang gsal ba rnams ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug cing gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no // 'di skad du gcig tu zhen pa bden pa gang gsal ba rnams ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan ba ma yin te /
translated: they are not conceived as one.üîΩThis is what he means: The manifestations that are conceived as one are not seen to follow each other.

original: gcig gi rang bzhin du mthong ba ma yin no zhes bstan ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin du mthong ba ma yin no zhes bstan ba yin no //
translated: They are not seen to be one.

original: ji ltar na gcig nyid du zhen kyang gcig ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig nyid du zhen kyang gcig ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can they be conceived as one even though they are not one?

original: bshad pa ; nus pa ni gsal ba rnams kyi bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ; nus pa ni gsal ba rnams kyi bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed bar nus pa'o //
translated: The reply: The capacity is the capacity of the manifest to perform a function, such as burning.

original: 'dis ni yod pa nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yod pa nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: This indicates existence,

original: don byed nus pa nyid ni yod pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed nus pa nyid ni yod pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the capacity to perform a function is the existence of existent things.

original: snang ba ni shes pa la yod pa'i don gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni shes pa la yod pa'i don gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The appearance is the image of an object in consciousness.

original: 'di ni yod pa rnam par 'jog pa'i tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa rnam par 'jog pa'i tshad ma yin te /
translated: This is the valid cognition that determines existence,

original: gang gi phyir snang ba de las 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe yod par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba de las 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe yod par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: because it is the case that something is known to exist in some place, at some time, by some person,

original: gzhan las ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: but not by another,

original: yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because even though it exists, it is not distinguished from nonexistence.

original: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: This will be explained later.üîΩThe ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gzung ngo //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: de dag tha dad pa de'i phyir gsal ba rnams gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa de'i phyir gsal ba rnams gcig ma yin no //
translated: Because of the difference of those, the manifest is not one.

original: de la dbye bar bya ba'i dngos par yang nus pa yod pa dang med pa dag nyid las tha dad par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la dbye bar bya ba'i dngos par yang nus pa yod pa dang med pa dag nyid las tha dad par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The object to be divided is either capable or incapable.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pas ni ma @78a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pas ni ma @78a * //
translated: The effect is not different.

original: yin no // gang gi phyir tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin la /
analyzed: yin no // gang gi phyir tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin la /
translated: Because difference has as its reason the possession of contradictory properties.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i gsal ba yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i gsal ba yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: And the manifestation that is mutually exclusive is both existent and nonexistent, but not existent.

original: ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig rang gi dngos po med pa dang 'gal ba de bzhin du rung ba med par nges pa'i dngos po gzhan dang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig rang gi dngos po med pa dang 'gal ba de bzhin du rung ba med par nges pa'i dngos po gzhan dang yin te /
translated: Just as some existent is contradictory with its nonexistence, so too is it with another existent that is ascertained to be without a suitable basis.

original: dper na sngon po sngon po med par nges pa'i sngon po ma yin pa dang 'gal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po sngon po med par nges pa'i sngon po ma yin pa dang 'gal ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, blue is contradictory with non-blue, which is ascertained to be without blue.

original: de med ba la 'khrul ba med pa nyid btang na ni dngos po dngos po gzhan dang phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de med ba la 'khrul ba med pa nyid btang na ni dngos po dngos po gzhan dang phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If the absence of that is relinquished, then the existent is not called ‚Äúmutually exclusive with another existent‚Äù through mutual exclusion.

original: phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin no zhes de dang der gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin no zhes de dang der gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The reason why they are mutually exclusive is because they are the reasons for being a thing and a non-thing. In order to demonstrate this, it is said in the sutra, ‚ÄúIt is like a thing and a non-thing.‚Äù

original: gal te yang mar me'i me lce'i rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa la mi 'khrul pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang mar me'i me lce'i rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa med pa la mi 'khrul pa yin na ni /
translated: If the non-erroneous state of the flame of a lamp is the state of not having the capacity to generate the consciousness that perceives it,

original: de dag 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ba yin na de ni nus pa gzhan yod pa dang med pa la ltos pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ba yin na de ni nus pa gzhan yod pa dang med pa la ltos pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: then they would be mutually exclusive. But that is not the case, because the existence or nonexistence of the capacity is not dependent on it.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu du ma'i nus pa ni 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu du ma'i nus pa ni 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the capacity for multiple effects is not mutually exclusive.

original: 'di'i tha dad pa 'dzin pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i tha dad pa 'dzin pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum nyid yin la /
translated: The apprehension of their difference is the direct perception that apprehends the capacity-endowed nature.

original: 'dzin par byed pa nyid ni snang ba dang ldan pas yin pa de'i phyir tha dad par 'dzin pa ni snang ba tha dad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa nyid ni snang ba dang ldan pas yin pa de'i phyir tha dad par 'dzin pa ni snang ba tha dad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The apprehension of difference is due to the presence of a different appearance.

original: des na snang ba tha dad pa brjod pa ni dngos po tha dad pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa'i don du yin gyi /
analyzed: des na snang ba tha dad pa brjod pa ni dngos po tha dad pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa'i don du yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement about the difference in appearance is intended to show the reason for the understanding of difference in entity.

original: snang ba tha dad pa nyid ni dngos po tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa nyid ni dngos po tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: The difference in appearance is not the difference in entity.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po tha dad pa ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yin na snang ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po tha dad pa ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa yin na snang ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes pa yin no //
translated: Because the difference in entity is the difference in intrinsic nature, but appearance is not the intrinsic nature of an entity, rather it is cognition.

original: 'o na mngon sum dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Well then, direct perception is the apprehension of the intrinsic nature of an entity.

original: tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar 'dzin pa gang gi gcig gi ngo bo gzhan la med par gzung na ni don de des ston par bzung ba'i phyir tha dad pa gzung bar 'gyur na mngon sum ni med pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar 'dzin pa gang gi gcig gi ngo bo gzhan la med par gzung na ni don de des ston par bzung ba'i phyir tha dad pa gzung bar 'gyur na mngon sum ni med pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na
translated: If one apprehends the different natures of things, and apprehends the nature of one thing as not being in another, then one apprehends that object as being shown by that. Therefore, one would apprehend difference. But direct perception does not apprehend nonexistence.

original: / 'dir brjod pa don byed pa la nye bar sbyor bar mthong ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid de la nus pa yin te /
analyzed: / 'dir brjod pa don byed pa la nye bar sbyor bar mthong ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid de la nus pa yin te /
translated: Here we say: That very nature which is seen to be applied to the performance of an object‚Äôs function is its capacity.

original: ma mthong ba brtag na ni ha cang thal ba'i phyir @78b ro ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba brtag na ni ha cang thal ba'i phyir @78b ro ;
translated: If one investigates what is not seen, it would follow that anything could be anything.

original: / don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid kyang dngos po yin te /
analyzed: / don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid kyang dngos po yin te /
translated: That very nature which is able to perform a function is an entity,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of an entity is that which is able to perform a function.

original: don byed par bzod pa'i rang bzhin gang de de snang ba nyid las mngon sum gyis nges par byed pa na yang de nyams pa rnam par gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: don byed par bzod pa'i rang bzhin gang de de snang ba nyid las mngon sum gyis nges par byed pa na yang de nyams pa rnam par gcod pa yin te /
translated: When one ascertains by means of direct perception that the nature which is able to perform a function is itself an entity, one eliminates the possibility that it is impaired.

original: nyams par dogs na ni rang bzhin du yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams par dogs na ni rang bzhin du yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you fear that it is lost, then it is not completely determined as the nature of the object.

original: de'i phyir gzung ba'i rang bzhin nges pa nyid kyi shugs kyis rang bzhin nyams pa med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba'i rang bzhin nges pa nyid kyi shugs kyis rang bzhin nyams pa med par nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the determination of the nature of the object is the determination of the absence of the loss of the nature of the subject.

original: gang las de'i rnam par mngon sum du gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ba dngos po med pa lus dang ldan pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang las de'i rnam par mngon sum du gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ba dngos po med pa lus dang ldan pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The non-existence of the object is not something that can be directly apprehended by the body, but rather

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis tha snyad du bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis tha snyad du bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: it is merely a conventional designation due to the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i 'dzin pa ni 'di nyid yin te de nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i 'dzin pa ni 'di nyid yin te de nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of non-existence is precisely this determination,

original: rang gi rnam par nges par byas pa nyid las de'i dngos po med pa yang med pa nyid du nges par 'gyur ba rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par nges par byas pa nyid las de'i dngos po med pa yang med pa nyid du nges par 'gyur ba rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: and the determination of its non-existence is the exclusion of the existence of that [object] due to the determination of its own form.

original: nyams pa bzhin du nyams pa dang ldan pa thams cad kyang rnam par bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams pa bzhin du nyams pa dang ldan pa thams cad kyang rnam par bcad pa yin te /
translated: Just as with the loss, all that possesses loss is also excluded.

original: gang gi phyir ser po la sogs pa ni sngon po nyams pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ser po la sogs pa ni sngon po nyams pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because yellow and so on are associated with the absence of blue,

original: snang bar gyur pa de dag la sngon po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa de dag la sngon po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because blue is not seen in those that appear as yellow and so on.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis nges pa'i rang bzhin snang ba las gcig gi rang bzhin du yongs su bcad pa na nyams pa dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis nges pa'i rang bzhin snang ba las gcig gi rang bzhin du yongs su bcad pa na nyams pa dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, by the mere apprehension of all, the nature of blue is ascertained. When the nature of one is determined, the absence of the others is excluded.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pas ni gang gi phyir 'di sngon po'i rang bzhin du ma dmigs pa de'i phyir sngon po ma yin no zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pas ni gang gi phyir 'di sngon po'i rang bzhin du ma dmigs pa de'i phyir sngon po ma yin no zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: By the non-apprehension of blue, one conventionally says, ‚ÄúBecause blue is not apprehended, it does not exist.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i nges pas mngon sum nyid kyis dngos po dngos po gzhan las tha dad par byed pa ma yin zhing tha snyad du byed pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i nges pas mngon sum nyid kyis dngos po dngos po gzhan las tha dad par byed pa ma yin zhing tha snyad du byed pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the ascertainment of non-existence, direct perception does not distinguish one entity from another entity. Non-apprehension is what makes the conventional distinction.

original: rang bzhin nges par byed pa'i mngon sum 'di nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan med par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par byed pa'i mngon sum 'di nyid kyis rnam pa gzhan med par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: This direct perception that ascertains the nature of the object realizes that there is no other aspect.

original: de srid par dogs na ni sngon po'i rang bzhin nges par yongs su ma bcad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de srid par dogs na ni sngon po'i rang bzhin nges par yongs su ma bcad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you suspect that there is, then it follows that the nature of blue would not be ascertained and determined.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po'i rang bzhin nyams pa rnam par bcad pas nyams pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po'i rang bzhin nyams pa rnam par bcad pas nyams pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of the impairment of the nature of blue is the negation of an impaired entity.

original: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa @79a * //
analyzed: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa @79a * //
translated: The aspect that is the nature of both blue and nonblueüîΩis a third alternative.

original: gsum pa las sngon po'i rang bzhin ma log pa'i phyir de rnam par ma bcad na ni sngon po nyid yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum pa las sngon po'i rang bzhin ma log pa'i phyir de rnam par ma bcad na ni sngon po nyid yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is not eliminated, then blue itself is not determined,

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt about the nature of both.

original: gang gi phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin dag kho nas gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin dag kho nas gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because whatever is the nature of both is just the nature of both.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir don byed pa gcig 'dzin pa ni mi slu ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir don byed pa gcig 'dzin pa ni mi slu ba dang bcas par mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the seen is to be considered as having the nature of both, the apprehension of a single object-support would not be deceptive, but it is deceptive.

original: de'i phyir gal te gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gsum yod na ni mthong ba'i don 'di gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa gsum yod na ni mthong ba'i don 'di gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the three aspects having the nature of both exist, then this seen object would have the nature of both.

original: 'di ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du yang dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du yang dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not perceived as having the nature of both.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan mngon sum nyid kyis spangs pa la snang ba mi dmigs pas tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan mngon sum nyid kyis spangs pa la snang ba mi dmigs pas tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of other aspects is made conventionally by the non-perception of appearances.

original: de bzhin du rim can la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum nyid rnam pa gsum pa'i gcod byed du blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim can la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum nyid rnam pa gsum pa'i gcod byed du blta'o //
translated: In the same way, the direct perception of sequential objects and so on should be seen as the instrument for excluding the three aspects.

original: rnam grangs 'dis mthong ba'am brtags pa'i gnyis 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa gsum pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis mthong ba'am brtags pa'i gnyis 'dus pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa gsum pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: By this method, it should be understood that the existence of a third aspect called the nature of the combination of the two, seen or imagined, is not possible.

original: sngon po la sogs nyams pa dang ldan pa yang sngon po ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs nyams pa dang ldan pa yang sngon po ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which possesses the experience of blue, etc. is not blue.

original: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rnam pa gzhan med pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rnam pa gzhan med pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: And in this case, ‚Äúthere is no other aspect apart from blue and non-blue,‚Äù direct perception itself is the valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gcig 'dzin pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de ni de gzhan las tha dad par byed pa dang / rnam pa gzhan sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gcig 'dzin pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de ni de gzhan las tha dad par byed pa dang / rnam pa gzhan sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever valid cognition apprehends a single nature, that is what distinguishes it from other things and excludes other aspects.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar nus pa tha dad pa ni dngos po tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar nus pa tha dad pa ni dngos po tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, different capacities are different things.

original: snang ba tha dad pa yang de 'dzin pa'i tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa yang de 'dzin pa'i tshad ma yin te /
translated: And different appearances are the valid cognition that apprehends them.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: The PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika says,

original: gcig yin na ni blo'i snang ba tha dad pa dang 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig yin na ni blo'i snang ba tha dad pa dang 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: If it were one, then the different appearances to the mind would not be different things.

original: gal te nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pa yul dang dus tha dad pa'i gsal ba rnams gcig nyid ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pa yul dang dus tha dad pa'i gsal ba rnams gcig nyid ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said that the different things such as potency and manifestation are not the same, because they are different objects and times?

original: yul dang dus tha dad pa yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus tha dad pa yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
translated: And being different objects and times is itself the contradictory property.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba'i tha dad par 'dod pa na yul dang @79b dus tha dad pa las 'gal ba'i chos gzhan bstan pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba'i tha dad par 'dod pa na yul dang @79b dus tha dad pa las 'gal ba'i chos gzhan bstan pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, when it is asserted that they are different because they are contradictory, it is untenable to demonstrate that they are contradictory because they are different objects and times.

original: mi 'dod na yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa gzhan tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dod na yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa gzhan tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But even if you do not assert that, the contradictory property is not the cause of their difference.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩphan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
translated: Here we say:üîΩMutually exclusive contradiction is like being a thing and being a nonthing.

original: dngos po'i cha dag ni phan tshun med pa med pa mi 'khrul pa nyid las 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i cha dag ni phan tshun med pa med pa mi 'khrul pa nyid las 'gal ba yin te /
translated: But the aspects of a thing are not mutually exclusive because they are not confused about their absence.

original: 'khrul na ni 'bras bu du ma bsgrub pa'i nus pa bzhin du gcig tu 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul na ni 'bras bu du ma bsgrub pa'i nus pa bzhin du gcig tu 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: If it were mistaken, then just as it has the ability to produce many effects, it would be one.

original: de la ni yul dang dus gcig yongs su spangs nas yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ni yul dang dus gcig yongs su spangs nas yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, having completely abandoned one place and time, it is not related to another place and time.

original: 'on kyang gcig pa nyid kyis te /üîΩdngos po de nyid yul dang dus der yang yod pa yul dang dus gzhan na yang yod pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir slob dpon yul la sogs pa tha dad na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig pa nyid kyis te / dngos po de nyid yul dang dus der yang yod pa yul dang dus gzhan na yang yod pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir slob dpon yul la sogs pa tha dad na /
translated: However, it is by virtue of being one.üîΩThat very thing exists in that place and time, and it also exists in another place and time.

original: nus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par ston pa na yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa ni yul dang dus gzhan spangs pa yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad par ston pa na yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa ni yul dang dus gzhan spangs pa yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, the master, when teaching that if the object and so on are different, the nature possessing the ability is also different, teaches that being related to another place and time is abandoning another place and time.

original: 'di ltar yul lam dus gcig 'dzin pa'i shes pas de'i rang bzhin nyams pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir nyams pa dang ldan pa'i yul dang dus gzhan rnam par gcad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul lam dus gcig 'dzin pa'i shes pas de'i rang bzhin nyams pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir nyams pa dang ldan pa'i yul dang dus gzhan rnam par gcad pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the consciousness that apprehends one object or one time excludes the nature of that object or time that is impaired, and thus it excludes other objects and times that are impaired.

original: ji ltar yul dang dus gzhan bcad pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin rnam par bcad pa'i yul la sogs pa na yod pa rnam par gcad pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yul dang dus gzhan bcad pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin rnam par bcad pa'i yul la sogs pa na yod pa rnam par gcad pa yin te /
translated: Just as it excludes other objects and times, it also excludes objects and so on that exist in other places, because it excludes the nature that is related to the object and so on that is seen.

original: ma bkag pa'i rang bzhin ni bkag pa'i yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i rang bzhin ni bkag pa'i yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not tenable that the nature that is not excluded is related to the object and so on that is excluded.

original: gnas pa'i rang bzhin yod pa yin na ni yul gzhan yang yod par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rang bzhin yod pa yin na ni yul gzhan yang yod par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: If the nature of endurance exists, then it follows that other objects would exist,

original: mthong ba'i yul nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it would be like the object that is seen.

original: des na yul gzhan na gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni yul gcig na yod pa'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir yul gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ni yul dang dus de'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa la mi 'khrul pa yin no
analyzed: des na yul gzhan na gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni yul gcig na yod pa'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir yul gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ni yul dang dus de'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa la mi 'khrul pa yin no
translated: Therefore, the nature that exists in another place exists having abandoned the nature that exists in one place. Therefore, the nature that is related to another place is not mistaken with respect to the nonexistence of the nature of that place and time.

original: // de'i phyir de'i yul nyid dang gzhan gyi yul nyid gcig la 'gal lo //
analyzed: // de'i phyir de'i yul nyid dang gzhan gyi yul nyid gcig la 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, its being that place and its being another place are mutually exclusive.

original: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dus tha dad na tha dad pa yin te /üîΩskyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dang / rgyun gyis gnas @80a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa dus tha dad na tha dad pa yin te / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dang / rgyun gyis gnas @80a * //
translated: In the same way, arising, etc., are different if they exist at different times.

original: pa dang mi gnas pa dag phan tshun med pa mi 'khrul pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang mi gnas pa dag phan tshun med pa mi 'khrul pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Arisen and unarisen, disintegrated and not disintegrated, enduring and not enduring by way of a continuum, are mutually exclusive because they are not mistaken with respect to each other.

original: de'i phyir yul dang dus tha dad pa na yod pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dang dus tha dad pa na yod pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the existence of a thing in a different place and time is a different nature that possesses the capacity and is a different nature that possesses contradictory properties, such as arising and so on.

original: snang ba tha dad pa yang de dag rnam par 'jog pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa yang de dag rnam par 'jog pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: The different appearances are the valid knowledge that posits them.

original: de'i phyir yul dang dus tha dad pa'i gsal ba rnam par gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dang dus tha dad pa'i gsal ba rnam par gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the manifestation of a thing in a different place and time is not the same.

original: 'di snyam du dbang po'i rtogs par bya ba gsal ba rnams tha dad par 'dod pa yin yang tha dad pa med pa dbang po'i rtogs par bya ba'i spyi gzhan yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dbang po'i rtogs par bya ba gsal ba rnams tha dad par 'dod pa yin yang tha dad pa med pa dbang po'i rtogs par bya ba'i spyi gzhan yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúAlthough the manifestations that are objects of the senses are asserted to be different, is there not another object of the senses, a universal that is not different?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pa de las tha dad pa 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pa de las tha dad pa 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyi spyi gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Response: A universal that is a different nature that engages with objects is not different from the different natures that are its parts,

original: tha mi dad pa'i spyi ni bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i spyi ni bkag pa yin la /
translated: because a universal that is not different has been refuted.

original: tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes 'dis spyi tha dad par smra ba 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes 'dis spyi tha dad par smra ba 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Nor is there a difference. This refutes the assertion of a universal that is different.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i blo tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i blo tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the cognition that arises from the sense faculty.

original: blo tha dad pa med pa nyid gtan tshigs su dgod pa rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: blo tha dad pa med pa nyid gtan tshigs su dgod pa rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain the reason that there is no difference in cognition, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is not seen.‚Äù

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid rnams las tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is different from the individual things.

original: ji lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of difference?

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i gsal ba rnams la rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i gsal ba rnams la rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is different from the individual things that do not have the property of pervasion.

original: ma mthong ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pas yul du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pas yul du ma byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot seen‚Äù means not taken as an object by the sense consciousness.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba de'i phyir med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba de'i phyir med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not seen, it does not exist.

original: don de ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gcig dang de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i sgra'i yul du 'gyur bar brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: don de ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gcig dang de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i sgra'i yul du 'gyur bar brtags pa yin la /
translated: That object is imagined to be the object of a single cognition that has the property of pervasion and the word that follows it.

original: sgra dang blo dag gi yul de yang snang ba yin na snang ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang blo dag gi yul de yang snang ba yin na snang ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And if that object of words and mind is an appearance, it is not an appearance.

original: de'i phyir gang la rnam pa gcig tu rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba blo dang sgra rjes su 'gro bar rung ba de ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la rnam pa gcig tu rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba blo dang sgra rjes su 'gro bar rung ba de ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no object that is the cause of the conception of a single aspect, and it is not suitable for the mind and words to accord.

original: blos yul du byas pa'i don nyid la sgra 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blos yul du byas pa'i don nyid la sgra 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because words engage their objects that are mentally created.

original: 'dis ni shugs kyis sgra dang blo dag bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shugs kyis sgra dang blo dag bstan to //
translated: This implicitly teaches that words and mind are not the same.

original: 'di snyam du ma mthong ba las don tha dad pa med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ma mthong ba las don tha dad pa med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na bshad pa /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow could it be that there is no difference between what is seen and what is not seen?‚Äù it is explained:

original: gang gi phyir snang ba'i don tha dad pa nyid la ni blo tha dad pa sna tshogs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba'i don tha dad pa nyid la ni blo tha dad pa sna tshogs pa mthong ste /
translated: Because of the difference in the appearance of objects, a variety of different minds are seen.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba'i don @80b yod pa nyid dang / gcig gi gcig nyid dang / tha dad par gyur pa'i tha dad pa nyid la ni blo yod pa nyid dang / gcig nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba'i don @80b yod pa nyid dang / gcig gi gcig nyid dang / tha dad par gyur pa'i tha dad pa nyid la ni blo yod pa nyid dang / gcig nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
translated: Because the existence of the object of appearance, the oneness of one with another, and the difference of the different are pervaded by the existence of cognition, oneness, and difference.

original: 'byung po dang mgul chings bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i yul ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po dang mgul chings bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i yul ston pa'o //
translated: Like a spirit and a necklace. This shows the pervaded domain.

original: 'byung po ni gza' rnams sam ma mo'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'byung po ni gza' rnams sam ma mo'i tshogs so //
translated: A spirit is a planet or a group of demons.

original: mgul chings ni me rtog gi phreng ba dpyangs pa'i tha gu'o //
analyzed: mgul chings ni me rtog gi phreng ba dpyangs pa'i tha gu'o //
translated: A necklace is a rope on which a garland of fire-gems is hung.

original: de tha dad pa ni bltar rung ba nyid kyis rang gi yul can gyi shes pa tha dad pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de tha dad pa ni bltar rung ba nyid kyis rang gi yul can gyi shes pa tha dad pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: The difference of that is pervaded by the difference of the cognition of its domain, because it is visible.

original: 'dir yang snang ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la snang ba'i spyi yod na ni de'i phyir blo tha dad pa nyid du thal ba de med pa'i phyir don tha dad pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang snang ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la snang ba'i spyi yod na ni de'i phyir blo tha dad pa nyid du thal ba de med pa'i phyir don tha dad pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Here also, if the universals of appearance exist in the particulars of appearance, then because of the absence of the consequence of the difference of cognition, there is no difference of object. This is the non-observation of the essential property.

original: ci ste yang blo tha dad pa med par mthong ba'i don tha dad par khas len na ni de'i tshe shes pa de tha dad pa med kyang tha dad par rtogs na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang blo tha dad pa med par mthong ba'i don tha dad par khas len na ni de'i tshe shes pa de tha dad pa med kyang tha dad par rtogs na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you accept that the object of seeing is different, even though the cognition is not different, then it follows, absurdly, that even though the cognition is not different, it cognizes different things.

original: gang cung zad tha dad par ma mthong ba de nyid la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brtag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i yul las 'das par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang cung zad tha dad par ma mthong ba de nyid la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brtag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i yul las 'das par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that the object of desire would transcend the realm of the desired, because you could imagine anything you wanted to be that object, even though you had not seen it as different.

original: gcig dang du ma'i tha snyad nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
