translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.

original: gal te yid kyi mngon sum yod na de'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes mdo mdzad pas grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa'i yid kyi mngon sum khas blangs pa la rtsod pa byas pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //üîΩdmigs pa'i rkyen bsal ba'i phyir yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen smos te /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi mngon sum yod na de'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes mdo mdzad pas grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa'i yid kyi mngon sum khas blangs pa la rtsod pa byas pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //üîΩdmigs pa'i rkyen bsal ba'i phyir yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is the direct perceiver‚Äù is used as a conventional designation based on the name that is known in philosophical treatises.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äú

original: 'di ltar rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i skad cig dang lhan cig pas rang gi rgyud la yod pa rigs mtshungs pa phyi ma skyed pa dbang po'i shes pa de ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa dbang po'i shes pa la dmigs
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i skad cig dang lhan cig pas rang gi rgyud la yod pa rigs mtshungs pa phyi ma skyed pa dbang po'i shes pa de ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa dbang po'i shes pa la dmigs
translated: Thus, the sense consciousness that exists in one‚Äôs own continuum, which produces a later consciousness of the same type simultaneously with its object, sometimes produces the knowledge of another‚Äôs mind of yogins who focus on the sense consciousness that exists in another‚Äôs continuum.

original: pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi sems shes pa skyed par byed pas de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen smos pas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi sems shes pa skyed par byed pas de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen smos pas bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is excluded by the statement ‚Äúthe condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.‚Äù

original: rang gi ni bdag nyid kyi ste dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: rang gi ni bdag nyid kyi ste dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul lo //
translated: ‚Äú Its‚Äù refers to the object of the sense consciousness, that is, of one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: de'i zhes drug pas ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig dag nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba'i dngos por bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i zhes drug pas ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig dag nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba'i dngos por bstan pa yin te /
translated: The sixth case ending in ‚Äúof that‚Äù indicates that the earlier and later moments are the appropriated and the appropriator.

original: des na dbang po'i shes pa'i yul rgyur byas pa'i skad cig ma bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i shes pa'i yul rgyur byas pa'i skad cig ma bzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sense consciousness apprehends the moment that is the cause of the object.

original: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni bar ma chod pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni bar ma chod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Immediately‚Äù means without interruption.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir yang skad cig ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir yang skad cig ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: This word ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù indicates that the object is momentary, and thus the cognition is momentary.

original: dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa ni /üîΩdon gcig pas de'i lhan cig byed pa can yin gyi bogs 'byin par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa gang yin pa ni / don gcig pas de'i lhan cig byed pa can yin gyi bogs 'byin par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty isüîΩnot a contributory cause of the object, because it is simultaneous with the object.

original: skad cig gi rdzas la bogs 'byin pa ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gi rdzas la bogs 'byin pa ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a contributory cause that enhances the object, because it is not tenable that an enhancement is made to a momentary substance.

original: de dag kyang bya ba gcig pas ni lhan cig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bya ba gcig pas ni lhan cig byed pa yin no //
translated: They are contributory causes because they have the same activity.

original: de lta bur gyur pa des bskyed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa des bskyed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: The mental cognition that is produced by that kind of eye faculty is direct perception.

original: khyad par gnyis pa 'dis kyang de'i yul bstan pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir yid de lta bu yin pa de nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir dbang po med par mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gnyis pa 'dis kyang de'i yul bstan pa yin no // gang gi phyir yid de lta bu yin pa de nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir dbang po med par mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: This second qualification also indicates the object of that mental cognition.üîΩBecause the mental cognition is of that kind, it is not a seeing that is without a sense faculty.

original: gang la de'i yul can gyi dbang po med pa de la de'i yul can gyi yid kyis mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de'i yul can gyi dbang po med pa de la de'i yul can gyi yid kyis mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Where there is no sense faculty that is the basis of the mental cognition, there is no mental cognition that is the seeing.

original: dbang po med pa nyid ni dbang po'i @87a * //
analyzed: dbang po med pa nyid ni dbang po'i @87a * //
translated: The absence of faculties is the absence of faculties.üîΩ

original: bya ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of sense faculty is the absence of the activity of the sense faculty.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs su ni yid mthong ba 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs su ni yid mthong ba 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: When the mind is in a conceptual state, it does not engage in seeing,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dbang po'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dbang po'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent, the sense consciousness, is absent.

original: yul gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it is a different object,

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i gzung ba'i don gyi nang du gtogs pa'i skad cig ma 'dzin pa de'i phyir don gzhan ni tha na rgyud tha mi dad pa yang 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i gzung ba'i don gyi nang du gtogs pa'i skad cig ma 'dzin pa de'i phyir don gzhan ni tha na rgyud tha mi dad pa yang 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: because it apprehends the moment of the object that is included in the object that is grasped by the sense consciousness. Therefore, it does not apprehend a different object, even if it is not a different continuum.

original: des na pha rol po dag gis dbang po'i byed pa med par yang don mthong bar thal ba dang / de bzhin du yid kyis kyang mthong ba'i phyir long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal bar gang brjod pa de spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na pha rol po dag gis dbang po'i byed pa med par yang don mthong bar thal ba dang / de bzhin du yid kyis kyang mthong ba'i phyir long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal bar gang brjod pa de spangs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the consequence that the opponent mentioned, namely, that objects would be seen without the activity of the sense faculty and that the blind and deaf would exist because the mind also sees, is avoided.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / long ba la sogs pa la yang gzung ba mthong ba la rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pas lhan cig byas pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / long ba la sogs pa la yang gzung ba mthong ba la rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pas lhan cig byas pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for the state of conceptualization, and because even the blind see objects, since the sense consciousness that is co-produced by the immediately preceding object of the sense faculty does not exist.

original: gang yang gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par thal bar brjod pa de yang 'di nyid kyis spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par thal bar brjod pa de yang 'di nyid kyis spangs pa yin no //
translated: And this also refutes the claim that it is not a valid cognition because it apprehends an object that is already apprehended.

original: byed pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa'o //
translated: Action is activity and performance.

original: de'i dus ni don yod pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de'i dus ni don yod pa'i dus te /
translated: Its time is the time of existence.

original: yod pa'i dngos po nyid byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po nyid byed pa yin no //
translated: An existent thing itself is action.

original: byed pa'i dus mi mtshungs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i dus mi mtshungs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which does not have the same time of action is said to be that.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul de ni yid kyi rnam shes kyi rgyu dbang po'i shes pa de dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul de ni yid kyi rnam shes kyi rgyu dbang po'i shes pa de dang byed pa'i dus mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: The object of mental consciousness is not the same time of action as the sense consciousness that is the cause of mental consciousness.

original: dus tha dad pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The reason for their being different times is stated:

original: rang ste bdag nyid kyi shes pa de'i dus de na yod pa'i ngang tshul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang ste bdag nyid kyi shes pa de'i dus de na yod pa'i ngang tshul gang yin pa'o //
translated: The state of that consciousness, i.e., of the self, at that time.

original: gang gi phyir yid kyi shes pa'i yul ni de'i dus na yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid kyi shes pa'i yul ni de'i dus na yod pa yin la /
translated: Because the object of mental consciousness exists at that time.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las snga ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las snga ma yin te /
translated: And the sense consciousness is prior to the mental consciousness.

original: des na de dag snga phyi yin pa de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag snga phyi yin pa de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are prior and subsequent, they are not co-existent causes.

original: gal te sngar skyes pa nyid 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa yin na ni phyi ma de la byed pa ma yin la ci ste phyis 'byung bas 'bras bu skyed na ni snga ma zhig zin pa'i phyir de la byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dus
analyzed: gal te sngar skyes pa nyid 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa yin na ni phyi ma de la byed pa ma yin la ci ste phyis 'byung bas 'bras bu skyed na ni snga ma zhig zin pa'i phyir de la byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dus
translated: If that which arises earlier establishes the effect, then that which arises later does not perform the action. But if that which arises later produces the effect, then that which arises earlier is already destroyed, so it does not perform the action.

original: tha dad pa dag don gcig byed pa nyid yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag don gcig byed pa nyid yin /
translated: How can those that are temporally distinct perform the same action?

original: de'i phyir don ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don ni lhan cig byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is not a co-existent cause.

original: de ltar yul dang shes pa dus @87b mnyam par khas blangs nas rgol zhing rtog par thal bar dogs pas she na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar yul dang shes pa dus @87b mnyam par khas blangs nas rgol zhing rtog par thal bar dogs pas she na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, having accepted that the object and consciousness are simultaneous, he argues and thinks that there is a consequence.

original: ma yin te /üîΩgnyi g-yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma yin te / gnyi g-yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: gnyi ga ni dbang po'i shes pa dang yid kyi yul lo //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni dbang po'i shes pa dang yid kyi yul lo //
translated: Both are the object of the sense consciousness and the mental consciousness.

original: dus mtshungs pa ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Simultaneous means the same time.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, they are not co-existent causes.

original: / dus mtshungs pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: / dus mtshungs pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to prove that they are simultaneous, it is explained:

original: shes pa'i rgyu skyed par byed pa'i yul te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu skyed par byed pa'i yul te /
translated: The object is the cause that produces consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te /
translated: Thus, what is not a cause is not an object,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences, as already explained.

original: de ni rang gi shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar te /üîΩdus gcig par 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: de ni rang gi shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar te / dus gcig par 'gal ba yin la /
translated: That is co-existent with its own consciousness,üîΩmeaning at the same time, is contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba de'i phyir dus mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba de'i phyir dus mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of that contradiction, they are not simultaneous.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig pa yin pa lan nus pa med pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig pa yin pa lan nus pa med pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Because if something is coexistent, it is necessarily devoid of capability.

original: des na 'gal ba khyab pa nyid kyis skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba khyab pa nyid kyis skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory for something to be a producer and also to be coexistent.

original: yang lhan cig tu yod pa la nus pa med pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang lhan cig tu yod pa la nus pa med pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Moreover, why is something that exists in a coexistent manner devoid of capability?

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i snga rol du ni lhan cig tu yod pa'i skad cig ma med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i snga rol du ni lhan cig tu yod pa'i skad cig ma med pa yin la /
translated: Prior to the production of the effect, the moment that exists in a coexistent manner does not exist.

original: med pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid nus pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba 'ga' yang med pas sngar skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid nus pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba 'ga' yang med pas sngar skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And because that which does not exist is characterized by being devoid of all capability, it does not engage in the production of the effect in the least. Therefore, it is not a producer prior to the effect.

original: nus pa yod pa'i dus na ste rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa na yang nye bar sbyor ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: nus pa yod pa'i dus na ste rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa na yang nye bar sbyor ba med pa nyid de /
translated: Even when it has capability, that is, when the cause is complete, it does not engage in the production of the effect.

original: 'bras bu bdag nyid thams cad rdzogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bdag nyid thams cad rdzogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect is already complete in itself.

original: de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of that passage.

original: sngar ni nus pa med pas nye bar sbyor ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni nus pa med pas nye bar sbyor ba med pa yin la /
translated: Previously, it was devoid of capability and therefore did not engage in the production of the effect.

original: nus pa yod pa'i dus na yang 'bras bu rdzogs zin pas phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nus pa yod pa'i dus na yang 'bras bu rdzogs zin pas phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: And even when the potential exists, the effect has already been completed, so there is no benefit.

original: rgyu des na skyed par byed pa nyid ni lhan cig pa nyid yin par 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyu des na skyed par byed pa nyid ni lhan cig pa nyid yin par 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory that the cause is the producer and it is simultaneous.

original: lag pa dang skyu ru ra gnyis bzhin yod pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin nam /
analyzed: lag pa dang skyu ru ra gnyis bzhin yod pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the two, the existent and the object held, like the hand and the myrobalan?

original: dus tha dad pa nyid la ni gzung ba'i dus su 'dzin pa med la /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid la ni gzung ba'i dus su 'dzin pa med la /
translated: But if they are different in time, the object held does not exist at the time of the apprehender,

original: 'dzin pa'i dus na yang gzung ba med pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa med pas dus tha dad pa ji ltar gzung zhe na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dus na yang gzung ba med pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa med pas dus tha dad pa ji ltar gzung zhe na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa ston pa'o //
translated: and the apprehender does not exist at the time of the object held. Therefore, since there is no apprehender, how can there be an object held? This is the presentation of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: rgyu nyid la gzung bar 'thad pa shes pas rig ste /
analyzed: rgyu nyid la gzung bar 'thad pa shes pas rig ste /
translated: The object held is understood to be tenable as the cause of consciousness.

original: rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas so //
analyzed: rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas so //
translated: Because it is known through the power of consciousness.

original: khyad par ji lta bu'i rgyu nyid la zhe na /üîΩ@88a * // shes pa la rnam pa ni snang ba la 'jog pa ni 'gong pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu'i rgyu nyid la zhe na / @88a * // shes pa la rnam pa ni snang ba la 'jog pa ni 'gong pa ste /
translated: What kind of cause is it?üîΩThe aspect appears to consciousness, and it is the cause of consciousness.

original: de la nus pa ste mthu yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la nus pa ste mthu yod pa'o //
translated: It has the power to produce consciousness.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: rang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu nyid la gzung ba yin par brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu nyid la gzung ba yin par brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The cause that is able to generate a consciousness that has its aspect is to be called the apprehended object.

original: skam pa dang lcags sbram gnyis bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: skam pa dang lcags sbram gnyis bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the object and consciousness are like a piece of wood and an iron ball, which are apprehended and apprehender.

original: skam pa la sogs pa dang lcags kyi sbram bu la sogs pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i bye brag kho na las yin no //
analyzed: skam pa la sogs pa dang lcags kyi sbram bu la sogs pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i bye brag kho na las yin no //
translated: The object and consciousness are like a piece of wood and an iron ball in that they are apprehended and apprehender only because of the difference of being cause and effect.

original: dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang sngon por snang ba mi skye la /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang sngon por snang ba mi skye la /
translated: Even though the sense faculty and so on exist, the appearance of blue does not arise.

original: yul sngon po yod na ni skye ba'i phyir rnam pa ni yul gyis byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul sngon po yod na ni skye ba'i phyir rnam pa ni yul gyis byas pa yin gyi /
translated: But when the object blue exists, it does arise. Therefore the aspect is produced by the object.

original: mig la sogs pas byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced by the eye and so on.

original: des na rnam par 'jog par nus pa ni yul nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par 'jog par nus pa ni yul nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the object is said to be the one that is able to be posited as the aspect.

original: tshig le'ur byas pas ma bzung ba'i don brjod pa'i phyir na bar skabs su sbyar ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pas ma bzung ba'i don brjod pa'i phyir na bar skabs su sbyar ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: In order to express the meaning that is not grasped by the metrical arrangement, there are verses inserted in the middle.

original: de'i phyir de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul bsgrubs shing gzhan gyis bkod pa'i skyon yang bsal nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul bsgrubs shing gzhan gyis bkod pa'i skyon yang bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having established the object of consciousness that is desired in this way and having also cleared away the faults that are set forth by others,

original: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i yul bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i yul bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to turn away from the object that is not desired, it is said:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di tshad ma snga ma'i yul 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di tshad ma snga ma'i yul 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This mental consciousness does not apprehend the object of a former valid knowledge.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: tshad ma zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzhan nyid yin par bshad kyi /
analyzed: tshad ma zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gzhan nyid yin par bshad kyi /
translated: Because the master DignƒÅga accepts valid knowledge, he also explains that the object of mental consciousness is different.

original: 'dir rang gi yid kyis brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi yid kyis brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not something that is imagined by his own mind.

original: tshad ma yin yang tshad ma snga ma'i yul can ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma yin yang tshad ma snga ma'i yul can ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is valid knowledge, why is it not the object of a former valid knowledge?

original: bshad pa / shes pa gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa'i yul gang la yod pa de'i dngos po ni nyid de /
analyzed: bshad pa / shes pa gzhan gyis ma rtogs pa'i yul gang la yod pa de'i dngos po ni nyid de /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: That which has an object not realized by another consciousness is itself an object.üîΩTherefore the object apprehended by a former valid knowledge is not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma snga mas gzung ba 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma snga mas gzung ba 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.

original: gzhan du na gal te de gzung ba 'dzin pa yin na ni de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩtshad ma ni 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su chad pa med pa ni ha cang thal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te de gzung ba 'dzin pa yin na ni de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro // tshad ma ni 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su chad pa med pa ni ha cang thal ba'o //
translated: If it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.

original: gang cung zad phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can gyi shes pa de thams cad tshad mar gyur pas dran pa'am cig shos dag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang cung zad phyin ci ma log pa'i yul can gyi shes pa de thams cad tshad mar gyur pas dran pa'am cig shos dag 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na ma rtogs pa'i yul can nyid yin no //üîΩgal te nges pa'i 'bras bu can @88b gyi tshad mas nges par byas pa'i yul 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na ma rtogs pa'i yul can nyid yin no // gal te nges pa'i 'bras bu can @88b gyi tshad mas nges par byas pa'i yul 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa yin la /
translated: If it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.

original: de ltar gyur pa yang tshad ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yang tshad ma yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid knowledge is limited.üîΩIf it were apprehended, then it would follow that it is untenable that valid

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas ma nges pa'i yul la 'jug pas na de ni rtogs zin pa'i yul can yin yang tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas ma nges pa'i yul la 'jug pas na de ni rtogs zin pa'i yul can yin yang tshad ma yin te /
translated: Mental consciousness engages objects that are not ascertained by eye consciousness, therefore, even though it has a previously cognized object, it is still a valid knowledge.

original: dran pas ha cang thal ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pas ha cang thal ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that there is the absurd consequence that memory is a valid knowledge.

original: bshad pa / gang la dran pa bskyed pa'i nus pa 'bras bu bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa mthong bas bskyed pa'i dran pa'i 'du byed ma nyams pa ma zhig pa yod pa de lta bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang la dran pa bskyed pa'i nus pa 'bras bu bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa mthong bas bskyed pa'i dran pa'i 'du byed ma nyams pa ma zhig pa yod pa de lta bur gyur pa ste /
translated: In response to this, Candrakirti says that memory is a valid knowledge only if the conditions for producing memory are not impaired or destroyed, and if the memory that is produced is in accordance with the result of the potential to produce memory that was created by seeing.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i gzung ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa de ni dran pa las khyad par med pa de'i phyir ha cang thal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i gzung ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa de ni dran pa las khyad par med pa de'i phyir ha cang thal ba yin no //
translated: Since the apprehension of an object that is such that it is not different from memory is memory, there is the absurd consequence that memory is a valid knowledge.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the idea.

original: gal te yang tshad ma thams cad nges pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nges pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyang gzung ba'i dngos po la nges bar skyed par byed pa yin na ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang tshad ma thams cad nges pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nges pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyang gzung ba'i dngos po la nges bar skyed par byed pa yin na ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: If all valid cognitions are the results of ascertainment, then even a non-conceptual valid cognition, which is not itself ascertained, is a valid cognition if it generates ascertainment with regard to the object that is its apprehended object.

original: gang gi phyir de dang de las ldog pa'i dngos po de nyid ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi nges pas yul du bya ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dang de las ldog pa'i dngos po de nyid ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi nges pas yul du bya ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Because the object that is the cause of the exclusion of that and that is the basis of the exclusion is the object of ascertainment, and not anything else.

original: de yang bdag nyid thams cad mngon sum gyis bzung nas rang gi mthus nges pa'i yul nyid du byas pa de srid du de tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid thams cad mngon sum gyis bzung nas rang gi mthus nges pa'i yul nyid du byas pa de srid du de tshad ma yin no //
translated: And as long as that is the object of ascertainment that is produced by the power of the perception that has apprehended it in all its aspects, it is a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir de ltar nges par byed par nus pa'i mngon sum ni nges pa skyes pa'i sngon rol du tshad ma nyid du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar nges par byed par nus pa'i mngon sum ni nges pa skyes pa'i sngon rol du tshad ma nyid du gnas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, perception that is able to generate ascertainment is a valid cognition prior to the generation of the ascertainment.

original: gzhan du na sngar tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur de lta yin na yang gang la nges par byed nus pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum skyes pa la ni don de'i yul can nyid kyi dbang po'i shes pa'am yid kyi
analyzed: gzhan du na sngar tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur de lta yin na yang gang la nges par byed nus pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum skyes pa la ni don de'i yul can nyid kyi dbang po'i shes pa'am yid kyi
translated: Otherwise, how could it become a valid cognition when it was not a valid cognition previously?

original: shes pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: shes pa yang rung ste /
translated: However, when a direct perception arises that apprehends an object that can be ascertained, it is the same as the sense consciousness or mental consciousness that has that object.

original: dran pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference from memory.

original: ji ltar nges pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum skyes pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum skyes pa na /
translated: Just as when a direct perception that possesses ascertainment arises,

original: nges pa nyid dran pa yin pa de bzhin nyid du gzhan dag tu yang yin te /
analyzed: nges pa nyid dran pa yin pa de bzhin nyid du gzhan dag tu yang yin te /
translated: it is ascertainment itself that is memory, so it is also in other cases.

original: 'on kyang nges pa'i yul la dran par tha snyad du byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa'i yul la dran par tha snyad du byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: However, it is merely a convention that is designated as memory in regard to the object of ascertainment.

original: nges pa ma skyes kyang nges par nus pas rtogs pa'i don 'dzin pa ni sngar med pa'i khyad par byed pa med pas na dran pa nyid yin te /üîΩmngon sum @89a * //
analyzed: nges pa ma skyes kyang nges par nus pas rtogs pa'i don 'dzin pa ni sngar med pa'i khyad par byed pa med pas na dran pa nyid yin te / mngon sum @89a * //
translated: Even when ascertainment has not arisen, the apprehension of an object that is understood through the ability to ascertain is memory itself, because it does not create a difference that did not exist previously.

original: gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i nges pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the ascertainment that is generated by the power of direct perception.

original: gtan tshigs tshigs pa las mngon sum gyi skad cig ma phyi ma rnams ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs tshigs pa las mngon sum gyi skad cig ma phyi ma rnams ni grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The reason is that the later moments of direct perception are not different from the established and the pleasant.

original: de ltar na yang yid ma bzung ba 'dzin pa yin yang dbang po las skyes pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma bzhin du rgyun gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don la tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang yid ma bzung ba 'dzin pa yin yang dbang po las skyes pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma bzhin du rgyun gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don la tshad ma yin la /
translated: Thus, even though the mind does not apprehend what has not been apprehended, it is a valid cognition in regard to the object to be established by the continuum, just like the later moments that arise from the sense faculty.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi ni skad cig ma'i khyad par bsgrub par 'dod pa la tshad ma ma yin par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi ni skad cig ma'i khyad par bsgrub par 'dod pa la tshad ma ma yin par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that it is not a valid cognition in regard to the yogi‚Äôs desire to establish a specific moment.

original: mthong ba'i 'du byed brjod pa la ni shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i 'du byed brjod pa la ni shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: In the case of the expression of the seen, whatever other cognition there is, that itself is a valid cognition.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig las nges par byed pa'i nus pa med pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig las nges par byed pa'i nus pa med pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: That which is not capable of ascertaining from some cause of error is not a valid cognition.

original: chur 'khrul pa'i dus ni smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i shes pa bzhin du nges pa med pas 'jug pa'i yul 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chur 'khrul pa'i dus ni smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i shes pa bzhin du nges pa med pas 'jug pa'i yul 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The time of delusion regarding water is not a basis for positing the object of engagement, because it is not ascertained, like the cognition apprehending the intrinsic characteristics of a mirage.

original: skyon gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: skyon gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To demonstrate other faults, it is said:

original: bya ba rdzogs pa'i las gang yin pa de la khyad par du bsgrub pa'i phyir khyad par byed pa de lta ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba rdzogs pa'i las gang yin pa de la khyad par du bsgrub pa'i phyir khyad par byed pa de lta ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is the action of completing is not the agent of distinction, because it is already established as a particular.

original: shing la rnam pa gnyis kyi dngos por grub kyang phyogs gzhan du rnam pa gnyis su gyur pa'i rgyu sta re ni sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pas na khyad par du byed pa ma yin pa zhes bye brag tu byas te /
analyzed: shing la rnam pa gnyis kyi dngos por grub kyang phyogs gzhan du rnam pa gnyis su gyur pa'i rgyu sta re ni sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pas na khyad par du byed pa ma yin pa zhes bye brag tu byas te /
translated: Even though the tree is established as a thing of two aspects, the axe is the instrument of the transformation into two aspects in another place, and is therefore distinguished as the agent of distinction.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de sgrub par byed pa yin ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de sgrub par byed pa yin ba'o //
translated: That which is like that is the instrument.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni don de lta bu yin no zhes ngag gi don 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni don de lta bu yin no zhes ngag gi don 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Is is the holding of the meaning of the statement the meaning is like that.

original: yang gi sgra ni nyes pa gzhan sogs pa ste zhes bya ba'i sgras gzung ba'i don 'das pa yin no zhes bya bas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nyes pa gzhan sogs pa ste zhes bya ba'i sgras gzung ba'i don 'das pa yin no zhes bya bas brjod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is for the purpose of including the phrase ‚Äúother faults.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshul ni lugs te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshul ni lugs te /
translated: The method of proof is the system.

original: gang gis de sgrub byed du 'gyur bar bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis de sgrub byed du 'gyur bar bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the means of proof that proves what is to be proven.

original: de las 'das pa ni rgal ba ste /
analyzed: de las 'das pa ni rgal ba ste /
translated: To go beyond that is to transgress.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsgrub par byed pa yin na ji ltar cung zad mi byed pa yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // sgrub par byed pa yin na ji ltar cung zad mi byed pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is to abandon.üîΩIf it is the means of proof, how can it not do anything at all?

original: cung zad mi byed na yang ji ltar sgrub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: cung zad mi byed na yang ji ltar sgrub par byed pa yin /
translated: And if it does not do anything at all, how can it be the means of proof?

original: de yang sgrub par byed pa yin na ni tshul las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sgrub par byed pa yin na ni tshul las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if it is the means of proof, it would transgress the system.

original: gang gi phyir gang gis sngar 'jug pa'i yul ston pa de nyid ni sgrub par byed pa yin la tshad ma'i sgra 'di yang sgrub par byed pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis sngar 'jug pa'i yul ston pa de nyid ni sgrub par byed pa yin la tshad ma'i sgra 'di yang sgrub par byed pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: Because that by which the object of engagement is shown previously is precisely the means of proof, and the word ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù also has the means of proof as its object.

original: des na de lta bu yin par ma smras pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de lta bu yin par ma smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, we do not say that it is like that.

original: de @89b ltar na ha cang thal ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de @89b ltar na ha cang thal ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because of the absurdity of the consequence and because the very thing that establishes is not tenable, the apprehension of the object is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu tshad mar brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma bzung ba'i yul can yin no zhes blta ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu tshad mar brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma bzung ba'i yul can yin no zhes blta ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is seen that whatever is called a valid cognition in some cases is not a subject that apprehends an object that is not already apprehended.

original: sngar gzung ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i tshad ma ni srid pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: sngar gzung ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i tshad ma ni srid pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also not possible for a valid cognition to apprehend an object that was previously apprehended, the treatise states:

original: de ni rim gyis 'byung ba 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rim gyis 'byung ba 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory for it to occur in sequence.

original: yang gi sgra ni gtan tshigs 'di'i phyir yang gzung ba 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes mi srid pa gtan tshigs kyi dngos po nyid du sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gtan tshigs 'di'i phyir yang gzung ba 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes mi srid pa gtan tshigs kyi dngos po nyid du sogs pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the root verse indicates that the apprehension of an object that was previously apprehended is not possible because of this reason. It is a reason that establishes the fact that it is not possible.

original: don gcig po de rgyur gyur pa gang la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: don gcig po de rgyur gyur pa gang la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who possess the cause of a single object are called ‚Äúhaving a single object.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gang gis skad cig gnyis par blo byed pa'i ngo bo de nyid skad cig ma snga ma na yang yod pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bsgrub par bya ba thams cad snga ma kho nar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gang gis skad cig gnyis par blo byed pa'i ngo bo de nyid skad cig ma snga ma na yang yod pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bsgrub par bya ba thams cad snga ma kho nar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the entity that is the nature of the cognition in the second moment exists in the first moment, and because the thing itself is the agent, then all of its effects would be produced in the first moment alone.

original: 'di snyam du lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do snyam pa bshad pa gzhan dag gis khyad par te bogs dbyung bar byar med pa sgrub tu med pa gang yin pa de ni ltos par mi 'thad do
analyzed: 'di snyam du lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do snyam pa bshad pa gzhan dag gis khyad par te bogs dbyung bar byar med pa sgrub tu med pa gang yin pa de ni ltos par mi 'thad do
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThere is no contradiction because the effect is produced sequentially in dependence on the assemblage of causes and conditions,‚Äù then the response to that is: That which cannot be improved upon, that is, that which cannot be enhanced by anything else, cannot depend on another.

original: // de'i phyir 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: // de'i phyir 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore there is a contradiction.

original: khyad par du byar med pa yang khyad par rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rang gi ngo bo yang sngar nyid du grub zin pa'i phyir ro 'di snyam du rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par ltos pa med pa kho na las 'bras bu rim dang ldan pa skye ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: khyad par du byar med pa yang khyad par rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rang gi ngo bo yang sngar nyid du grub zin pa'i phyir ro 'di snyam du rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par ltos pa med pa kho na las 'bras bu rim dang ldan pa skye ba yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the effect arises in a sequential order from the thing to be distinguished that is independent of the distinction,

original: bshad pa / ltos pa med na yang rim gyis skye bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / ltos pa med na yang rim gyis skye bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Even if it is independent, it is contradictory because it is untenable that it arises sequentially.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i bsgrub bya gcig la gtan tshigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba zhes bya ba'i bsgrub bya gcig la gtan tshigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Even‚Äù means that the reason and so on are the same with respect to the probandum, that is, ‚Äúcontradictory.‚Äù

original: ci ste yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyad par du bya ba nyid yin na de'i tshe tha dad pa nyid du thal ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyad par du bya ba nyid yin na de'i tshe tha dad pa nyid du thal ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid de /
translated: But if the thing to be distinguished exists in dependence on the distinction, then it follows that it is different.

original: de yin na ni gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yin na ni gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If it is that, then it is different.

original: gang gi phyir ltos byar gyur pa'i lhan cig byed pas rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i khyad par bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul dngos po'i snga ma las tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir skabs @90a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltos byar gyur pa'i lhan cig byed pas rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i khyad par bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul dngos po'i snga ma las tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir skabs @90a * //
translated: Because if the object of mental consciousness were established as a specific thing that is a different entity from the prior object, then it would be a different entity from the prior object.üîΩ

original: gyi don yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gcig pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gyi don yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gcig pa nyid nyams pa yin no //
translated: If the object of mental consciousness were to establish a difference that is its own nature, then the object of mental consciousness would be different from the prior object, and the point of the present discussion, that the object of mental consciousness is the same as the object of sense consciousness, would be undermined.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma nyid ma yin na rnam par shes pa snga mas gzung ba 'dzin par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma nyid ma yin na rnam par shes pa snga mas gzung ba 'dzin par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, if the object of mental consciousness were not momentary, then it would be the object of the prior moment of consciousness.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi don rnams ni skad cig ma nyid kyis med na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi don rnams ni skad cig ma nyid kyis med na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But the objects of sense consciousness are momentary, and if they do not exist, then the mental consciousness that is caused by the sense consciousness does not apprehend them.

original: med pa nyid kyang 'das pa'i phyir te /üîΩzhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang 'das pa'i phyir te / zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, they do not exist because they are past.üîΩThey are past because they have ceased.

original: 'das pa yang skad cig ma nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'das pa yang skad cig ma nyid kyis so //
translated: They are past because they are momentary.

original: de'i phyir de ltar med pas na dbang po'i shes pa'i yul skad cig ma ni dbang po'i shes pa'i 'bras bu yid kyi rnam par shes pas mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar med pas na dbang po'i shes pa'i yul skad cig ma ni dbang po'i shes pa'i 'bras bu yid kyi rnam par shes pas mi 'dzin la /
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist in that way, the momentary object of the sense consciousness is not apprehended by the mental consciousness, which is the result of the sense consciousness.üîΩAnd if it is not momentary, then the sequence is contradicted.

original: skad cig ma nyid ma yin na yang rim pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul las don gzhan nyid yid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ma yin na yang rim pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul las don gzhan nyid yid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Having thus established, he concludes: Therefore, the mental consciousness cognizes an object that is different from the object of the sense consciousness.

original: rkyen ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni rgyu'o //
translated: Condition means cause.

original: de nyid ni khyad par te khyad par du byas te zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni khyad par te khyad par du byas te zhes bya bas so //
translated: That itself is the distinction, as it is said to be distinguished.

original: des bskyed pas ni rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskyed pas ni rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: Generated by that means caused by that.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi don las ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi don las ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Because the mental consciousness that arises in sequence from the object of the sense consciousness does not arise from the object of the sense consciousness,

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa brjod pa'i rkyen gzhan las skye ba de'i phyir don gzhan rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa brjod pa'i rkyen gzhan las skye ba de'i phyir don gzhan rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: but rather arises from another condition that is the stated object, therefore it does not cognize a different object.

original: de bzhin du gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, if the mental consciousness does not depend on the eye,üîΩeven though it apprehends external objects, why is it determined to apprehend the form of that eye?

original: phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa yin yang de'i gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa ci'i phyir zhes dogs pa la rkyen gyi khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don 'dzin pa yin yang de'i gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa ci'i phyir zhes dogs pa la rkyen gyi khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is produced by a specific condition.‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang ci'i phyir gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa yin zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang ci'i phyir gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa yin zhes dris pa na /
translated: If the visual consciousness is determined to apprehend form, why is it asked?

original: rgyu'i khyad par nyid bstan par bya ba yin pa de ni 'di la yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par nyid bstan par bya ba yin pa de ni 'di la yang yod pa yin te /
translated: The specific cause itself should be shown. That exists here as well.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs 'dzin pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skyes pa de'i phyir gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs 'dzin pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skyes pa de'i phyir gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa yin no //
translated: Because it arises from the immediately preceding condition that apprehends form, therefore it is determined to apprehend form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i yid gang yin pa de ni gzugs 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i yid gang yin pa de ni gzugs 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: For that very reason, the mind that is not such a cause is not the apprehender of form. Thus it is established.

original: gnyis po 'di ni rkyen gyi khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni rkyen gyi khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the same as saying that they are produced by the specific conditions.

original: gal te 'o na dbang @90b bo'i rnam par shes pa dang de'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul las yid kyi mngon sum skye ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'o na dbang @90b bo'i rnam par shes pa dang de'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul las yid kyi mngon sum skye ba yin la /
translated: If the mental perceptual consciousness arises from the sense perceptual consciousness and its object,üîΩthen when the sense perceptual consciousness is present, the mental perceptual consciousness arises immediately after the first moment of the sense faculty.

original: rgyu nye ba'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa na yang dbang po'i skad cig ma dang po'i 'og tu yid kyi mngon sum skye ba yin no zhes kha cig 'dzer to //
analyzed: rgyu nye ba'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa na yang dbang po'i skad cig ma dang po'i 'og tu yid kyi mngon sum skye ba yin no zhes kha cig 'dzer to //
translated: Some say this, because the cause is present.

original: de la 'di skad ces mig gi dbang po'i yul gyi don la 'jug pa na skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de mig las byung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces mig gi dbang po'i yul gyi don la 'jug pa na skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de mig las byung ba ma yin na /
translated: In response to this, it should be asked: ‚ÄúWhen the object of the eye faculty is present, the perceptual consciousness that arises is not derived from the eye.

original: 'o na mig las byung ba gzhan ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na mig las byung ba gzhan ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: What else is derived from the eye?‚Äù

original: don de la rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i dbang po yang ci'i phyir rgyud gcig po de nyid kyis skad cig gcig la don de 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa kha cig gi ni skyed ba'i rgyu yin pa kha cig gi ni rgyu ma yin khyad
analyzed: don de la rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i dbang po yang ci'i phyir rgyud gcig po de nyid kyis skad cig gcig la don de 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa kha cig gi ni skyed ba'i rgyu yin pa kha cig gi ni rgyu ma yin khyad
translated: Why is it that the sense faculty that is suitable to generate consciousness of that object is the cause of the arising of some consciousnesses apprehending that object in just that single mindstream in a single moment, but is not the cause of the arising of others?

original: par med pas gnyi ga'i rgyu'am gzhan du khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par med pas gnyi ga'i rgyu'am gzhan du khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no difference, so it would either be the cause of both or there would be no difference.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi mngon sum ni mig gi bya ba med pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi mngon sum ni mig gi bya ba med pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore it is established that mental direct perception is not different from the absence of eye activity.

original: yid kyi mngon sum bshad nas /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum bshad nas /
translated: Having explained mental direct perception,

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum bshad par bzhed pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum bshad par bzhed pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: in order to explain reflexive awareness direct perception, he says, ‚Äúpleasure and so on.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag go //
translated: Whatever is pleasure and so on is pain and so forth.

original: rang bdag nyid 'dis rig par byed pa'i phyir rig pa ste /
analyzed: rang bdag nyid 'dis rig par byed pa'i phyir rig pa ste /
translated: It is awareness because it makes itself known.

original: rig par rung ba nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rig par rung ba nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is suitable to be aware.

original: de ni mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum yin no //
translated: That is direct perception.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes rims pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes rims pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
translated: The commentary explains this: ‚ÄúEven pleasure and so on are direct perception.‚Äù

original: kyang gi sgra ni sngar bshad par yang mngon sum yin la bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang zhig bdag nyid yang dag par rig par rung ba gang yin pa de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni sngar bshad par yang mngon sum yin la bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang zhig bdag nyid yang dag par rig par rung ba gang yin pa de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù indicates that pleasure and so on are also direct perception, just as the previously explained direct perception is.

original: bdag nyid ni gzhal bya yin la de yongs su gcod par rung ba'i 'dzin par byed pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni gzhal bya yin la de yongs su gcod par rung ba'i 'dzin par byed pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: The self is an object of knowledge, and the apprehension of it that is suitable to be ascertained is direct perception.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rang rig pa'i mngon sum ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rang rig pa'i mngon sum ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the mind and all mental factors direct perception that is reflexive awareness?

original: de ci'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa nyid nye bar blang zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa nyid nye bar blang zhe na /
translated: Why is it that pleasure and so on are taken as an example?

original: bshad pa / bde ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gsal ba'ang yin la nyams su myong ba'ang yin pa de bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / bde ba la sogs pa smos pa ni gsal ba'ang yin la nyams su myong ba'ang yin pa de bstan pa ste /
translated: Response: The mention of pleasure and so on indicates that it is a manifest object and also an experience.

original: bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi don gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa de nyid kyi don gang la yod pa'o //
translated: that which has the meaning of what is accomplished.

original: gang gi phyir rtsod pa med pa'i gsal bar nyams su myong ba bstan na @91a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsod pa med pa'i gsal bar nyams su myong ba bstan na @91a * //
translated: For, when the experience of the manifest is taught without dispute,

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs na gzhan la yang nyams su myong ba nyid du khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs na gzhan la yang nyams su myong ba nyid du khong du chud do //
translated: if one follows that, one will understand the experience of others as well.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang dag par rig pa ni gsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung yang bshad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang dag par rig pa ni gsal ba nyid do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung yang bshad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe correct knowledge of pleasure, etc. is manifest‚Äù should be seen as explaining the text of the master Dignaga in this way.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dir rab tu bstan pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dir rab tu bstan pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, why is it merely taught here?

original: 'di yul yongs su rdzogs par bzung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yul yongs su rdzogs par bzung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the object not taken as complete?

original: bshad pa gang gi phyir shes pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa gang gi phyir shes pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation is this: because that which is the nature of all consciousnesses is knowledge, it is perception.

original: yang de ji ltar mngon sum ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ji ltar mngon sum ma yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is that not perception?

original: bde ba la sogs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said: ‚Äúpleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid rig pa ste rig par rung ba'i rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa ste rnam par rtog pa ni sgra dang bsres nas 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid rig pa ste rig par rung ba'i rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa ste rnam par rtog pa ni sgra dang bsres nas 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Because the nature of pleasure, etc., is not suitable to be known, i.e., is not known, by conceptualization, i.e., by the apprehension that is mixed with words.

original: de srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de srid pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni dngos su yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa ni dngos su yin te /
translated: Thus, the nature of itself is apprehended directly,

original: bdag nyid ni bdag nyid rig pa'i lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni bdag nyid rig pa'i lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not hidden from itself.

original: bdag nyid rig par byed pa ni bdag nyid la ma 'khrul pa dang rtog pa med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig par byed pa ni bdag nyid la ma 'khrul pa dang rtog pa med pa yang yin no //
translated: The self is not mistaken with regard to itself, and it is also non-conceptual.

original: rtog pa med pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it non-conceptual?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang la brda nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de la rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang la brda nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de la rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is said: Because the nature of pleasure, etc., is not capable of being indicated, therefore it is non-conceptual with regard to that.

original: brda mi nus pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: brda mi nus pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not capable of being indicated?

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de dag gi bdag nyid gzhan la brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir brda nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de dag gi bdag nyid gzhan la brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir brda nus pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù means that since they are not dependent on another nature, they are not able to be a convention.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig rang rig pas gzung pa skad cig ma'i bdag nyid de dag ni thun mong ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig rang rig pas gzung pa skad cig ma'i bdag nyid de dag ni thun mong ma yin pa yin la /
translated: In this way, those moments that are apprehended by reflexive awareness are not shared.

original: sgra dgod pa yang yul du byas pa la brjod par gzo ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin na skad cig ma gcig pa ni rim pa dang ldan pa yul du byed pa dang / brjod par gzo ba dang / 'god pa rnams mi srid do //
analyzed: sgra dgod pa yang yul du byas pa la brjod par gzo ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin na skad cig ma gcig pa ni rim pa dang ldan pa yul du byed pa dang / brjod par gzo ba dang / 'god pa rnams mi srid do //
translated: Moreover, the positing of a word is preceded by the desire to express that which is taken as an object, but it is impossible for a single moment to be taken as an object, to be the desire to express, and to be the positing in a sequential manner.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa nyid du yul du byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa nyid du yul du byas te /
translated: Therefore, having taken as an object that which is not arisen,

original: brjod par gzo ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sgra bkod pa byas nas skyes pa na /
analyzed: brjod par gzo ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sgra bkod pa byas nas skyes pa na /
translated: having made the positing of a word preceded by the desire to express, when it arises,

original: sgra'i khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin grang na /
analyzed: sgra'i khyad par can du 'dzin pa yin grang na /
translated: it is the apprehension of a word that has a particular.

original: tshul 'di yang mi srid do //
analyzed: tshul 'di yang mi srid do //
translated: But this method is impossible.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa de nyid kyis bdag nyid la sgra bkod pa'am shes pa gzhan gyis yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa de nyid kyis bdag nyid la sgra bkod pa'am shes pa gzhan gyis yin /
translated: Because of that, is sound posited by that awareness itself or by another awareness?

original: rig pa nyid kyis yin na yang sgra 'god pa na skyes @91b pa'am ma skyes pa ma yin /
analyzed: rig pa nyid kyis yin na yang sgra 'god pa na skyes @91b pa'am ma skyes pa ma yin /
translated: Even if it is by awareness itself, when positing sound, it is not arisen or non-arisen.

original: re zhig ma skyes pa la bkod par mi nus te /
analyzed: re zhig ma skyes pa la bkod par mi nus te /
translated: First, it cannot be posited as non-arisen,

original: gang gi phyir ma skyes pa ni ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma skyes pa ni ma byung ba yin no //
translated: because that which is non-arisen is non-existent.

original: ma skyes kyang spyi yul du byed pa'i phyir so sor nges pa zhes khyad par brjod do //
analyzed: ma skyes kyang spyi yul du byed pa'i phyir so sor nges pa zhes khyad par brjod do //
translated: Even though it is non-arisen, because it is taken as an object, it is called ‚Äúdeterminate‚Äù as a distinction.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni yul du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni yul du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of pleasure, etc. is not taken as an object,

original: yul can rang rig pas so //
analyzed: yul can rang rig pas so //
translated: because the subject is reflexive awareness.

original: 'dir dngos po sgrub pa rig pa'i sgras ni rig par rung ba'i bdag nyid tshad mar gyur pa bzung gi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po sgrub pa rig pa'i sgras ni rig par rung ba'i bdag nyid tshad mar gyur pa bzung gi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúawareness‚Äù in the proof of the thing refers to a valid cognition that is a nature suitable to be aware, but not to a nature that is a result,

original: de la tshad ma byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshad ma byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition that acts on that.

original: ci'i phyir yul du mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yul du mi byed ce na /
translated: Why is it not taken as an object?

original: bshad pa bdag rig pa de ni bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa bdag rig pa de ni bde ba la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid de'i phyir ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: That self-awareness is the entity of the nature of pleasure and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rang rig pa 'di ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo yin pas de ma grub na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang rig pa 'di ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo yin pas de ma grub na /
translated: Because this self-awareness is the nature of pleasure and so on, if it is not established,

original: de yang ma grub pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa na yul dang yul can gnyi ga med pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gis yul du byed /
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa na yul dang yul can gnyi ga med pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gis yul du byed /
translated: then that also is not established. Therefore, when the nature of pleasure and so on is not arisen, because neither the object nor the subject exists, what is the object of what?

original: yul du ma byas na yang brjod pa gzo ba dang sgra bkod pa med do //
analyzed: yul du ma byas na yang brjod pa gzo ba dang sgra bkod pa med do //
translated: If it is not an object, then there is no expression and no arrangement of words.

original: des na ji ltar brda nges par sbyor ba ni sgra'i brjod byar 'dzin pa yin la yul du byed pa ni 'dzin pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: des na ji ltar brda nges par sbyor ba ni sgra'i brjod byar 'dzin pa yin la yul du byed pa ni 'dzin pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore how could the definite application of a sign be the apprehension of the object of a word? The object is merely the object of apprehension.

original: 'dzin pa'i khyad par yang 'dzin pa'i spyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i khyad par yang 'dzin pa'i spyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: The difference in apprehension is pervaded by the apprehension of the general characteristic.

original: des na gang zhig gang gis yul du ma byas pa des ni des sgra 'ga' zhig gi brjod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang gis yul du ma byas pa des ni des sgra 'ga' zhig gi brjod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which does not take something as an object does not express it in any way.

original: dper na ba lang gi shes pas rta bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi shes pas rta bzhin no //
translated: For example, the consciousness of a cow does not express a horse.

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa yang rang rig pas yul du byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid ma skyes pa yang rang rig pas yul du byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that which has the nature of being ascertained is not taken as an object by reflexive awareness. This is the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: 'di snyam du 'o na ni yul du byas pa'i phyir na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa la sgra 'god par 'gyur ro snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'o na ni yul du byas pa'i phyir na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid skyes pa la sgra 'god par 'gyur ro snyam na bshad pa /
translated: But if you think that because it takes something as an object, sound expresses the arising of the nature of pleasure and so on, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa'i bdag nyid yul du byas pa 'di dag la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa'i bdag nyid yul du byas pa 'di dag la /
translated: These that take as their object the arising of the nature of pleasure and so on

original: rig pa 'di rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa 'di rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: are the expressers of awareness.

original: smras par byed pa'i sgra dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: smras par byed pa'i sgra dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: They are connected to the sound that expresses.

original: 'god pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'god pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not positers.

original: bsam pa 'di yin te gal te skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rig pas yul du byas pa de lta na rjod par byed pa dang sbyar bar mi nus so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin te gal te skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rig pas yul du byas pa de lta na rjod par byed pa dang sbyar bar mi nus so zhes bya'o //
translated: The idea is this: if the nature of the pleasure of birth, etc., is taken as the object of awareness, then it cannot be connected with the expression.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /üîΩbdag nyid la de ltar @92a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa / bdag nyid la de ltar @92a * //
translated: The reason is stated:üîΩbecause it is not possible for it to be connected with the expression.

original: te rnam pa des 'jug pa ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: te rnam pa des 'jug pa ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means ‚Äúin that manner.‚Äù ‚ÄúEngagement‚Äù is connection.

original: rjod par byed pa dang sre ba'i rnam pa can gyi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang sre ba'i rnam pa can gyi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the activity of the form of the expression and the object.

original: de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir sgra sbyor bar byed pa las tha dad par gzung ba'i char gnas par snang ba la nus pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra sbyor bar byed pa las tha dad par gzung ba'i char gnas par snang ba la nus pa yin te /
translated: Because it is possible for the sound to be grasped as separate from the connection, it appears as a part that endures.
